review_body: Not too fancy, downstairs is the Nihonbashi Mitsukoshi store, very convenient for shopping. Impeccable service like any other MO. Bath products are made of BV, which is especially easy to use. Clean and tidy room, comfortable bed, very good view from the room. There are two restaurants for breakfast. One is self-help and the other is fixed food. Both restaurants are very nice. There are several Michelin restaurants in Tokyo, so you can eat well at the hotel. The Wenhua Bakery on the first floor is also very good. Cloud cake is said to be very popular. This is definitely my favourite hotel in Tokyo!

The hotel is actually on the top floors of an office building. The street level entrance is where you drop off the luggage and then go up to the upper floor lobby to check in. My room was 45m, big for Tokyo hotel standard, but average for a luxury hotel.On arrival I found an elaborate snack display in my room but seeing that it was all deep fried food I was in no mood to eat it.The hotel is near the Mitsukoshi department store and subway station. Otherwise, it's not really a convenient place to stay.Mandarin Oriental is always excellent but in Tokyo, I would prefer to stay somewhere else.

This is hands down the best hotel in Tokyo. Although it’s located at the top of what seems like an office, it still has a very good look from the outside. The room and service were superb. The check in went smoothly and we were escorted to the room which was a nice gesture. Outstanding management. Location is perfect and it's right above a metro station.

Spent 3 nights there with friends. Great hospitality amazing location stunning breakfast great Mt Fuji view. The pizza Bar experience was super entertaining thanks to Yuichi, but I knew him as Luigi. I wish everyone had the chance to meet this guy. A real star. And great pizza from Italian point of view. Will be back soon.

One of my favorite hotels I’ve stayed at! The service was wonderful and the hotel and location were perfect. The breakfast and restaurants were fantastic, we loved the hotel and didn’t want to leave. I highly recommend!

Mandarin has always been great, after visiting here, I even love MO more, thanks for all the great service , housing keep did a great job of our room, Concierge assist us for the restaurant, reception did a smooth job for checking, the last but not the least, I want to thanks to the cake shop team, Mr. Yuto Kaneyasu who has work for almost the entire day( We ask him to reserve the cloud cake in the morning and went to pick up the cake at night)but still has a great smile on him and excellent service! All the staff have done a great job! Thanks to MO gave me such a great vacation

This is a fantastic hotel and incredibly well located, a short distance from Tokyo Train Station and the Imperial Palace.The views from the gym, breakfast, the 37th floor bar and our room - which included a distant view of the top of Mount Fuji in the latter two cases - were amazing.Our room was spot on - a great size, with a superb bathroom - bath, shower and separate toilet. The TV was huge and there was a lovely chez long by the window from where one could recline and take in the spectacular views of the city.The gym was on the 38th floor, open 24 hours and full of modern equipment and well stocked with water and clean towels. There were also sis facilities available although sadly we did not have the time to enjoy them.Breakfast was epic - choice of a buffet, with egg options prepared to order or set menu. Both enjoyed on the 38th floor and therefore offering that great view.The staff were all superb - the concierge arranged a great teppinyaki dinner for us one night and the ground floor door staff were always on hand with a towel and water when I took an outdoor run.Complimentary bikes were also available from the hotel for use around the city.An incredible stay...
user_name:
NICHOLAS T
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: My wife and I spent four nights at the Mandarin Oriental while visiting Tokyo. It was everything you'd expect from a Mandarin. The room was spacious and well maintained with amazing views of the city below. Excellent spa facilities. What most stood out, however, was the quality of the service -- personal attention at every turn. The concierge was very helpful in arranging dinner and show reservations. I left my glasses in a taxi one evening and the bell captain managed to track down the taxi and get them back. The location in the Nihonbashi area is well suited for touring the city. The hotel is directly on top of Mitsukoshimae Station, which serves the Ginza and Hanzomon subway lines. You get the benefit of easy access to different parts of the city while staying in an area that is quieter and less frenetic than the Ginza or Shibuya. I recommend joining Fans of Mandarin Oriental. This entitled us to free breakfasts each morning at the sumptuous buffet. An excellent deal.

This was my third or fourth stay and the hotel really is excellent. Its location, standards and helpfulness are second to none. The location is splendid in several ways - views, transport facilities etc. I've used and been impressed with your Hong Kong, Barcelona and Tokyo hotels and will contiue to use the brand.

Always such a delight to stay at the MO Tokyo. Service is polite, elegant and always attentive. Rooms are beautiful and the bed so very very comfortable. I love the pillow menu and the wide selection of options. The views are fantastic!

I have been to more than 10 hotels in Tokyo and MO tokyo has been the best of all. The room always stays very clean and each detail including note paper is considerate. And MO has the best service team. Thanks to Concierge director Masumi San, for helping me reserve so many fine dining restaurants before my arrival. The check-in experience is good as well, thanks Erin Chen for her warm-welcoming attitude and GM Paul’s warm greetings. Besides, I have to thank Taikai San from Bell who noticed my worn-out luggage tag and gave me new one with cute-drawing card and who always warmly greeted me every time I walked out the hotel. Also, thanks Niko for his greetings at the breakfast and his thoughtful care at check-out. More importantly, of all my stays in Tokyo, including Aman, Hoshinoya, I think Mandarin staff are top ones that each of you speak very good English, and I was really impressed by that. I’ve been to Tokyo for too many times as a visitor but staying in MO makes me feel like home. Thanks for all of your effort and I’m looking forward to the next stay. Best wishes to everyone.

Beautiful fantastic property, I cannot day enough about it. Warm natural service. Stayed at peninsula after and was incredibly disappointed. Look no further! This is without doubt my new home in Tokyo!
user_name:
lovestoseetheworld1
New York City, New York

review_body: Just back from MO Tokyo. Beautiful property. Extraordinary staff. -Gorgeous & comfortable rooms.-View of Mt Fuji from our window.-Molecular Tapas Dinner: fun, unique and delicious. Family’s favorite meal in Japan.-The concierge staff- accommodating & expert. great recommendations. -Breakfast - extraordinary every morning -Overall level of service - staff never missed an opportunity to assist us or make us feel welcome.

Mandarin Oriental's staff really impressed me. We had a very memorable Tokyo trip because of the stay here. I really want to thank Ms. Erin Chen. The reservation made by her at the Tapas Molecular Bar made my first trip to Japan very very unique. She made us feel very special. Great great service!

Great choice in Tokyo. Excellent rooms, excellent restaurants, cool bars, nice SPA. A perfect stay from start to finish. The brazilian lady at the concierge desk was a truly connoisseur of Japan and gave us many tips for Tokyo and Kyoto. Would recommend. Stayed in April 2016
user_name:
Flavio R
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: This is a true 5 star hotel. The staff makes you feel welcomed. Everything was excellent. Could not really complain about anything. The food at the Signature restaurant was good. We stayed only 1 night.

The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is an unbelievably exceptional property. World class in every aspect -- property, services, staff, restaurants, bar and lounges. Every minute there we were made to feel special. Have been to Tokyo over 30 times in fabulous hotels and this was the best stay. Very special place.

This is a great hotel in Mandarin Oriental is a great company but it would be very very good if it had a pool. I love indoor pools although the view almost made up for it . I normally don't care a lot about the view but this view was amazing. You can see all of Tokyo's skyscrapers because the rooms are all up very high on the 30th -37th floor

First time here.- hotel is easy to access, via subway Ginza lineI really love everything here.The service is really great.The room I got upgraded; Mandarin room was huge. Luckily that i also could see Mount Fuji from the room.The bathroom was very nice. The bathtub was very big (like a spa).The room was clean, everything was well-maintained. Love the airplay that I could play youtube on the TV.I would like to admire female staff (sorry that i cannot remember her name) she helped me checking in and helping me to find the v.league ticket which I could not purchase. She is very kind and helpful.Another person was male staff; Eric. He showed me the room, explaining everything. I really impressed with his hospitality and service.Everyone at the French restaurant especially the female staff (sorry that I do not know her name again) she was in the service with my table. She is really great. Breakfast was good. I loved the special Egg. As a regular guest of Mandarin Oriental Bangkok, I have to say I also love MOTYO so much.

Food is amazing. Whatever you want they do. It well. Their dry cleaning is terrible. They refuse to clean basic thing, which is super strangeService is tops overall and the location is great. Also, the spa is awesome. They have the best massages and manicures in the world. The only issue they have are certain employees. The guys who work in the gym are super creepy and stare at female guests. If you tell them to leave you alone they still make you feel uncomfortable. They will continue to bother you. I have experienced this repeatedly. Also, they have newer employees who work in their downstaira bar that are just flat out racist. For example, they ask you your room number, you tell them then they ask if you will pay the bill and stand over you like wierdosI like staying here, but they need to deal with some of their newer employees. Very strange people

We liked the location, particulalry the fact that it is very easy to get to the tube station. We moved to a corner room after a few days to get two lots of view, the fact that we could see Mt Fuji from our room was unbelievable, we tried both the Japanese ( excellent) and Western breakfasts, until you see their eggs you have no idea what you are missing, they are golden. Gym is good, we also dined at the Chinese resaturant which was very good, also drank in the bar with friends a few times. Until we had been here, our favouritie hotel in the world was Four Seasons HKG, we now have a joint first.

It was another wonderful experience to stay for the third time in a few years, at the fantastic excellent Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo. Every time it is better, and i will absolutely stay there again in this hotel that it's very probably my favorite in the world. Thanks to all, especially to the "room service" staff... which was exceptional, wonderful...

Enhanced our overall Tokyo experience. Everything was top notch (room, amenities, hotel facilities, hospitality, restaurant & bar). Was worth every penny spent. Will definitely visit again next time we visit Tokyo.

Just finished 3 nights at mandarin oriental Tokyo. Absolute perfection. Small problem with room resolved immediately. Service at the highest level imaginable from restaurants to bar to room service to spa. Perfection. 10 out of 10! Highly recommended

While being 4 nights in Tokyo we spend them in this cool hotel. Rooms were clean comfortable and nice; breakfast (we preferred the Japanese though they serve also Western) was very good and rich; the facilities were comfortable and the service was very good coupled with smile and readiness to help.

The service at this hotel is amazing, with a super friendly and attentive staff. The beds were the most comfortable we experienced during our whole week in Japan. But the best part of our stay was the spa—with amazing views of the city from the sauna and soaking tubs. Major Wow.

The Mandarin Oriental is an upscale, comfortable hotel. From the moment you arrive at reception on the 38th floor with sweeping views of the city, to the beautiful touches in the rooms, to the thoughtfulness of the staff, to the quality of the spa and restaurants, we very much enjoyed our stay. We would absolutely go back.

We stayed as a family for three nights. The hotel is clean with nice views of the city. I found it very similar to the Ritz Carlton. As between the two, I think it’s mostly a question of which area you want to be in, but you should expect that the hotel is geared towards business travelers. The hotel bar does not let you sit in it after 5 with a child. The sushi restaurant is also closed to children. We haven’t taken children to the Ritz so it may have similar limitations for family travel. While the concierge was attentive we found them only so effective and generally did not care for their restaurant recommendations.

The high quality of service is definitely what makes MO Tokyo stand out among other luxury hotels in Tokyo. The staff here are always hospitable and charming, making you feel that this hotel is treating its guests like friends and families.Among many luxury hotels we stay in Japan, barely any of them can provide as perfect experiences as MO Tokyo does.

Wow. What can I say? The MO Tokyo is just perfect. We are just finishing a long vacation in Japan where we stayed at a number of other high end hotels but nothing even came close to the MO. We have stayed at many luxury places over the years but this is something special. From the moment you arrive to the moment you check out the staff cannot do enough for you - special mentions to Erin at the front desk who arranged an amazing table in the sky bar for us, the concierge who helped us get a short notice (few weeks in advance) reservation at the incredible Tapas Molecular Bar and the housekeeping team who kept our room absolutely immaculate throughout and left thoughtful touches like origami items day to day. The property itself is also beautiful with the most amazing views and the breakfast was the best we have had anywhere. Complete luxury - we will be back!

This was our first time to Japan & we began our trip in Tokyo staying at the M.O. This was a perfect choice, as the hotel was welcoming, luxurious, beautiful and an easy transition into a new country. Our only complaint was that the rooms were very dry and needed humidifiers big time. We felt dehydrated & dry no matter how much water we drank. Otherwise, M.O. gets 5 stars in every department: guest rooms, spa, restaurants, lobby ambience, etc. Wonderful service at every turn!

We booked in that hotel so that we could secure a seat at their Tapas Molecular restaurant for my birthday. I emailed the concierge to book at Tapas Moelcular, and also make additional bookings at high end restaurants in town (Jiro Roppongi and Sushi Yoshitake). They booked them, at the wrong dates. I emailed back. All bookings corrected and confirmed. Ok. We show up, and it turns out they have booked two restaurants on the same evening, They cannot arrange Tapas Molecular for another evening, but they suggest to try shabu shabu or tempura instead. Forget it. For a Mandarin Oriental, definitely a sub-par service, if we can call this "service".

This was our treat at the end of our Rugby World cup visit.Go just before sunset to get contrasting views. Food was delicious as were the cocktails, although it is a bit pricy. Staff were excellent and relaxing to listen to the pianist after dinner after so much walking was superb. Views in the men’s loos interesting too

You know why you will get with the Mandarin. Impeccable service, spacious rooms with well fitted out bathroom and super comfortable beds; a welcome change after five days of futons in a Ryokan. Italian restaurant on 38th floor was pretty good and reasonable value for money. The view of Mount Fuji from our breakfast table capped a short but very comfortable stay

Excellent Hotel. Great service although a bit pricy. Perfect location to subway and JR. great facilities and very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Very dinning and great good quality. Recommend for celebration

I have stayed in multiple MOs and many nice hotels around the world, but this is the best one. Great location, impeccable service, beautiful appointed rooms. Truly didn’t want to leave the room in the morning and basked in the luxury of coming back each day. Wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Tokyo.

best hotel and care and staff i ever had,clean hotel,great service,excellent care,i will never forget this amazing hotel and welcoming i got there,actually i love Mandarine Oriental hotels everywhere.

I heard so many great things about MO Tokyo before I actually stayed there in September. My experiences absolutely exceeded my expectations!! The room is super spacious for Japan standard ! Love all the eco-friendly bathroom amenities! Not the usual over-packaging Japanese fashion :-) Food and beverage quality is top notch ! Absolutely love the buffet breakfast as well as the Japanese set breakfast . The service all around the hotel came across naturally warm, friendly and attentive. The hotel team is clearly committed in taking good care of all the guests ! Can’t wait to go back to this hotel!

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights recently and were really happy with our stay. Right from the start the staff were very friendly and our room was so nice. The views from both our room and breakfast were fantastic. We were on the 32nd floor and we looked over most other buildings. This hotel has a great bar area and a couple of very nice restaurants. It is also very close to the underground subway and more food options downstairs. Well worth staying here if you’re in Tokyo.

This is a great property and, in my opinion, the best hotel in Tokyo (and I stayed in most of the top hotels in Tokyo). The rooms are nice and cozy, with a nice Japanese design. The reception area is beautiful and has amazing views. It might be expensive but... it is worth it. Highly recommended!
user_name:
Nuno N
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed during RWC. Room upgraded on check in. Staff anticipated almost every need. Tapas molecular bar one of the best meals we have ever had and fully deserving of its star. Breakfast and spa were also superb. Suited toward travellers who appreciate the difference between very good service and exceptional service. Subway station in the basement so getting around is very easy (and keeps you dry). Only concern was sound proofing of the rooms. One occasion room next door decided to play music very loudly at 6.30am, this was however sorted by the hotel manager fairly swiftly.

On our second day, we returned to our room to find all our toiletries arranged in neat rows, on top of beautifully made linen napkins. We were to come across such attention to detail throughout our week-long stay there, from the room department to the staff who greet you on arrival. We had done little preparation for this trip and relied on the concierge to recommend and organise restaurants for our dinners in the week, agreeing on criteria. The concierge team secured bookings at short notice at some great restaurants and except perhaps for one, all the meals were very enjoyable and the food exemplary. The concierge team have a very good system of keeping track of customer requests, and there was never any gap in communication. Fantastic.The hotel is well located next door to Mitsukoshi and close to Kyobashi and Ginza. A great base from which to explore Tokyo. The hotel can be proud of its team. We are now fans.

Superb 2 day stay at the start of our trip to Tokyo. As expected, the hotel was very luxurious. The room were beautiful and very comfortable. Staff were excellent. The food and beverage manager spoke to all guests at breakfast and knew all guests. Breakfast was wonderful and the bar was very glamorous. I would highly recommend.

I stayed at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo Hotel for 2 nights with my husband. It was actually our 3rd time stay at this hotel and every time we stay, it amazes us. When we checked in, all the receptionists are so friendly yet polite. Madaoka san (the receptionist) took us to the room and we enjoyed talking with her. After that we didn't get to see her until the day we checked out but she saw us at the reception when we were checking out and talked to us again. It was very nice of her. Okazaki San was also nice and welcoming us upon check in and we just felt like we came back to our home in Tokyo!The room was clean (as always) and it was really spotless. I cannot imagine all the effort and the care they put to make sure the room to be always clean. One morning, I was in a hurry and had to leave the room with my cosmetics all over the place but when I came back to the room, cleaning was done and my cosmetics were neatly put besides the sink. Other hotels do that too but I think the "Mandarin way" is the best. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast in the morning. We didn't ask for anything but they gave us a small fruits platter with "welcome to Tokyo" message written on it with chocolate. We have never experienced that at other hotels we stayed. :) We cannot wait to go back to stay at Mandarin again. I would also like to thank to Niko, who recognised us from our last visit and made sure we were comfortable throughout the stay. Thank you!

WE had a great experience at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. We really enjoyed Mandarin Bar and Sense, which are both highly recommended! Our favorite hotel in Tokyo and can't wait to be back soon again - a must try!

There are no words with which to adequately convey just how wonderful our stay here was. At every moment, there was always someone to assist us with unparalleled service and kindness. We indulged in 3 glorious days as we acclimated our initial stay in Tokyo. The views, the service and the sheer beauty of this hotel surpassed any and all expectations. We wish to thank EVERYONE for creating this most treasured Tokyo memory.

Excellent place to stay, best walking location, close to super fine shops, very easy to move around by taxi and metro, good quality of room, stay. Just a place to be and stay. We celebrated our 18 years wedding anniversary and even the hotel prepared a special small present. Very nice and Thank You MO

Recently we stayed at the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo for 2 nights. On arrival, we were automatically blown away by the reception which is on the 38th floor. The views over Tokyo are seriously incredible! On top of that, the recpetion area is stylish and has a great ambience. Our room was to die for! We had a large King size bed which even came with a pillow menu. We had a spacious bathroom with a separate bath and shower as well as a dressing area. The furnishings are simple yet very elegant. Within the Hotel itself you have a fitness centre (with the most incredible views) and a Spa. There is a male and female onsen area. Not all guests have access throughout the day but there is a certain time at the beginning of the day where access is provided to all guests. Be sure to check the area out as its very special! Literally right downstairs from the hotel is the metro line which can have you in Ginza within 5 - 10 minutes. There are also a number of great restaurants and shops within walking distance from the hotel. Our stay at Mandarin Oriental was incredible. Everything from the food to the helpfulness of the staff and the amenities within the hotel! We will definitely be staying here again one day.

I still can't find words to describe my feelings after staying at this hotel, probably the most superior experience in my whole life, in one word - amazing! The hotel is beautiful but the most amazing was the service, every little detail just incredible... was such a pleasure to come to breakfast every morning... The most helpful stuff at the reception... cleaning ladies as well. Special thanks to the reception stuff that helped me to get an incredible cloud cake from the downstairs bakery! We were so happy that we chosen this hotel among such a hard competition. I can't wait to be back!

Mandarin Oriental Tokyo has been our second home away from Hong Kong. This stay was as excellent as ever. Guest relations team warmly attended to our personal needs while the F&B team served us with excellence and friendliness. MO Tokyo is a gem of true hospitality in the city.

The MO in Tokyo fires on all cylinders. It's nice to visit a hotel where every aspect of your stay feels effortless and top notch. Although hotels in Tokyo are almost universally expensive, you get what you pay for at the MO. The service is excellent and the hotel has a great welcoming ambiance that's a bit of a calm reprieve from the hustle and bustle of surrounding Tokyo. The stellar views from the hotel (in the top floors of an office building around the financial district) and its rooms look out over the city and are especially impressive at night. The bar is particularly good and draws a diverse upscale crowd that gives it a decent amount of energy, even on weekday nights.
user_name:
AtlasArch
New York City, New York

review_body: Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo is an exceptional hotel. The location is in the center of the City. The Hotel is actually on the top floors from 30 to 38 of an office building. The views are spectacular. The service is unparalleled. Ask for a corner room for a panoramic view of Tokyo.

There is so much choice when looking for a luxury property in Tokyo. After reading endless reviews on TA and cross referencing with other sources i decided to book the MO for the first part of our stay in Japan. It of course did not disappoint , just read all of the other reviews, no need for me to repeat the same things. What is worth mentioning is how good the local area to the hotel is. There is one of Japans oldest department stores next door with a load of other interesting shops along the road. Best of all is if you walk over the road and a bit to the right you will discover multiple back streets with many restaurants , we tried a Teppanyaki one and was really good. Great local tea and pastry rooms nearby too. With the metro being right under the hotel you can not go wrong staying here.

Quite a unique hotel in that the reception was on the top floor and the room floors were below it. So that meant you got a good view of the city being so high up.Service was exceptional as one would expect and the quality and selection of food was impressive.We stayed in a Grand Room which was very clean, spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable.Location was good and close to many department stores and other restaurants.Its not cheap but if you want to splash out then this is one of the hotels to stay at.

I had stayed a night for leisure occasion. Location is perfect close to shopping complex and metro station. Ambiance for hotel is truly luxury. Cleanliness of room is perfect. Since joining fans of M.O. which is free to join as a guest recognition program made us different for this visit. Exclusive unique welcome amenity and streaming WiFi. Amenity in the room was exclusive. I really liked the Bottega Veneta selection which I cannot get any other luxury hotels in japan. F&B staffs also anticipated my needs whenever dined in any outlets. Really attention to details and high standards consistently delivering. Housekeeping staffs also greeted all the time whenever passed by. Besides entrance ground floor MO shop also very attractive. Selection for items and goods are really interesting. At last thank you so much for warm welcome by Mr. Kaseda and Mr. Niko. Again upon departure farewell by Mr. Kaseda. Looking forward coming back again to stay mandarin oriental Tokyo near future soon.

Made an advance reservation for Sunday afternoon English Tea. Beautiful setting on the 38th floor and all of the chairs were positioned to face the stunning view of Tokyo. Started out with a glass of champagne. Service was impeccable. The tea cakes and sandwiches were sublime. You can make an alteration to the cakes/sandwiches if you opt to via the menu. I was hoping it would never end!

We stayed in a Mandarin Grand room for several nights and everything was pretty much flawless. I do some business with another Mandarin property, so am familiar with how great they are, but the Tokyo one exceeded even my high expectations. The decor is so elegant throughout the hotel, in the rooms, common areas, and restaurants, and the little touches make all the difference (the hotel has real living bonsai all over the place- I mentioned I love plants in an email and there was a beautiful orchid and a bonsai in our room upon arrival). Also, I know Nihombashi isn’t necessarily a “classic” area for tourists to stay, but between the metro in the basement of the building and the large number of connections, we found that getting around Tokyo’s major neighborhoods was much easier than expected. Would definitely stay in this area and at the Mandarin again!
user_name:
Sunfl0werSky
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Best hotel we have ever stayed in. The staff and management were above and beyond-- from the moment of our reservation, to assisting us in advance over email with train reservations, dinner, and sightseeing plans, to the genuine kindness and personal concern they showed during our stay. This hotel is expensive but it is worth every penny. It is not stuffy or snobby in any way, but truly welcoming. The views of Tokyo are spectacular, the design of all the spaces is stunning, and I will never forget the feeling of the bed in the room-- I've never experienced such a comfortable bed! It was truly like sleeping in a cloud. The food was excellent and we very much enjoyed the breakfast and in-room dining as well as the lounge (didn't have time to try the restaurants but they looked phenomenal). Thinking back to our multi-week trip in Asia, this hotel stands out as one of the most special experiences, and I dream of returning as soon as we can!
user_name:
lioras2019
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff service is perfect. House keeper , In room Dining team are very polite and full of hospitality.Check out is very smooth. Staff arranged a taxi promptly when I chaecked out.The night light under the night table could not be turned off so that I could not sleep well.

I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo for 1 week, from August 4th-August 12. This is by far, the best hotel I have ever stayed at. I travel a lot, all over the world and have been to Tokyo many times before, nothing beats the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo. The staff was extremely helpful, knowledgeable and kind. They all went way above the norm in helping us out in every possible way especially Niko Penttinen. The cleanliness of our room was impeccable and I’ve been called “a clean freak.”I can’t wait to return, staying there was a pure delight! Yuta, shihori and Hilda were wonderful as well. Thank you all for a very memorable stay!

We are big fan of the restaurant in the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. We decided to stay in the Hotel and have dinner at SENSE Chinese Restaurant. Our decision was correct. We really enjoyed the stay and the dinner. Every staff in every section was very friendly. Service was splendid. This hotel is the best hotel in Tokyo at least for us. We would like to thank the Manager and all hotel staffs.

What a beautiful hotel!!The customer service was great and they did a great job... everyone had a smile on their faces.Thank you for everything.I will be back for sure.oh the food was amazing!!!The room was very clean so mucho appreciate it

We just had the pleasure of staying at MO — Tokyo for 5 days. It was amazing. The hotel was beautiful with gorgeous views. The service was unlike any hotel we have been to. From the bellman to the concierge to the staff in the restaurants and housekeeping. Special shout out to Maria Yano & Robin Colleau they both enhanced our stay. They made us feel special and went out of their way to ensure that our first trip to Tokyo was amazing. They succeeded. Our room was a stunning corner suite with lovely views. The amenities in the room were second to none, modern and exceptionally clean. The bathroom was gorgeous. In room dining was next level band the attention to detail incredible no request was too small. We will be back! Thank you!

A wonderful hotel. A Fantastic team from the minute you book. How am I supposed to use another hotel now? .. I'm ruined for life!.And as for the cocktails and creme brulee... Whilst looking at view over Tokyo... Divine!

My husband and I LOVED this hotel. We agreed it was hands-down the best hotel in a city we'd ever stayed in. The service was excellent, the rooms were large and comfortable (definitely the comfiest bed we had in Japan!), the bathroom was like being in a spa, and the location is excellent. And of course, the views from the room were stunning. We had breakfast included and it was very good. The concierge was very helpful both before and during our stay, helping to secure us reservations at Jiro for our anniversary, and booking shinkansen tickets to Kyoto for us. We would absolutely stay here again.
user_name:
ghostie2
New York City, New York

review_body: Was a fabulous place to base ourselves whilst exploring Tokyo. Negotiate the spa into the package because it’s worth it to go but costs a lot if you pay for daily use. Breakfasts were awesome. Worth the extra and whilst having Japanese’s options had plenty of what I’d call international cuisine too ( eggs benedict, cereals, fruit and yoghurts etc-) all good when travelling with children who don’t particularly like eel sashimi and miso soup for breakfast!The view from the rooms was absolutely incredible.

It is probably the best hotel I have ever been in my life! (and trust me I travel a lot) from the service of the staff to the amazing rooms and restaurants, this is with out a doubt the hotel to stay in if you go to Tokyo. Its pricey but so so worth it. Please dont miss the food experience at the molecular tapas bar they offer in one of their restaurants, you wont forget this never

It was an amazing stay to celebrate my husband’s birthday. Everything from room to service, food to amenities was top notch! Thanks for the little birthday surprise, and the concierge team in sorting out our restaurant reservation such last minute. Thank you so much MO tokyo In making our stay so memorable.

The mandarin oriental experience in Tokyo was just phenomenal. I’ve not had this great of a service for a long time. Every little detail is attended to. Robin made sure all of our needs were met and got us space in their great restaurants even though already at capacity (e.g., Tapas Molecular Bar).Room: I particularly enjoyed the video of the new Tokyo tower, the mochis every day, the amazing bathroom (and toto toilet), the sleeping robe, and the essential oil.Hotel: I loved the central location and choice of world class restaurants. Everything from the massage to the concierge were just well organized and enjoyable. All facilities are well up-kept.

Luxurious room with fantastic service. We stayed here for part of our wedding anniversary and had a wonderful time. The rooms are large with great views of Tokyo, understated but luxurious, and the bathrooms are just amazing. Well-kitted out too, with Bottega toiletries. They also use a lovely essential oil in the room which was blended especially for the hotel. It has a very distinctive but relaxing scent. We got the restaurant bookings we asked for, although my one negative comment would be that the team was probably not very well organised and would forget our requests until we reminded them. We did one dinner at Tapas Molecular Bar which was very special - only 8 seats per night. Coupled with the view and the “show” from the chef (who hails from HK!) and his team, it was very memorable.

The Mandarin in Tokyo is considered one of the top hotels in the city and in many respects it deserves the accolades. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, the main lobby is on the 38th floor and the rooms are in the floors below (which always caused me some confusion but that's on me not the hotel). The room was beautiful and finely finished with full height windows with an amazing view of the Tokyo Skytree. The furnishings were up to par and the bed was sumptuous. The dining options in this hotel are top shelf with not one but two Michelin starred restaurants. We ate in the french restaurant and it was fabulous. The other Michelin is a Chinese restaurant that we didn't try. They also have an Italian restaurant that is excellent. We had dinner there and it was amazing. The breakfast brunch is also served in that venue and it was a smallish but very high quality buffet with some excellent items that where made to order (try the Ritz pancakes -- incredible). We also tried the spa and it was excellent with a therapeutic pool that overlooked the city -- amazing. A truly first class spa I should add. My first knock and the reason for the four stars was the concierge -- frankly I didn't think they were all that. They were nice and helpful but not quite the level of concierge that I'm used to from a Mandarin or other equivalent hotel. Maybe it was a language or cultural issue but they didn't seem to go out of their way unlike the other concierges that I had later in my trip through Asia. My second knock is that they seem to allow smoking in the bar which is on the floor right below the main lobby. The smoke wafts up from the bar and taints the whole lobby. One of the reasons I love the Mandarin in Vegas is that it's the only hotel that doesn't allow any smoking. I would note that the bar itself is beautiful and the bartender (I think his name was Add) was a true mixologist. See photo!! All in all, though, I would recommend staying here. You really can't get much better (if at all), the hotel is clean, modern, luxurious and with all the amenities you would expect from a Mandarin.
user_name:
RubenO942
New York City, New York

review_body: It’s always nice to return to the mandarin oriental tokyo. Great rooms all with amazing views of Tokyo. Bathrooms are a good size with luxury productsRoom service menu is great - excellent quality of local food if you don’t want to eat out. Hotel also has great restaurants in house Last point - concierge service is one of the best in Tokyo. Helped get me into most key sushi counters and other restaurants in Tokyo with enough notice.

The Mandarin is always a treat. With breathtaking views to the best food and service you can find in Tokyo. These are by far my favorite rooms in Tokyo. If you have a chance try the tapas restaurant. It is one of the best places in the world the menu was original food was delicious and staff entertaining and extremely knowledgeable. The staff is very attentive throughout the hotel and they all know how to treat their guests with the great care you would expect from the best hotel brand. This is my favorite hotel in Tokyo and top 5 in the world. There is no other view like the view from these rooms. You can see all the way to mt Fuji on a clear day. Room amenities include large luxurious beds as well as fine bottega Veneta soaps. This is the only other place in the world I would consider moving too. Truly best of the best in all categories.

My girlfriend and I have stayed twice at the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo. Each time we were struck by the beautiful and pristine rooms, the excellent restaurants and spa, and (most importantly) the incredibly thoughtful staff. The spa is perhaps the best I have ever visited, with amazing views and skilled therapists. I greatly enjoyed dining at Sense and Sushi Shin, along with having breakfast in the hotel's charming lounge. At each, the service and food were impeccable. But what stood out to me most was the care and intelligence of the staff, particularly with small details that would be easy to overlook. Here's one example: I asked the hotel for help mailing to the US an unwieldy gift I had bought which didn't fit into my suitcase. I filled out a form for the package with the mailing address, item value, etc., and the package promptly arrived the day I got back. It sounds simple, and they made it simple. But when the package arrived, I noticed I had actually made an error filling out the form, but they had carefully read my entries on the form, noticed the mistake, and fixed it. Also, the actual box they shipped the gift in was unconventionally shaped, suggesting to me that either they have a vast assortment of packaging on site, just on the off chance someone needs it, or that they went out to acquire a specialized package. Either way, the experience showed that the hotel took great care to make sure the package delivery went smoothly. That's just one example; moments like this happened constantly. For instance, we noted to a staff member that we particularly appreciated something we'd tried at the hotel, and later found a gift of this item in our room. The concierge's recommendations were always great. And housekeeping was extremely thoughtful: they noticed we preferred to have no throw pillows or decorative items on the bed, as we had removed them and set them on the couch, so instead of replacing them on the bed daily, they set them aside unobtrusively in the closet. The care and attention left us delighted and touched. We are very much looking forward to our return.
user_name:
jtm852
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for the first week of our honeymoon in Japan. It has been amazing. The attention to detail is wonderful. At all times the hotel went to their best efforts to make our honeymoon as special as possible. The staff, Robin, Erin, made us feel welcome and were so kind. Everyone is so friendly.The room was fantastic with amazing panoramic views over the Tokyo landscape. The hotel is always so clean and tidy and everyone is always trying to do what they can to make your stay even better.The restaurants are a real highlight- the best in any hotel I’ve stayed in. We tried most of them and were never disappointed! Signature, Sense, visiting chefs, the pizza bar- all incredible! The Tapas Molecular Bar in particular was a highlight- a dining experience like no other.Overall this is one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had. We would race to come back again and feel very sad leaving it behind! Thank you very much Mandarin Oriental, it was superb!

This is an award winning amazing hotel. I truly enjoyed my stay and the way we were taken care. All of the restaurants have fabulous service and menus. Breakfast service was the least joyful one as it was always packed and you can feel the staff is not coupling up with turning the table covers timely.The service we had in the at the Chinese restaurant was the best. Our service assistant Mi-Yu was a great recommender and assisted so politely. Great asset to the hotel. Next visit to Tokyo , I cant even think of staying anywhere else. Thanks ,

Mandarin Oriental is always ranked as the best hotel chain in the world, this one really lives up to its reputation. Staff are amiable and helpful, always be able to anticipate our needs. They give us a home-away-from-home feel. The hotel is located in the posh area in Tokyo, right above the Mitsukoshi Mae sta. which is serviced by the two most important train lines. Getting around is very easy. The room has a great view of Tokyo. For shopping, the Mitsukoshi original store is just next door. There are some nice shops in the Coredo Mall across the street. There are many nice restaurants in the neighbourhood, and Ginza is just 2 stops away. This is definitely my hotel of choice in Tokyo!

we stayed for 1night for celebrate my partner's birthday.we had amazing times.The breakfast in K'shiki was so good We are so satisfied with that hotelThank you for the kindness of the staff I wanna be coming again

Good location, excellent service. The only thing missing in this hotel is a swimming pool.View from room is good but nothing special. Breakfast is exact the same everyday. Would be nice to have some variation between each day.

The hotel is amazing and the staff certainly treat you like royalty with care. There was only a few things we were surprised about considering price. - no iron in room so you are forced to pay for services- no pool or complimentary use of steam and sauna- people are allowed to smoke inside which left a strong smell in the bar and lobby. The hotel is stunning and quite close to Tokyo station which makes it easy for travel. The food is amazing

Had a couple of fantastic days at the Mandarin. It's conveniently located right above the Mitsukoshi-Mae JR rail station so we took trains from Narita directly here. The location also made it easy to explore Ginza and access other parts of the city quickly. Staff is exceptional and made check-in a breeze. Rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable. They walked us through all of the features of the room which was nice.Breakfast was great but expectedly expensive. Amazing views. Spa is available to hotel guests for free prior to 9am. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks MO for a great stay!

Robin, Lorena and chef David were amazing. They took time to greet us every day and assure we had all of our needs met. What an incredible team you have!! Robin, I know you will be in charge of all the Mandarin hotels world wide some day. If not, it is their loss. Lorena, you will be able to do whatever you want in the service industry. Your smile, your kind words and attention to detail are amazing. And chef, I looked forward to seeing you each morning. You would remember me by name and even sent me on the bullet train with a surprise. Each little thing added up to a marvelous stay. I won't look for any other hotel when I return to Japan. Mark and I agree, this was the best vacation ever. Thanks to all of you!! I wouldn't recommend trying anywhere else to stay. You will probably be disappointed!!

If there were such a thing as a sixth star this hotel deserves one. Every detail is excellently attended to. The breakfast is incredible with the highest quality foods, so is room service. I was traveling with two jet lagged children and the hotel managed all of my curveballs with grace. They went out of their way to make the children feel welcome, while graciously also preserving many adults only parts of the hotel. We splurged at the Signature restaurant and they served the children Wagyu beef on the children’s menu!The level of detail to which this property executes is a marvel. My only criticism is that what you get at an MO in Tokyo or Hong Kong or Bangkok is not what you get (got) in Las Vegas or Macau. Some of the newer MO properties have not had the level of expertise demonstrated at their prime properties like Tokyo.Congrats MO Tokyo, you’re in my top 3 with only your sister properties competing.

It is rare to find a hotel where you can find NO fault with...this one has it all and puts in the extra effort in everything they do. We were treated like royalty and our every need was met quickly and with a smile! The breakfast, dinner and drinks we enjoyed there were magnificent as well. I would highly recommend staying here. Hands down!

We just returned home from the MO in Tokyo last night. What an amazing experience!My husband and I stayed a short 6 nights at this property. We actually were meant to stay 4 nights, but decided to extend our stay after experiencing the exceptional service provided by everyone at this hotel (particularly Mr Robin Colleau - Restaurant Guest Relations Manager - and Chef Davide Di Dio - Chef de Cuisine at K'shiki Restaurant). The rooms are spectacular (and huge!), the food exceptional, the Spa magnificent. But what sets it apart is the outstanding service. The quality of their customer service is beyond anything we've ever experienced at ANY hotel, and we've travelled a bit. This was our first stay at a Mandarin Oriental. But it certainly won't be the last. It is expensive, but so worth it. Don't take my word for it, go and experience it for yourself. You can thank me later!

The hotel has an amazing location close to all the shopping and touristy things, the views are amazing as well from the lobby and the rooms. The staff took great care of us as it was our first time in Japan they helped us find a perfect English speaking guide who showed us way more than we could ever do on our own. The hospitality of the hotel is amazing the bar is also great, really enjoyed this property the only thing which we felt could have been better were the rooms slightly dated but still will visit here again definitely.

We were on a family trip to Tokyo and found the MO to be a very comfortable hotel in a great central location. We had breakfast included with our room and we looked forward to it every day. The room service supervisor Mr Terui went above and beyond in taking care of us. Concierge did a great job getting us into the Ninja restaurant last minute. The only downside of this hotel was the smell of smoke in the lobby. most spectacular gym i’ve encountered in my travels.

A great hotel.. Great team.. From checking in to check out.. Amazing food options. Don't miss the Tapas bar. Great spa.. All rooms refurbished to perfection.. More important is the great team. Super active concierge.

Our stay of 2 nights at the MO Tokyo was just exquisite. The staff was very helpful in many ways. Plus we were upgraded in a suite... and many attentions for my birthday make that stay memorable. The view is incredible from the bar, restaurant and the rooms.

We had an exceptional experience at this property. The bell staff, front desk, concierge and housekeeping were excellent -- impeccable service. Their efforts helped to make our stay comfortable and memorable.We had a pristine room with an amazing view of the Skytree Tower. The room amenities were all top-notch. Turndown was wonderful. The Nespresso machine and selection of teas were welcome. We had breakfast at K'shiki, which was an excellent buffet -- highly recommend it. All of the restaurants were gorgeous. The location was ok, but we ended up taking a cab from Tokyo station because of our luggage. It would have been a long walk with our bags. Overall, we look forward to staying again.

This is the second time we've been at Tokyo and while we thought about trying some other hotels this time, we couldn't resist as the MO Tokyo is really a treat. The K'shiki breakfast also is top tier in our book. Can't recommend enough.

Beautiful hotel, with very large rooms and exceptional staff. the staff is very knowledgeable and helped us plan our visit to Tokyo’s main sites. The rooms are a lot larger than we expected and stunning to say the least (with an insane view of the Tokyo sky tree) Would definitely recommended staying here.

I had the best week stay at the Mandarin Hotel in Tokyo! Everything was perfect from a-z. I loved the room overlooking the city skyline. The service for a large hotel was impeccable. The staff are Uber professional and will do absolutely everything to please their guests! Well done. It was a fabulous stay!

My spouse and I really enjoyed this hotel. It’s beautiful, the service is great, and the food is to die for! But, there was a very big down side...The hotel lobby stinks of cigarette smoke. I literally had to cover my face to walk across the lobby. This is a thick, and heavy smoke that permeates throughout the main levels of the hotel. To make matters worse, they mix in the signature Hotel scent, which makes for a nauseating smell. I understand that smoking is popular in Asian countries, but this level of indoor air pollution was pure torture. Other than that, we really enjoyed the hotel.

My husband & I were fortunate enough to have experienced the wonderful hospitality, beautiful rooms, efficient staff, delicious breakfast and pizza restaurant experience during our recent visit. We were so pleased with the efficient & pleasant service we received from the staff including our request to have the hotel transfer our large suitcases to our destination in Kyoto. Everything was efficiently handled and our bags were waiting for us at our Kyoto destination. The breakfasts were delicious with a large variety of cuisines both Western & Eastern. Many of the tables had wonderful views and the service was superb. We would definitely choose this hotel or other Mandarin Chain hotels for our future travel plans.

The Tokyo Hotel is at the top of its game. The hotel room amenities are up to date and worked perfectly,i,e, Wi-Fi television, HVAC etc. . Our room was luxuriously furnished and very comfortable. One evening we dined at the the delightful Signature restaurant . Ask for a table with a view of the city. The evening view is extraordinary. The fitness center is large and well kitted out. It too offers dazzling city views out the windows, even for this jaded New Yorker.

Beautiful hotel, looked after our needs - the concierge team were incredibly helpful with restaurant bookings (despite many not being available they persevered) and also arranged to help store my breast milk in the hotel freezers. Would definitely stay again.

For the third time in less than 3 years, we have enjoyed nights at the Mandarin Oriental. Every aspect of the hotel is of the highest standard, from the personal service offered by each and every member of staff, to the excellent breakfast, both buffet and table-service, and the room service, which we most appreciated, as we had an early flight to Europe and the Mandarin brought a sumptuous breakfast to our room at 5.20am at no extra cost. If only all luxury hotels could maintain this level of quality!

I am a MO fan!! We had been staying in so many MO locations and love the service the best!! My daughter got married at MO NY city about 2 years ago and she loved everything about this hotel.We just returned from our trip from Tokyo and had the best experience again the best service Especially the day before we leave for the airport I forgot my pocket book in the lobby ladies room and when I came back to the lobby ladies room to look for my pocket book and it wasn’t there I ran to asked the front desk and they said that they have it! The ladies room attendant found it! I couldn't believe the honesty of the people especially the attendant in the lobby ladies room.For me the best thing I really like in the this hotel is the professionalism and great service and most important is their honesty. I can’t wait until my next stay in another MO
user_name:
daisylarry
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed a week in the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo, the room was pretty spacious, the staff service was amazing, the concierge really help me to get reservations at the sushi places that i was looking. The staff at the bar the best!

The perfect location to visit Tokio, with the convenient Mitsukoshi Mae metro line in the basement. 5 minutes away from the station, and amazing views. From my room I could see Mount Fuji. During my stay in Japan I visited many luxury hotels, and this one is the best by far.

This is my first experience at a Mandarin Oriental and oh my goodness, it was amazing. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left, the employees worked in a way that earned my confidence in them. Upon arrival, the bellhop commanded the driveway for easy loading and unloading. The employees were eager to help carry luggage and provide assistance to get checked in. The lobby was on the 38 floor so we had a bellhop accompany us directly to the reception area. From there, the employees had a file of our stay, got us checked in, and explained amenities. They were very organized and knew exactly when we would be there, our travel plans, and reservations. The concierge was equally helpful. We contacted them even before we left for Japan and they were able to get reservations for us. They also pointed out excellent areas to visit and were able to contact our travel agency when we asked them to do so. Everyone was extremely kind and courteous. I could go on for days about how excellent the customer service is. Customer service aside, the views from this place...AMAZING! It’s in a very tall building where you can basically see all of Tokyo. On clear days, you can even seen Mount Fuji. The rooms were extremely luxurious and clean. I’m am OCD about hotels being clean and this one receives my stamp of approval. The toilets had heated seats. (I never appreciated this until I experienced it.) The room had many high tech features. There were floor to ceiling windows. The list goes on for days. The gym was equally luxurious. There was a lot of cardio equipment and some weights. The view of the city...you can see it all from the gym!They have an excellent breakfast buffet that had both Japanese and western foods. I was extremely comfortable during my stay here. I was 100% satisfied and recommend it to everyone.

The Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo was a great choice for our trip. All the staff is always ready to help and to give more than one expects. The restaurants, the Spa. If you have the chance, experience all. Even the room service. The best headquarter to get to explore Tokyo.

This hotel has been THE best hotel experience I have had across the world. It provides impeccable service, excellent facilities and top notch location. I was left speechless, it is that good and I travel all over the world and have done so for most of my life.

Visit the bar on the 37th floor.View was amazing the restaurant and bar was beautiful.Loved the design.We had eaten there also and the food was just so good.The waiter (french waiter) recommend all the cocktails we drank and everyone was very nice. He made the visit even better.Would definitely visit again when in japan again in the near future.

Lovely staff , convenient for the metro to get into town , fantastic shops nearby too . Sense, their Chinese restaurant, is brilliant as is the lovely little Pizza bar . We had a great view from our room of the city scape and found room service and turn down really excellent . Why only 4 stars then ? Well we don't like the smell of smoke and they allow smoking at the 37th floor bar area ,. This drifts up the open staircase to the lobby and reception on 38th floor too . If you are European, and used to smoke free living, this is nasty . One day we were driven out of the bar by cigar smokers which we could still smell the next morning !

Stayed in this lovely hotel for four nights in early April. Thought it is on the more pricey side than most other hotels in Tokyo, it is well worth it!The guest rooms got some wonderful unobstructed views to the city of Tokyo! Staffs are extremely helpful, since the very minute you stepped into the hotel, escorting you to the check in counter on 38th floor and to your room. The rooms are well maintained and the air conditioning system is the most user friendly one I have ever seen in the hotels I have stayed in. It is also close to the metro station, though a cab ride from Tokyo station to the hotel would be a lot more time saving and cost effective.The only drawbacks I can think of would be the smell of smoke in the 38th lobby and the lack of swimming pool. So overall a brilliant hotel!

We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Mandarin oriental. The service is absolutely outstanding. There is care in every detail, and the staff genuinely cares for their guests. When I was ill, they made sure I would get better and went above and beyond to ensure that.The concierge staff is professional, and has picked excellent restaurants for us to dine in during our stay.The in room dining team really deserves a commendation. Thank you for being our home away from home.Thank you for ensuring we had a memorable stay.

It is now the second time that I have the privilege to lodge at the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo. The experience is always nothing less than exceptional.Rooms are spacious and clean and can come with a view of mount Fuji. Service is just astounding: every detail is taken carefully planned and often personalised to the occupant of the room.The hotel has several excellent restaurants. The omakase experience at the traditional Japanese restaurant is to die for. Highly recommended. I wish I could always stay there when in Tokyo.

I stayed two nights in this wonderful hotel. The staff is so kind and the room very comfortable. All is made to make your stay unforgettable. I also had breakfast seated in front of an amazing view on the city and Mount Fuji in the background. The buffet is very generous and quality of food is excellent.

This was a new hotel for us in Tokyo. We stayed for four nights in late March, early April during the time to see cherry blossoms. The service was exquisite. The facility and the view are outstanding. Great food. It couldn't have been any better.

We stayed here for a week and this hotel was superb.All the restaurants are good (particularly the Chinese one). We stayed in a Grand room which was big and had great views. Yes you can see Mt Fuji on a rare clear day.Location is good and it is literally under a subway station so very handy.Highly recommended.

This is very classy hotel. Conveniently located for Tokyo Station and the Underground Rail and within easy access of lots of stuff that's wort visiting.The room was immaculate, well appointed and had a distant view of Mount Fuji. All staff were engaging and in particular, I must mention the lobby ambassador, Chiharu Hashimoto, who provided us with a very warm greeting, and was of much assistance during our 5 night stay. She is a credit to the MO organisation. In fact, all staff that we dealt with were excellent, including housekeeping who we never saw in person but clearly did great work.The cocktail bar is well worth a visit. Great drinks, very well managed by the engaging Fu-Fu (hope I got her name correct) and a superb night view over Tokyo from the non-smoking section (yep, Japan still allows smokers to puff away indoors - so 1980's!). The rest of the hotel looks to be non-smoking.If you want to eat at the hotel's Michelin Starr 'Tapas Molecular Bar' get your reservation made before you turn up. We tried to book when we checked in only to find it was fully reserved for the whole of our 5 night stay. Luckily there was a cancellation a few days later and we managed to get in on our last day. It's pricey but it's more than just a meal - it's entertainment too - and be sure to get the wine paring.In my opinion, the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is so much nicer than the Shangri-La just down the road.

Another great stay at this wonderful hotel. I very much love the mandarin here in Tokyo- the location is terrific, the rooms marvelous with fabulous views , the staff could really not be more warm and helpful. If you can - take the grand room or suite - the room is significantly better than the regular one. The food is generally great - tapas molecular is a stand out for me and the bar is wonderful with interesting cocktails and views to die for.Room service is ok - I found the menu limited and to me this is a minus. More choices especially in the Japanese section pleaseService overall just perfect. And I must single out the concierge desk - all of them but Reo especially were incredible!Bravo Mandarin!

Our 3rd stay here. The staff (they don't like to be singled out but they are exceptional team: Front Desk Jenny Miu, Nao, Niko, Osamu, Maria; in restaurant, Eita, Yuka, Yu, Luca) keep bringing us back, even when our trip doesn't include Tokyo, we make a point of staying here! Jenny and Niko even helped us with MO Bangkok and Hong Kong stays. Excellent Japanese service, but warm and friendly, too; so generous with their hospitality, have earned our loyalty. Feels like coming home. Rooms amazing; breakfast buffets and Italian dinners; spa baths and sauna with a view of the city. Luxurious--worth every penny!

Staff was attentive and welcoming. Room was quiet, clean and had incredible views. (Stayed across from elevator and didn't even hear it.) Good meals inside and just outside of the hotel. Will definitely return again for next trip to Tokyo.

The Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo is my favorite hotel, with dog business and leisure. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Excellent facilities. Rooms are very comfortable. Restaurant choices are great.

We traveled here as part of our honeymoon. Having been to many 5 star hotels around the world my wife and I both agreed this is the best service we have ever received. A definite recommendation of visiting Tokyo

Our stay at the Mandarin Oriental through American Express Platinum was amazing. They believe in the personal touch, and made us feel special from the minute we walked in the door. The breakfast was delicious, and the dinner at Sense with that fabulous view could not have been better. Our room was large with another great view. I could hardly get my husband out to do the sightseeing we had planned! Loved the staff as well.

I read some of the lower rated reviews to see what the possible issues were and I think most have been addressed - the service is great, most staff speak good English and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The only remaining one is that smoking is allowed in the bar on 37 which floats up to reception. I think it’s time that the MO Tokyo got with the rest of the 21st century and banned smoking in the public areas. Why should one or two people spoil the space for everyone else??

Second time to Tokyo and the first time to MOTYO. After the visit, for sure you will return to this FANtastic hotel.  Spacious room and I am really impressed that as usually the hotel rooms in Japan are quite small. I am so surprised for the amazing view from the room which seems like just a short distance to the Skytree Tower. Stunning View no matter in the morning, evening or night time!!!!  Bathroom amenities are luxurious by using BV and all amenities are available. The bath salt with great scent and always great to use it for the relaxation after the long shopping day at daytime.  Convenient location, connected to the Metro, shopping mall, convenient store with 2 mins walk. Only 10 to 15 mins to Ginza by Metro. For arrival and departure to or from airport, you may also take the Airport Limousine Bus (additional charge) and just around 1.5 hour to be arrived.  The staff are helpful. Especially I got the assistance of transfers arrangement from Bell and restaurant recommendations from Concierge. They won't suggest the over-fancy one and always give me the one that suitable my needs and budget!!  For Front Desk, they are all friendly and efficient for the room allocation as I have arrived to the hotel in the early morning which they try very best to accommodate the available room for me as soon as they can!!! Highly appericated!!!!!!  For Housekeeping Team, SUPERB!!!! The amazing thing is they even tidy up my chewing gum and put it in order!!! And I also love the Turn Down service by placing the Essential Oil on the small plate with origami.  For GR team, as I have stayed on 3 March and when I back to the hotel, I found a special gift for Hinamatsuri!!! SURPRISED!!!!  Nice experience and a MUST-TRY hotel if you travel to Tokyo!!!!!!!!!!!!! :)

The hotel is centrally located and has a metro station which connects you directly into the hotel- very convenient. It is only 2 stops away from Ginza and 11 stops away from Shibuya (around 15 mins metro ride). It is also a 7 min cab ride to Tokyo station and if you have light luggage then you can walk to the hotel which is around 10-12 mins away. The lobby is located on the 38th floor however once you are in the hotel though you have lovely city views you still seem away- its the best of both worlds! We stayed in the Mandarin Grande Room (Twin) - was super spacious with a walk in wardrobe, big queen size beds, the bathroom has a bath tub and walk in shower. They also offer Bottegga Veneta amenities! They have a buffet breakfast selection with the usual pastries, eggs, fruits etc. and Japanese style too. However I was probably expecting more variety however it is still nice. Do try the Pizza Bar at the restaurant, as they do really nice pizzas. Also visit the spa, if you get a chance. It is heaven! Must say, had a lovely stay in Tokyo and Mandarin Oriental was a big contributing factor.

Good service, staffs are polite and have good quality of service!Foods are excellent! Especially the foods in the "Signature". Those are wonderful at all.The room (especially the bathroom) is a little bit old-fashioned.

This time we use here as wedding reception place. You can find what is hospitality in this hotel. From entrance exit, many staff said celebration word for us. Perhaps there are good information sharing method.

I generally do not write reviews on trip advisor but felt it was necessary as I think the level of service at mandarin in Tokyo was exceptional. I made a visit on my birthday and was provided with a lovely cake in my room which was very thoughtful.I would like to thank yogi who is the breakfast manager for being so attentive and diligent. I would also like to thank masahiro at concierge who was extremely helpful, thoughtful and patient. I would definately stay at mandarin next time I visit Tokyo as the views alone are worth the trip! Only downside is there is no pool..

First off, I was a Amex Platinum traveler for 20+ years - they completely screwed up my trip. Booking us 2 twins(which are more like full beds) which would have placed my teen daughters on opposite sides of the hotel floor. Book directly, email them. I was very nervous because after spending 2+ hours and 2 days with AMEX they couldn’t figure it out. Unknown to me Platinum cards travel is just Expedia! Join the MO Fan and get same benefits. And the hotel emailed me to let me know that this would have happened. So here’s where Nao stepped in and despite fully booked because of holiday in Japan, we were able to get adjoining rooms after 3 days. She spoke flawless English and gave me many tips especially to the mochi place in Ginza that is part of turndown. She’s an asset to the hotel. I just felt service that was behind the scenes flawless execution and really trying hard even if things aren’t perfect. Comparable to my other fav hotel Waldorf Astoria in Beverly Hills. My daughter loved the spa and fitness areas there were killer views.The attention to details as you can see are amazing from a pillow bar, mochi to the aromatherapy oil. The views are KILLER! The warm Toto seats and towel bars are super nice touches.Breakfast buffet was too good, going home with a few extra pounds. The eggs are a bright orange and the pancake is not like an American pancake but more like a chiffon cake. Lots of dim sum and Japanese dishes too. The breakfast curry was to die for. The chefs are real serious about serving great food. Omelets and eggs dish lean more toward Eastern style and taste.A week in Japan we were really craving home food and they did accommodate us with pizza room service which was darn good NYC like pizza. I think it was expensive but very tasty.Concierge could be more helpful with dining choices but I found Yelp super helpful. It’s not about what you spend but how good the food is or if like us we want quick meals.Hubby had a $25 orange from their market, he said it was the best orange he tasted. Food looked so perfect it looked fake.Lastly, I’m super happy to stay in this part of town. The other areas are overcrowded with people and being from California and living in hills I felt like Disneyland level of people in a lot of Japan. I really like a quiet hotel where I’m not hearing a lot of guests or staff. I love being way up high too. The BED! Only other bed this comfortable is my own at home. I have major insomnia and this was the only hotel I’ve ever stayed in that I’ve gotten great sleep! I’ve stayed at Four Seasons and other 5 stars all over the world - none in Japan but this was a slice of luxury comfort. I got the aromatherapy pillow and my girls the booster.I recommend wearing layers because the heat is pumped in all over. I had a short sleeve T-shirt with a thin down jacket - was most comfortable. Overheated in cashmere.

We had breakfast for 5 days at the K'shiki restaurant where Davide Di Dio surprises you every morning with stunning food and even better views.The Mandarin is a wonderful place where the staff tries to accommodate ever wish. The front office, Masafumi Kobayashi was also very helpful. Extremely friendly and nice place. The rooms are getting a little tired but the view is superb. We saw Mount Fuji so cleary that we though we can touch it.We would recommend the hotel and restaurants, all of them. We had lunch, dinner and snacks in each one of them.

We stayed two nights at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo for Chinese New Year again this year. The service quality is absolutely top notch. Rooms are high-tech with good views and are sparkling clean. We will definitely visit again.

I spent 4 glorious nights here recently. I wanted to stay near Tokyo Station for convenience, since I would be arriving on the shinkansen from Kyoto, going to Tokyo Disney and also back to Narita on the Narita Express--all journeys beginning and/or ending at Tokyo Station. I had spent my first night in Japan at the Tokyo Station Hotel and had booked there for this 2nd segment as well. But when the Mandarin offered a complimentary 4th night, it was an offer I couldn't refuse. Although the Tokyo Station Hotel stay was perfect, my Mandarin Oriental stay was even more perfect and sumptuous.The Mandarin is about a 10-15 minute walk from Tokyo Station. Via email, the hotel staff had recommended I take a taxi from the station, but I opted to walk and got a bit lost, despite my pocket WiFi device. This never happened again after receiving proper directions from the hotel staff. Note if you do walk from the station, make sure you take the Nihonbashi exit. You will cross the famous Nihonbashi Bridge, originally built in the 1600's, with its current version completed in 1911.The Mandarin occupies the top floors of a 38-story office building, the Nihonbashi Mitsui Tower designed by Cesar Pelli. The street entrance has a lobby plus access to the office building, but the main lobby/reception area is on the 38th floor. Several restaurants and the fitness centre are also on this level. One story below (37th floor) are more restaurants and lounges, plus the Spa. All rooms are situated on floors below these down to the 30th floor. Ballrooms, the chapel, offices and the Business Centre are on the 3rd floor. My booking was for a Mandarin Grand room. These rooms are larger that the Deluxe rooms (especially the dressing/closet area) and all have Mt Fuji views. The room was indeed grand and filled with amenities and features expected from the Mandarin brand. I immediately noticed the similarities in decor, especially in the bathroom, between this Mandarin and my favourite Mandarin, the iconic and classic circa 1960's Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong. The extensive use of wood paneling, the granite bathroom with its black marble sink, the tortoise-shell-like accents on the bath fixtures, the sliding mirror all brought back fond memories. The only thing lacking was the signature Mandarin scent that I would notice in the hallways of several Mandarins I've stayed at. At nightly turndown, however, the housekeeper would leave a small dish with a soothing oil that would perfume the room, plus a mochi treat The room of course had the Mandarin's signature valet door. There were plush terrycloth robes and slippers, plus lighter-weight printed-fabric robes suitable for onsen. Pajamas were available upon request. There was a humidifier/air purifier, fixings for coffee and tea. The bathroom had a tub with an adjacent granite shower with THREE heads. There were shuttered windows into both the bedroom and dressing area. The room itself had electronically controlled shades both opaque and transluscent. Although I never heard any noise from the hallway or adjacent rooms, I would hear the footsteps of guests staying directly above me. The hotel has quite a few dining and lounging options. I would highly recommend joining the Mandarin chain's Fan of M.O. program, which entitles you to several perks of your choice. I opted for complimentary daily breakfast, plus a dining credit. An extensive breakfast buffet is served daily at K'shiki (egg dishes and pancakes are made to order), which seems popular with locals also. The restaurant offers Italian fare for other meals, complete with a pizza bar fronting the pizza oven.A set breakfast (Japanese or Western) is offered in the Oriental Lounge.I chose to use my dining credit at Ventaglio, located on the 2nd floor of the Tower lobby, somewhat disconnected from the hotel. It offers an extensive Mediterranean buffet for both lunch and dinner that is also popular with locals.The hotel also has French and Chinese restaurants, a molecular gastronomy restaurant, a tea bar plus a regular bar and a gourmet shop for sweet and savoury bites on the first floor. The sushi restaurant is currently closed and being revamped. I actually ate several meals within Tokyo Station. Just inside the Nihonbashi entrance are 2 levels of small restaurants each specializing in a particular type of (mostly Japanese) food. Delish and budget friendly. Service throughout the hotel was impressive--people almost breaking into sprints to help you, staff respectfully bowing. Particularly helpful for me was concierge Masahiro, who gave superb directions.Overall an outstanding and impressive stay.

One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and I like high end travel. Stunning food, service, ambience and views of Mr Fuji. Great location to wander around the high end stores and local Japanese boutiques. Walking distance to Imperial Palace. All round a spoiling and glamorous experience. I highly recommend but be prepared to pay for the privilege but its worth it!

My wife and stayed here for 5 night & lived every moment. From the views of Fuji to the food it was perfect. Staff were accommodating and friendly at all times. The young French waiter was excellent. Breakfast with a view over the city each morning and the night cap drink listening to the jazz session a highlight. Large comfortable rooms made the 5 days in this busy city an absolute pleasure. I highly recommend this hotel.

As with most luxury hotels, I would expect nothing less from perfection. What I remember most is the sensation of feeling genuinely welcomed. The room was immaculate, the view spectacular and breakfast in bed was to die for. Speaking of food, the Michelin 1 star French restaurant Signature was sublime! My wife and I travel to Tokyo and various parts of Japan yearly for the past half decade. Suffice to say, this will be my sole choice when visiting Tokyo for the foreseeable future.
