This was our first hotel for our trip across Japan and we didn’t want to leave.Staff are impeccable. They are all so incredibly polite and helpful and the reception/lobby area is stunning.We arrived slightly early for our room and so we visited the bar just below the lobby. The food and drinks were delicious (photos).We were shown to our room and it was perfect. With a large seating area and big bathroom area. The bedroom was also a nice large size which offered a nice view.The bathroom and bedroom in particular made the stay fantastic.The bathroom felt incredibly clean and modern, offering a bathtub with a view.The bedroom was also very clean and comfortable. The bed was so comfortable and the bedding was soft, felt like new!Electronic blinds were a nice touch too.We didn’t use the facilities for dinner but breakfast was very good. A nice selection of food to choose from with very good waiter service.I would absolutely recommend staying here.If you get a chance to visit the Gourmet shop, please do. Lots of delicious food to choose from. I tried their seasonable cloud cake and it was fantastic.

Flawless facilities and service. I wish there were more stars on TripAdvisor, as this hotel deserves more than five. Everything feels new and a bit better than you might find in other hotels. The view is likely the best in all of Tokyo, whether you're on the Mt. Fuji or SkyTree side (I preferred the SkyTree side, with slightly more sweeping views and a spectacular sunrise). The bar also has great views, but is absolutely worth it just for the drinks and service. Head bartender FuFu took great care of us and makes outstanding drinks. Walk into the fitness centre and you are greeted with a towel and immediate offer to help you get comfortable with their facilities. Best view ever from an elliptical or rowing machine. Same for the pool. And the breakfast buffet. The dim sum was a highlight, as was their house "eggs benedict" with crab and avocado. Special thanks to Ms. Hashimoto for taking my luggage and key and sorting my checkout when I was late for a meeting. Might have to surprise my wife with a night there for our next anniversary.

writing this from Sumba isle and have had earthquakes and tropitcal storms the last couple of days so much apologies for typos etc!On the Tokyo portion of our all-Asia honeymoon, my wife and I were greeted with a warmth and genuineness that was truly memorable. Igor Apratz, the hotel manager himself, was there to greet us in person with Nao Kobayashi, their Guest Relations Officer who was awesome! I really recommending signing up for the free Fans of M.O. program, which gets you complimentary upgrades a free breakfast!Nao, who left us several surprises and touches thoughout our honeymoon stay, whisked us to our upgraded deluxe room (huge and gorgeous btw), prepared this beautiful fresh red rose petal heart display accompanied by these pairs of amazing white swans kissing each other made out of bath towels (I've attached a picture). Now if that wasn't already enough, Nao also greeted us with maybe the most amazing strawberry shortcake that i have ever more. Now Japanese people are known for their mastery of elevating something to an even higher level (more on this later). This strawberry shortcake baked in house and made to say, perfection, would be an understatement. A lot of hotels have restaurants that usually are..eh. But Mandarin Hotel Tokyo has 4 restaurants, 2 of which are Michelin star restaurants and one that should be (more on this later too) and an in house Bakery that is to typical of that Japanese way of perfecting things, perfect artisanal croissants (had lots of those in the morning), perfect strawberry shortcakes with just the right balance of strawberries, and cream and just the right amount of sugar and a swirl of crushed nuts on the outside. I'm still salivating about that. It's not easy to get a cake right in this modern day of mass production but the flaky crust was well, perfection.When we told Nao that my wife was pregnant that we'd prefer to exchange the complimentary bottle of champagne in our honeymoon suite for a bottle of Pellegrino, you know what she did? She got us a bottle So Jennie, a premium non-alcoholic champagne bottled IN FRANCE. I am so grateful for this because the only non-alcoholic champagne or wine I've had is basically glorified grape juice. This was anything but. It tasted like the best grape extracts without any added sugars and by the way it wrapped my palate in ectasy, it must be made the traditional Champagne method or something very similar. Nao taught me something my wife and I will remember the rest of our lives that this is what we will drink every time all of our friends have champagne and we want to join to fun but just sans the alcohol. Breakfast was a delightful joy every morning. The freshest fruits, vegetables, pastries, eggs, dear god, everything was the highest quality. I guess that's what you get for staying a a hotel with 2 Michelin Star restaurants and their own artisanal bakery. Every morning, my wife and I were attended by someone that we found out later was one of their management trainees, Flora Hye Soo Shin who had a musicality and gracefulness in your attentive and warm hospitality and, I really must say, Flora was, I guess in retrospect that every single staff member at the hotel, always looked perfect. Every hair in place, every thread of her uniform perfect. She always remembered that we loved San Pellegrino in the mornings and made sure our glasses were filled always. We always saw Flora at 6:30AM every morning so I was astonished when one evening, on the advice of the executive chef Daniele Cason, we hard core NYers opted to have pizza of all things Pizza Bar 38, we saw Flora in the evening hour, again perfectly coifed, perfectly fresh and perky attending to us at the Pizza bar. OK, two things. What?! Apparently, all the staff at Mandarin Oriental wear multiple hats, have multiples skill sets and tireless dedication to their jobs. When we asked her if she was tired after having served us at 6:30am in the morning and now into the evening, she, without even the slightest hint of fatigue that she was well rested and relished the opportunity to serve us again. Wow. Apparently this must be the culture of hospitality so deeply ingrained in their staff from top to bottom, because honestly the hotel manager Igor, who greeted us late at night when we arrived for our honeymoon, I saw early in the morning as well, fully in command and just like all of the entire staff, crisp, organized but relaxed and running every facet with precision.I need to say one thing about the corporate culture at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. Their management empowers their staff to go above and beyond, to write us a little personal notes, to take time to really let us know the wonders of what makes them so special.Remember when i mentioned Flora worked the night shift same day after serving us on the breakfast shift at 6:30am. Couple of things i wish to say about that night.1) We ordered and savored our bottle of San Pelligrino sparkling water and declined to order. Flora sensed we would've loved more and she sent a few bottles to our room along with such such a lovely personal note. Kudoes Mandarin Oriental and the hotel Manager Igor. They empower their team members to take initiative and coddle their loyal guests. Bravo. It's the mark of a consumnate hospitality manager to entrust and empower. Says a lot about the top level managers and perhaps even more of their faith and belief in the team all the way down the line. Impressive. This is on top of all the premium fruit plates with HAPPY HONEYMOON written in chocolate from Flora at breakfast! Quick shout out to to the awesome manager Yoji Osada who greets us at the door as we come for our table! What wonderful smiles and Japanese bows all around!2) I want to speak about the Pizza alla Palla Pizzaolo, which is Italian for Pizza Maker. First let’s start with Executive Chef Daniele Cason’s pizza. We are from NYC and for me to talk about Pizza somewhere, well, it is something. Pizza Bar 38 at MO Tokyo is made in the style of Pizza made in Rome for centuries, what they call Pizza alla Palla. Is is truly out of this world and it is NOT easy to make. In my opinion, the best pizza int he world comes from NYC BUT let me qualify. The best Pizza in the world that is made quickly and from mass produced ingredients. Having said that, NYC city, yes, the city that never sleeps, does NOT have the best PIZZA. THE WORLD’S BEST PIZZA, must be made of the WORLD’S BEST INGREDIENTS, the best tomatoes, the best Bufalo Mozzarela and the BEST FLOUR. PiZZA BAR 38 HAS ALL THAT AND THE FLOUR THAT THEY USE IS SLOW MILLED BY MULES TURNING A STONE GRINDER (YES, THE SAME METHOD DONE IN ITALY FOR HUNDREDS IF NOT A THOUSAND OR MORE YEARS. They import it from Italy: Marino Flour, Mulino a Petra Naturale Della Langa. It is wow. Something about using only slow ground flour maintains the heartiness the vitamins the soul of the pizza dough. Modern bleached machine milled flour is just, well, nothingness. No flavor, no body, no soul, much less nutrients. The heat of the machine quick grinding of wheat destroys all that. Pizza Bar 38 at Manarin Oriential makes it exactly like the Romans have done for a millennia. Daniele Cason has shaped and trained Yuichi Ito, his Japanese Pizzaolo in Japan into a Master that leavens the bread for 48 hours until it is a cloud, yes, a cloud of dough, soft as the clouds in the sky if you could actually reach them. The result is the world’s highest finest Pizza crust. No one is better. No one. I actually thought Yuichi was Italian. With his Italian Pizza hat and warm bubbly Italian friendliness, somehow I blocked out in my mind and honestly though he was Italian. He had taken his training so well and sooo soo oud and into his craft that he breathed and lived as master Italian Pizzaolo from Rome. What Hotel in the world, really, has 2 Michelin Star restaurants and better get a 3rd for Pizza 38 or that would truly be a crime against the culinary world. You know sometimes when you see an Academy Award Winning performer and what makes his so good is that he is not acting. He is being. Yuicihi Ito is truly a master Pizzaolo in the centuries old tradition of Roma Italia. Bravissimo to the hotel Manager Igor Apraiz and his team. There are world class hotels and there are world class resorts. Somehow Mandarin Oriental Tokyo has both in one location. mastered I daresay. Truly remarkable. Bravissimo once again.

We stayed in MO Tokyo for the second time to celebrate birthday, and the stay was absolutely excellent. What remain the same as our last stay in the hotel are the top quality services and smooth flow of the staff, and this time we really appreciated the hotel for giving us a great room with Mt. Fuji view. The staff were very hospitable and prepared many surprises as birthday gifts to us. The gifts really presents the hotel's creativity and ingenuity in catering to the needs of its guests. And after you stay here for once, you'll definitely grow loyalty to MO Tokyo due to their finest service and hospitality.Besides services, at floors from the 30th to the 38th, the rooms, the fitness center, restaurants, and SPA center of MO Tokyo all offer spectacular view of Tokyo City. The view itself already an eye feast.Overall, M.O. Tokyo is a luxury hotel that's absolutely worth its price and deserves a second (or even more) visit.

every little details matter and everyone at MO Tokyo has delivered them impeccably well. Prior to our stay, we asked for a few personal celebration arrangement and they did an excellent job to help us, not to mention how they top it up with great options and ideas.

I stayed for a week in the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo ... amaizing rooms with asowme views and the services is next level... I stayed on the 31st floor with a stragiht view to the Mt Fuji. The Concierge is very helpful with reservations , they work with my concierge at America Express to get me a reservation at Jiro. Im regular at Mandarin Oriental but Tokyo property is above the other properties.

This was my first stay at this hotel and I couldn’t have been more impressed. We arrived late at night and were expeditiously checked in and escorted to our room. We booked the base room but it was large, and QUIET (we are light sleepers). Though very firm, the beds were very comfortable, and the room/bathroom were immaculately clean. We really enjoyed the staff; everyone was very polite and accommodating. MO’s CRM must be amazing because they had details about my preferences on hand that could only have come from my many visits to the Pudong property. Breakfast buffet had everything you could ask for, including a wonderful 38th-floor view of Tokyo. We also ate dinner at the Italian restaurant and service was over-the-top amazing (the food was great too). The restaurant staff for all meals made sure we wanted for nothing. We were sad to leave, but we will definitely be back!Tips:Taxi from Tokyo station. Subway requires two lines and if you’re tired from intercontinental travel, save yourself the hassle. The Narita limo bus stops directly at the hotel and took the same time as NEX + subway. Grab a drink at the bar, get a spot within the water feature.

I love Tokyo and I love the Mandarin so the combination is perfect. The rooms are wonderful and most have great views. the check in lobby has a break taking view of the city. sushi sora is one of my favorite sushi places in the world (I am sure there are several in Tokyo that are comparable if not better but can't beat the convenience especially when traveling on business). the spa is also excellent and I highly recommend getting a massage. One drawback is that the hotel does not have a lap pool and the gym is small but functional. The breakfast buffet is excellent. All the bars and restaurants are also exceptional.
user_name:
rcjdd148
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I just returned from 4 fabulous nights spent at the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo. The hotel is in an excellent location, with plenty of food and shopping options nearby. The Narita Airport Limousine Bus picks up and drops off at the hotel, for easy access to and from the airport (90 mins.). The metro line (Ginza Line) is conveniently located underneath the hotel, and the entire metro system is extremely user friendly. The hotel is located on the upper floors of a modern building, in Tokyo’s financial district. Our room was on the 31st floor, with crystal clear views of Mt. Fuji. The hotel room (3105) was excellent: modern, large, well appointed, and comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job, and were practically invisible, including the nightly turn-down service. The front desk and Concierge were extremely helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable, and provided great suggestions for places to go and outside dining options. The lobby Ambassador, Chihan Hashimoto, was extremely helpful, and made herself available every time we saw her. She even escorted us out of the hotel during our departure. The daily breakfast buffet is among the best I have ever experienced. We also had dinner in Signature, the hotel’s French restaurant, and our dinner was easily one of the best we have ever experienced (and we have tried the Chef’s tasting menus in many M-O locations). Our server, Nozomi, was delightful, and had great wine and Sake suggestions. We both used the spa facilities, and the men’s area had immaculate water and heat options, with a magnificent view of the city. My wife had a facial, and said the practitioner was a true artiste.We like the Mandarin Oriental brand very much, and have tried many around the world. The Tokyo Mandarin Oriental is a true gem, with high quality staff and personnel, excellent dining and bar options, with modern, beautifully appointed, quiet rooms, in a great location. It is without question in the top tier of Mandarin Oriental properties, and an opportunity to try this hotel should not be missed. It is exceptional in every way.

This is the best hotel- period. The staff makes the visit extremely pleasant. Everyone is courteous, kind, helpful and the facility and restaurants and bar are all outstanding! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates true 5-star services.

My boyfriend and I finished our 2 week trip to Japan by staying at the Mandarin Oriental. It was absolutely fantastic. The staff was friendly and attentive. Our room had a beautiful view of the city, and the room service staff took care of us (such as providing a glass cloth for my reading glasses and a chord manager for my boyfriends phone charger). We enjoyed the small touches that made our stay magical: morning juices and power bars in the gym room, the sweets left by our bed every night, costumer care in and out of the elevators, and concierges assistance in making dinner reservations during our stay in Tokyo. If you get the chance, make sure to get reservations at Tapas and Signature ; these dining experiences were highlights of our trip!

Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo for 2 nights on business, and what a tremendous choice. The service at this hotel is amazing and I absolutely loved how you can work out on the highest floor and have a drink at the bar later! Also whether you are here to shop or for business, this hotel has an amazing location right in the centre of everything and everywhere you need to be.

We just back from M.O Tokyo and miss our stay already. MO Tokyo is a truly best hotel in Japan, and among the MO franchises. every moments we experienced were unforgettable. We will definitely back again soon. Thank you again for your fantastic hospitality.일본 최고의 호텔이라고 생각합니다. 세밀 하지만 품격있는 서비스를 계속 받았습니다. 항상 경청하고 도와주려는 마음이 느껴지는 곳이였습니다. 깊은 환대에 감사합니다.Hyun Kyu Nam

One of our new favourite hotels in the world. We absolutely loved our brief 3 night stay and were made to feel very special by all staff. Amazing views, amazing service and amazing food. We had booked Sushi Sora for our first meal but this closed down just before our stay and instead we ate in the Italian - we were a smidge disappointed for our first night in Japan however K’shiki provided one of our best meals of the holiday. We had a table by the window and our Italian waiter looked after us throughout the meal. We also ate at Tapas Molecular which was amazing and a highlight of our holiday - very expensive (especially with wine pairings) but worth it.Rooms were very comfortable as you would expect and we received lots of nice touches and gifts from the staff - as I say we were made to feel very special. We are very anti smoking and were a little concerned about the bar but this was fine with separate allocated areas plus the lounge is fully non smoking - not sure why the hotel doesn’t go fully non smoking but anyway. Amazing stay and will be returning (soon, hopefully). Highly recommend

I was always very happy with the service by staff at MO_tokyo. They fully underestand what OMOTENASHI（hospitality in English) is. In room, I could see amazing scenery. I can see some beautiful scenery there in the early morning and evening. The view from this room is wonderful. it was great, thanks!

Stayed in king premier room. Nicely appointed, wonderful attentive staff, amazing views of Tokyo. Literally right on top of Tokyo subway stop with easy access to the JR Lines. Next to large department store, multiple stores and restaurants. Would highly recommend and would stay here again. Fantastic breakfast buffet, excellent room service (highly recommend the Katsu-Don). Thank you for a great visit.

The hotel is conveniently located in Tokyo, nicely decorated, spacious room with a very grand view over Tokyo. Staff ( not only conceirge but also housekeeping, bell services) are excellent, responsive and caring. They responded to my need very efficiently during our stay. All staff can speak fluent English and you get all the help you need. The Tapas Molecular Bar worths a visit. A special culinary experience with a reasonable price. Need to reserve in advance.

I returned after 1 year in this wonderful fabulous hotel and i could still appreciate the wonderful environments and the excellent service. I thank all the staff, and in particular way the very kind and courteous girls of the beautiful fantastic Mandarin Bar, as well as the breakfast staff, and Pizza bar. Certainly i'll return in future to enjoy again all the beauties and wonders of the superb Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo which is now one of my favorite hotels in the world... Have a happy new year and very good work...

Mandarin Oriental Tokyo seems to have done everything just right - the room is clean, spacious, tastefully decorated, comfortable for business as well as leisure traveller, and boasts a fantastic city view; staff are exceedingly courteous, efficient and helpful; restaurants are numerous and inviting; location couldn't be more convenient: it's steps away from JR's Shin Nihombashi Station, within walking distance to the famed Tokyo Station, and has direct access to the Airport Limousine (which gets you to the Narita Airport in 75 minutes). The hotel thoughtfully leaves a personal touch here and there to make me feel at home - a handwritten welcome card, a small Japanese delicacy on the bed side table every night, and so forth. Thanks everyone at M.O. Tokyo - you should feel proud of creating an excellent first impression.

A top luxury hotel that is ensconced in a high-rise building with fantastic views of the Tokyo skyline. The team at Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo is also very attentive and delivers incredible, warm personalized service. Kudos to the knowledgeable concierge team led by Masumi, and also the front desk team who are very efficient and friendly to boot. Love the dining options at the hotel as well especially Sense (great Cantonese food) and the gorgeous Mandarin Bar.The Nihonbashi neighborhood is also full of character and shops that specialize in artisanal products. This is a fantastic neighborhood.Can't wait to visit again soon.
user_name:
Aik Wye N
New York City, New York

review_body: Everything about this hotel is excellent. In a city full of luxury hotels, the MO strands out for the following reasons:Direct access to subway station from the basementSpacious, luxurious and well equipped rooms Warm and friendly service staff who go out of their way to make you feel at home Resourceful concierge team

Overall it was a great experience at Mandarin. Service was good. I had a deep impression on Tapas Molecular Bar. The location is very convenient to go to Ginza areas. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I will go back in future.

The stay was perfect and the service is the best anywhere we have travelled to so far. From the moment we entered until departure, the attention to detail and the care everybody is giving makes me want to come back as much as possible. Special to mention the breakfast team who makes you want to stay until lunch. They make everything look very calm and especially Miura san is doing an outstanding job. Rooms are very nice and super clean and in contrast to many other hotels don't smell. Whenever something was convenient to happen it happen due to the attention of everybody. During our departure the lady saw me from far away sitting with a finished Banana and she realized and came to collect it - this is really great to know that everybody cares even though a small thing. Must stay when in Tokyo

Very convenient. Close to shops. Love the breakfast buffet. Mandarin oriental las Vegas has a larger room and looks newer but I still love the Tokyo branch. There is a shopping center a few blocks away which sell exotic good food at the basement. Hotel has a store that sells extremely expensive fruits like $30 for a cantaloupe. I bought one to see if they taste different but no.

This is a great hotel and it’s got better from when I last visited. The overall style and service are amazing. The room had an amazing view across the city and the housekeeping is great. Hidden in the basement are some good cheap food options, connection to the shopping Malls and the underground. You feel a sense of calm as you walk in.So what has got better? The F&B. Last time I stayed I was constantly leaving for dinner and drinks. Now I found the bar has improved, even with a great pianist occasionally playing in the background - the drinks are good and fun and there are loads of staff there to help. However trumping it all is the improvement to the French restaurant Signature. This is now really good and of course comes with an amazing view. The Chef has just moved up from Singapore and has really improved things. It means I can invite people to my hotel for dinner and drinks instead of going to theirs.Well done Mandarin Oriental.

Spent 4 wonderful nights away with my wife. Beautiful and spacious rooms. Great location and outstanding dining options but what sets this hotel apart was the phenomal service we received. Staff went above and beyond at every turn including booking and delivering our train tickets which was a great convenience. Daily breakfast buffet and afternoon tea were amazing!

Excellent Hotel- amazing service Krit Kranratanasuit at the front desk was particularly good Love the spaAnd Pizza restaurant is fantasticYuzu martini at the bar was excellent The aroma oil in the rooms is amazing and can be bought at the spa

MO Tokyo is our favorite hotel in the city, and in our family’s opinion, one of the very best hotels in the world. My husband and I travel very regularly for work, and take the same holiday each year with our kids: June and December. We have been staying with MO Tokyo each time, for years, due to its impeccable and unparalleled attention to detail, quality to its service, and warmth of its staff. We would like to particularly mention Jenny Miu who looks after us and our kids particularly well. Quite simply the best hotel in Tokyo, bar none.

Fantastic rooms and service the staff are all fantastic the 2 restaurants the french and chinese both wonderful. If there is one criticism the Hotel decorative wise could do with a little updating scratches on the cupboard doors in the room and at the end of the bed. .

Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is everything you want in a luxury hotel. Outstanding staff, great accommodations, first class culinary choices. Best breakfast buffet anywhere. Location is fantastic. Though at the top of the price range, if you are looking to be pampered, this hotel is the one to choose.

As city hotels go we found this one average. It did all the basics well, cannot complain about the room other than the lighting in the bathroom which was underpowered particlaury around the basin, that too was undersized and awkward to use, should have been two basins with a decent amount of worktop to place your washbag on. Even the Bottega shampoo & conditioner seemed to have been stuck solid in the bottle.We found the buffet breakfast acceptable but get there too late and it feels like a rush,wolfing down your food before it all gets taken away. The signature eggs benedicte is nice but they must do something about the congealed hollandaise sauce. Surely this is not acceptable?The communal areas we found lacking, whilst running the gauntlet through the smoke filled bar between the two restaurants, this could have been better thought out. The bar was small but provided very good cocktails and drinks but as a non-smoker found it stuffy and the hotel jazz band would grind on you night after night - a little more variety would have been better received. This hotel lacked outdoor space, not surprising being on the 38th floor, maybe then maybe not. We have stayed in city hotels in NY, Bangkok and Seoul that are all high rise blocks and all had outside terraces and rooftop bars that gave you a hit of fresh air and openness. We used the spa once but were uninspired by it. Personally, there was no wow factor in this hotel and we found it sterile and lacking atmosphere, if you are looking for a stay that is well organised and good service then it is fine. Looking for more bang for your buck then this is too vanilla.

Stayed here for 5 nights, 4 at the start and one at the end of our trip. Our rooms had spectacular views, spacious, secure, well equipped, and were quiet. The service was fantastic. There are several great restaurants, including a highly rated, albeit pricey, chinese restaurant Sense, which we ate at and really enjoyed. The location is great, very close to the subway system and plenty of restaurants. The staff is top notch. The breakfasts were the best we had in Japan, with a huge selection of foods from all over. I wish they had a swimming pool. The bar on the 37th floor is very nice, with some wonderful cocktails, but unfortunately allows smoking.

Very nice hotel with some lovely views from the rooms. Typical Mandarin quality and service.Not that keen that you need to take an elevator from ground floor up to level 38 reception and then cross the floor and take a different elevator back down to the floors where the room are.

Just like you are at Tokyo Skytree, but better!!!! First class service as always, however after traveling around Tokyo for weeks and coming from Hakone, they provide no shuttles from any stations when I emailed them and none to Haneda Airport upon exiting, surprising for a hotel of this level. They are located right above Mitsukoshimae station on the Ginza line, next to Mitsukoshi dept store level B1 with tons of food, and across the street from the best Shabu Shabu/Sukiyaki Wagyu A5 beef restaurant Zakuro. The bar is sleek and serves all types of drinks and food, there are 2 Michelin restaurants on property and have a lovely spa with an Infiniti jacuzzi pool and views for days. Make sure to sign up for MO fan and receive 2 complimentary things at check in, we got an upgrade to our room and a late checkout of 4pm.

We’ve stayed here more than once and it’s always an exceptional experience. Starting with entering into the sky lobby on the 38th floor all the way to the beautiful views from the bedrooms, this is a fabulous city hotel. Great restaurants (especially Tapas), surprisingly good buffet breakfast offer, and top-notch facilities. Very expensive but the M.O. works hard to make it all worth the price.

We had an amazing experience at the Mandarin and would highly recommend anyone to stay in this incredible property. The staff is out-standing, nothing is too much trouble and they take pride in delivering a real omotenashi with every encounter. We also had the pleasure to visit Tapas with chef Kendo and the team, whom put on a culinary show that will be remembered! Wow. Lastly, the spa - it was the best experience we ever had (recommend to upgrade to a suite experience to enjoy the views of the city pre and post treatment!). Thank you and hope to be back soon again!

Just like other Mandarin Oriental hotels, this one is characterized by GREAT service. Tokyo can be difficult to navigate, but the concierge staff made that challenge easy. They are knowledgable and approachable. The hotel is expensive, but worth the splurge. The only downside is that there is precious little drawer and storage space--also like other M/O properties

Staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo was really a great experience. Beautiful hotel, comfortable room with all the amenities imaginable, breathtaking views, amazing staff and the best food you could ask for (one of the best breakfast ever).It will always be my hotel in Tokyo. Obrigado!

It was the last day of my holiday and a perfect room and hotel to just sit back and relax in. Big rooms, outstanding service from the time I walked into hotel till I stepped back out. No request is too big or too small. Thank you MO for a wonderful stay. Staying a a fan of MO

I'm not even sure where to start with Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo - that's how bad our stay was. My fiance and I book a big vacation every year, but this year was special because we were celebrating our engagement. We decided to book a three-week trip starting in Singapore, then Bali, and finally ending in Tokyo. As an aside, we stayed at luxury five-star resorts at each destination (and always stay at five-star hotels whenever we travel, whether it's for vacation or business). During this trip, the service at each resort was exactly what you'd expect from a luxury hotel - each day, the hotels left little treats for us to celebrate our engagement, the staff would bend over backwards to accommodate any of our requests, every single staff person knew our names, and so forth. And then we got to Mandarin Oriental. I live in Vegas half of the time and the Bay Area for the other half; there used to be Mandarin Oriental properties at each place and I would go frequently for high tea, to the spa, or for staycations. When I first started going to MO in the Bay and Vegas, it set the standard for five-star service. I never had any problems at the Bay Area location, but about three years ago the service really started to go downhill at the Vegas location. I should've known better, but I thought that since we would be in Tokyo where service tends to be exceptional wherever you go, then the service at MO would be good. Unfortunately, I was wrong. It started when I emailed the hotel several months prior to our arrival to ask if we could do early check-in. Our flight was arriving into Tokyo at 9:00 a.m. and I figured that even going through customs and driving to MO, we would arrive at MO by noon. I offered to pay extra to check in early, thinking that we would be required to pay maybe $300 since we would only be a few hours early. The reservation desk replied to my inquiry, saying that they could not guarantee early check-in, that they would allow us to do early check-in if a room was ready, and if we needed a guarantee that we could check in early, we should pay for one extra night beginning on the night prior to our arrival date. While I understand that this is probably hotel policy, as a five-star and very expensive hotel, MO's job should be to provide the best customer service it can possibly provide. Telling a guest to pay for one extra night in order to check in three hours early is not, in my opinion, five-star service, particularly when MO appeared to have availability. If it didn't, why would they even suggest that we pay for one extra night? If the rooms were sold out, I would've understood where they were coming from with their response but that didn't seem to be the case. Things just got worse when we got there. Some of the things we noticed (too many to remember): the entire lobby on the 38th floor smelled like smoke (disgusting to us non-smokers), the water closet in our room smelled like urine, housekeeping was inconsistent and sometimes didn't restock our shampoo and body wash, there were guests above us that we could hear running back and forth early in the morning and late at night, several times there was no one at the reception desk or concierge to help us when we had questions, and a few times no one was at the desk on the ground floor (we would ask them for assistance hailing a cab, so we had to wait around for a bit on the several occasions when no one was there). The worst part came on our last night when we went down to the reception desk to request late checkout (by 3:30 p.m.) since our car service wasn't picking us up until then. The young man at the reception desk was nice enough, and after 15 minutes of him checking his computer and speaking with colleagues, he advised us that we could check out at 1:00 p.m. for no extra charge. However, if we wanted to stay until 3:30, we would need to pay 3780 yen, which is just a little under $30. While I understand that the extra charge is again likely hotel policy, if a hotel has capacity, would it really hurt to let guests stay a few extra hours at no charge? (side note - one of our resorts in Bali gave us late checkout at 9 p.m. to accommodate our late flight). In any event, given the relatively small extra charge, which we made it a point to confirm with the staff person at least three times, we agreed to pay the 3780 yen. About an hour later, the reception desk called our room, said they had made a mistake with the price, and that it would instead by $258 to stay until 3:30. We declined and advised that we would check out by 1:00 p.m. to avoid any extra charges. In our opinion, since the hotel made the mistake and we confirmed three or more times that it would only be the $30, the hotel should've honored the original price. My fiance, who is the most easygoing guy in the world and rarely ever gets upset, was absolutely furious and said that that ruined our last night there. Again, we understand that the $258 charge was hotel policy, but MO clearly wasn't fully booked as they were willing to allow us to stay if we paid extra. In addition, it was their mistake that they quoted us the wrong price, and gave the wrong answer each time we asked them to confirm the price. The next day when we checked out, my fiance expressed his disappointment to the person who assisted us with checkout. The only thing she did was give an insincere apology and kind of giggled about it. She didn't ask if we wanted to speak to a manager or offer any other remedy. In all fairness, we didn't ask to speak to a manager, but by this point we were exhausted, just wanted to get home, and decided to save our comments for this review. Again in fairness, not all of the staff was bad. There were a few really helpful ones whose names we wish we could remember, and we are very grateful to them. Too bad it was limited to just a few people. As a result of this experience, we will never stay at another MO property, and will share (and have been sharing) our poor experience with our friends and family to make sure they don't waste their money here.

My daughter and I were guests at the Tokyo Mandarin Oriental Hotel on September 19th-22nd and October 2-4th, 2018. While our stay in Japan was a wonderful two week authentic Japanese cultural experience, I will say that our brief stay at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel was exceptional on all levels. Gracious service greeted us from the outset of our arrival at Reception. Smiles, warmth, courtesy, promptness, and a very high level of professionalism welcomed us following a 12 hour flight. Concierge, Housekeeping, the Spa staff, ever so pleasant and genuinely concerned for our comfort and general inquiries. I have never experienced such seamless service in all my travels. In fact, the overall service exceeded our expectations. Above all else, I would like to commend Robin, Flora and the team-spirited staff at breakfast every morning. We were greeted cheerfully, and personally escorted to tables overlooking spectacular panoramic views of Tokyo. Robin and Flora ensured our orders were prepared to taste. They both managed to memorize our orders on Day 2 of our trip! Incredible! Our start to each morning was engaging, interesting and always informative as both Robin and Flora addressed our litany of questions about the hotel amenities and must-dos while in Tokyo. They spent considerable time serving, cleaning and resetting the table several times over on any given morning. Again, I have never had the pleasure of being cared for so completely as a traveler and guest. Kudos to Robin, Flora and hotel management for offering such personalized service. Truly outstanding. Without a doubt, you have made us loyal customers! I am truly grateful to have met such an interesting, intelligent, highly professional and knowledgeable staff. The grace and elegance in which you serve others is truly exemplary. Thank you! Susan and Lara from Canada

Spent 4 days at this hotel for my 1st visiting in Tokyo. The room is perfect and clean...kinda combination of japanese style , you can see the whole city from the window.. such a amazing view , i really love their salt bath .. good smell and give you very relaxing moment ! Well , i also dont know what’s HK work process in this hotel but we had left over bottles that we don’t drink anymore since the 1st day on the table until the day before we leave. Its still there and i need to tell them to clean it up for me. Tho i know they thought we gonna drink it again maybe.. Breakfast are good , just only they are open at 7 a.m ( which a bit late for us and others hotel are open at 6 or 6.30 am) and if you come like 8 am u gotta line up and wait a bit.Overall , from my hotel industry experience.. this hotel room is good , good location and All staff are friendly and super nice !!!!! Excellent services & very kind. That’s why i said this is the best hotel i have ever stayed. i would like to say thank you for staff at Mandarin bar. for clean up when I was spilled my drink over the sofa.... And especially to Flora Shin from K’shiki for taking such a good care of me during my stay there. I am really grateful for that. I will definitely come back to MO again for my next trip return to Tokyo. !

We stayed here for our first night after arriving in Japan and loved it! The environment is great-but that is kind of a given here. We liked the location, the lobby area is beautiful, the views are fab and the rooms are lovely-we had a really fine suite with corner views, a beautiful bathroom and dressing room area- ideal. The furnishings in the lounge area and bedroom were a little on the functional side for me personally but that is a matter of personal taste and others will love them.As I say, above is really a given here. What really impressed us about the hotel was the approach of the staff. Again great service is a given here as it should be but we found the staff here went beyond in terms of being proactive, approachable and personable. We had our four year old daughter with us and without exception the staff went out of their way to be friendly and kind to her. This applied right across the hotel from the reception to the restaurants. As another example, we arrived tired after a long flight from the UK but were quickly ushered into the lounge for tea and refreshments. We had great service across our trip to Japan but the service here stands out.We ate dinner in the Italian restaurant and the food was very good, breakfast was excellent. I also used the sauna and bath area which has lovely views. Overall highly recommended.

What a fabulous hotel. Beautifully appointed with exceptional service. My room is ideally laid out and love the floor lighting and overall comfort. I cannot say enough good things. And I am hard to please!

Hotel is beautiful with amazing views over Tokyo and Mount Fuji on a clear day. Rooms are sumptuous with silk gowns to use when you arrive. Removed the next day and not returned which was a pity. Staff were attentive friendly warm and went further to please than anywhere I have ever been. They took shopping as soon as you entered the door, they brought fruit and happy travel embossed with choclate to breakfast the day we were leaving. Breakfast was superb. Dinner in the Molecular was the experience of a lifetime. Have stayed before and cant wait to stay again.

Once again, the MO sets the benchmark for service in Tokyo. The rooms are very generously sized, the breakfast and the service of the hotel is impeccable. The location is excellent as well as it is connected directly to the subway system.

Centrally located within walking distance from the shopping outlets in Ginza. Beautiful decor, descent size rooms (not spacious but not small either). Very friendly and helpful staff. Good gym and very good spa. Few good food outlets. The Pizza bar is excellent. The only downside if any is that there is no swimming pool.
user_name:
DrHabib
New York City, New York

review_body: 1. Good location, convenient to go around. Subway just under the hotel building2.. Spacious rooms3.. Very courteous and well trained staffs4.. Excellent food at the restaurants.5.. Mitsukoshi Department store just next door. 6. Many many restaurants in the vicinity.Alway enjoy staying here!

Spacious and very well appointed rooms and bathrooms.Staff speaks perfect English and is attentive and efficient.Impressive views on Tokyo’s center.Buffet breakfast among the best in terms of both quality and variety.Several great restaurants in the same building.
user_name:
MILOUW
New York City, New York

review_body: Everyone went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable. From the management, to the bar, restaurant and fitness staff, we were completely taken care of. Best customer service my husband and I have ever experienced. Can’t thank Shogo and the rest of the team enough for making our first trip to Japan and my husband’s birthday a very special experience. We will definitely be back.

5th stay at the Mandarin Oriental and once again, an amazing experince. All is great, the hotel, building, service, room, staff.....it is really a great hotel, among the best ones I ever visited in the world. This time stayed for 4 nights on one of recurrent business trips to Japan and as on previous stays, I enjoyed a great stay.I can only recomment this hotel and of course, I will be back

This hotel is of high quality, staff are polite and helpful. However, the staff helped us book the train ticket and told us to pick up after one hour, when we came back they told a loooong time to check (about 25 mins) while we were in hurry. And they intend to charge again (we’ve paid before) for the ticket. Although they found the mistake and cancel the charge, but still put us in a “lack of time” situation. I think it was due to the inappropriate managing system, which shouldn’t be happening in a hotel like this.

The property here is very nice as other reviewers have noted, but the staff sets this hote apart from other luxury hotels in the area. The entire front desk staff and the staff at breakfast went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable, book reservations, and to make me feel at home. My girlfriend couldn’t make the trip because of illness and the entire front desk staff signed a lovely card with a gift from the spa for me to bring home to her. It was the most thoughtful gesture! Thank you everyone at MO Tokyo for another great stay - I will be back soon.

M.O. Tokyo offers top quality services, accommodation, meals, and city views.The staff are professional and efficient since the check-in service, to dining, turn-down, and check-out services. Dining experiences here are beyond expectation, as the Michelin-starred restaurants are ready to treat you with a feast. The gym and spa facility are both professional and meet the needs of most guests. The staff in the hotel is proficient in English, and there is no difficulty by communicating in English in the hotel.Traffic-wise, the hotel is located close to Tokyo Station. It only takes a 5-minute drive to get to the hotel from Tokyo station. Overall, M.O. Tokyo is a luxury hotel that's worth its price and deserves a second (or even more) visit.

This is my 6th stay in Mandarin Tokyo the services are very consistent and never disappointed me .Spa service is excellent and dining varieties very good . A good location with connection to train station .

The hotel is located very close to the Tokyo station and about 4 minutes train ride to Ginza. It has 11 restaurants to choose from, very elegant and comfortable hotel. Large rooms with large shower and great amenities, highly recommended..

7 years ago as I hired a colleague who eventually became my law partner, I planned to take a month long trip in August of 2018. I’ve just completed that trip that took me to 4 European countries, a week on Cape Cod and 10 days in Japan. The crown jewel of the entire amazing experience was my time at the Mandarin Oriental hotel in Tokyo. The views, the restaurants, and spa were all extraordinary, but it was the attentive staff that trip made me feel special and anticipated every need and desire. When my EarPods went missing they simply replaced them. All of the staff were great, but I want to specifically give a shout out to the front desk trainee Krit. He greeted me with respect and yet was relaxed enough to be funny which relaxed me on my first day at a “fancy” hotel. Krit even sought me out at the end of my stay and gave me a touching and thoughtful gift. It was also fun meeting other guests in the hotel who also marveled at this wonderful property and experience. I look forward to my next stay at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo!!

Celebrated my 50th birthday @ the Mandarin Oriental. This included a 9 night stay. I had the most awesome experience there. From the moment we walked through the doors to the moment we left. The service was exemplary every single day. They anticipated our every need and were always eager to help. Customer service at its very best. ⭐️

We stayed at the Madarin at the end of July for one night during our time in Tokyo, we stayed here during the Sumida fireworks.The room was wonderful and I cannot find any fault with it, the beds comfortable, the bathroom was gorgeous with a huge bathtub, marble everything and a nice shower. We had plenty of space to put our luggage and the room was very spacious, even though there was three of us (thus, three luggages).We tried the gym which was great, the equipments were new, there were towels, water and fruits available, and there were some weightlifting equipment and some cardio ones and you could also see the fireworks from there. However, they do not have a swimming pool which would have been nice. The problems come firstly with the wifi - in order to connect you had to either because a "fan of mandating oriental" or have it charged to your room, but one of my friends who arrived later was told by the reception that she had to pay, and was not informed of the first option. I also had a problem connecting even after becoming a "fan of Mandarin Oriental" despite having asked the reception for instructions and followed it to the T, I instead had to pay due to such difficulties. I feel as though given the steep price, it is rather appalling that connecting to the wifi was such a hassle. We had stayed in the Peninsula the night before which was slightly cheaper and we faced no such problems with the wifi and I actually prefer the location of the Peninsula which is near the imperial palace and Ginza. Secondly we went for dinner in one of the restaurants (the pizza bar). Whilst they were considerate in allowing us to order from the pizza bar from the other restaurant as they were fully booked, we had to wait almost 2 hours for our order from the pizza to arrive. Nonetheless, the waitress was wonderful, her english was perfect and her recommendations all proved to be great and gave us complimentary deserts due to the wait. Otherwise the food was very good but not exceptional, and the price was reasonable given the amount we ordered and the fact that we were at the Mandarin with a great view. Lastly the service was at times inconsistent, firstly the problem with the wifi and misinformation noted above regarding that, and whilst the service at checkout was great, it wasn't so at check-in. The lady who checked us in gave us wrong information at times, not only relating to the wifi (e.g. we asked about the Sumida fireworks and a good viewing spot and she told us people reserve their restaurants to view it months in advance even though the fireworks were delayed by one day due to the rain, as such, people who reserve "months in advance" must have reserved for the night before), another minor problem is that when asking for some information, the lady who checked us in always referred us to another rather than making enquiries herself which I would expect from a 5 star hotel. Nonetheless, she was polite.Nonetheless, the problems weren't too bad, and the room, as noted above, was wonderful, therefore I am still giving the hotel 4 stars.

This hotel is simply amazing. You cannot beat the view from there, every detail is well thaught out and the staff is extremly helpful. I particularly liked the gym - you get to run while watching the run rise above Tokyo if you wake up early enough - and the yoga mat that was available in my room!

Great hotel, really well-located and excessive good treat. Good and confortables rooms, excellent breakfast service and great view of the city. No doubt, I recommend this hotel, best holidays thanks to the hotel!!!!!

Really love the view of this hotel. You can watch the difference of the city day and night, I even have Mountain Fuji view in front of my window. Location is great, easy to walk to Tokyo station, and it's a nice walk. I don't know how they do, but they remember which newspaper I prefer, my last time stay in this hotel was 5 years ago but they remember! The service is amazing, first day breakfast i asked for Eagle tea, second day they just automatically offered. This hotel made me feel like home. Really love it

I recently visited the Spa and then the Italian restaurant on the 38th floor.The service was impeccable, with a special mention to Robin who made sure I had everything I needed.Can’t wait to come back and try pizza bar!

The best Chinese resturant in Tokyo. All the dishes were very tasty, fresh . Service was excellent. Resturant managers were very friendly and helpful. I felt very well welcomed .I was with 2 friends at this beautiful resturant. with stunning Tokyo skyline view. We had a great night.

Supposedly the Mandarin is Tokyo’s only 6 star. Hotel. While room size is large and views are stunning, I would leave it in the 5 stars category. Service is impeccable. The property is starting to fray around the edges. Also allowing smoking cigarettes the lobby bars is a bit behind the times. The whole place has a stale smoke smell. Spa was also a disappointment. With the exception of a great view, then facilities are in remarkable. Breakfast buffet was very limited. Definitely punching below its weight relative to regional peers. However, their special of the day kind of made up for it: crab avocado eggs Benedict. The sushi bar was great but super expensive. Almost as much as a night in the hotel for a sushi dinner. On balance falls short of the 6 star reputation. I prefer the Hyatt.

We stayed here for 5 nights and felt completely blown away by the service and amenities. The room was impeccably clean, the staff could not have been friendlier and the breakfast was excellent. However our stand-out memory has to be The Tapas Molecular Bar. Worth every penny.

My husband and me are definitely MO Tokyo fans. We stayed at the hotel in early July and the stay was as excellent as before. We appreciate the modernization of the room which makes it cozier; love the bright and yet warm tone of the room. We had our breakfasts at Oriental Lounge and K'shiki, and visited Pizza Bar for nice pizzas; service of the F&B team was of top quality. We want to specially thank Ochiai-san, Yuka, Miwa, Yuichi, Minami, Flora, Kaori and many more including Emiri at the Gourmet Shop who made our meal experience memorable. And the Kumo cake was such a delight that we want to try out all the different flavors according to seasons.Jenny at the front office took good care of us. Yee, Maria and Shogo also were much attentive and kind. After a few years of always staying at MO Tokyo whenever in Tokyo, we are confident to say it has the best service in town which is about personal attention offered in a timely manner.

1. Good concierge service - we asked for restaurant and site seeing outside Tokyo recommendations before our trip, quick response received2. Dinning at Signature - great food resonably priced in a Michelin starred French restaurant. The waitress is cheerful and attentive to our needs3. Location is very good - subway station is just underneath the hotel. Environment nearby is quiet and not crowded. Tokyo station is 10 min walk away4. Efficient house keeping - whatever we need i.e. iron board, utensils, they were delivered efficiently5. Spacious gym - with all basic equippments we need, fantastic Tokyo night view6. My husband pre arranged roses with MO on my birthday. The roses were so beautiful! MO sent me very tasty birthday cake as a surprise, all these impressed us.Staff are friendly without any doubt. We stayed in quite a few MO in different countries, we put it on the top of our hotel list because of the service and quality of rooms. I already recommended to many of my friends to stay in MO Tokyo.

1. Good concierge service - we asked for site seeing outside Tokyo and restaurant recommendation before the trip, quick response.2. Dinning at Signature - great food resonably priced in a Michelin starred French restaurant. The waitress is cheerful and attentive to our needs3. Location is very good - subway station is just underneath the hotel. Environment nearby is quiet and not crowded. 4. Efficient house keeping - whatever we need i.e. iron board, utentils, they were delivered efficiently5. Spacious gym - with all basic equippments we need, fantastic Tokyo night viewStaff are friendly without any doubt. We stayed in quite a few MO in different countries, we put it on the top of our hotel list because of the service and the quality of rooms. I already recommended to many of my friends to stay in MO Tokyo.

We spent 5 days in Tokyo for the first time!We preferred to stay in a hotel that we’ve had already known. We decided for Mandarin Oriental and there are no regrets! The top in class service provided by this wonderful hotel is connected to the Japanese culture of reaching perfection in everything they do!We appreciate our stay and intend to come back to this magnificent city and certainly we will stay once more in this wonderful hotel!ありがとうございました

This is the best hotel I have ever had the opportunity to visit. We stayed here our last night in Japan and after 12 days of amazing service we had become a little spoiled and hard to impress. That stopped here. Comfortable bed, spacious room, amazing tub, spectacular views and of course the service was the best we have ever had. After an amazing dinner in the hotel bar we hit the town and before we knew it it was time to go. We hustled down to the lobby and were escorted from checkout to the airport shuttle. They reminded us several times to check we had our phones, passports and other valuables but in our hurry my husband left behind his wireless Bose head phones. The staff happily tracked them down and shipped them to us in the states. I hope I get the chance to stay here again.
user_location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
user_name:
Crystal S
Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

review_body: From the moment you walk into the sky-high lobby you are blown away by the views that greet you from every space (make sure to visit the bathroom off the lobby to get an awesome photo with their floor to ceiling windows). The staff is awesome...professional, courteous, and helpful at every turn. The rooms are gorgeous...exactly what you envision when you think of a 5-star hotel in Japan. The restaurants are incredible! Especially the Tapas Molecular Bar. It was, hands down, the most amazing dining experience I've had in my entire life (which is saying something). Be sure to make a reservation far in advance if you'd like to experience it...there are only 8 seats per lunch/dinner. It was truly a meal I will never forget. All of the restaurants are incredibly good...and their breakfast spread is incredible. Another must-do during your (in my opinion) is the spa. Not only are the services to die for (albeit it more expensive than expected even for such a hotel), but you get to enjoy the incredible views throughout...and in the most unique dry sauna and water feature I've ever seen as a result (see photos). We stayed at two other hotels during our time in Tokyo and each had their perks...but the amazing ambiance, views, dining and spa really set the MO apart.

We stayed here for 3 days celebrating our anniversary. The extremely welcoming staff made us feel very special, for example Minami, who wrote us a personal card when dining in the Pizza bar as well as Luigi who gave us fantastic advise on where to go during the trip. Rooms, amenities and restaurants are first class.

The Tokyo Mandarin Oriental begins high in the sky so no matter what room you get, you will have a thrilling view of this sprawling city. The service is excellent. I stayed here twice during my time in Japan - once in March and again in April. On my last night there, I inquired of the concierge Chikana Kigami if she could locate a Gudetama bento box that my granddaughter wanted me to bring her from Japan. She not only found it for me, she got it for me and it was waiting in my room when I returned from dinner that last night in Japan. Also noteworthy is the housekeeping staff. My room was spotless during my stays and the housekeeper arranged all of my bath items in perfect, aligned, balanced order ... I was impressed!

The hotel location in Nihonbashi is definitely convenient, there is limo bus ticket counter at Narita airport and drop directly in front of the hotel. Subway station Mitsukomae is just at the B1 level of the hotel, just few stations to the tourism attractions like Akakusa, Ueno, Ginza, etc.I was checking in late but warmly greeted by the managers, Morita san and Kurokawa san. Check in was speedy and I was escorted to the room. I wrote to reservation to tell them that my friend will be arriving ahead of me, found him so comfortable in the room when I arrived. Thank you for the seamless services from reservations to the reception.The bed was very comfortable and I could not leave it even I was awaken in the morning. The room cleanliness was perfect - I did not wear the slippers or shoes, still found no dust even I was walking around in the room. The toiletry they offer is Bottega Veneta.Thank you to Concierge team, Eguchi san and Mori san for assisting me to try to find a sumo ticket and Kabuki information. I just highlighted that these may be one of my interests for me to explore during my first trip to Japan, and I found very detailed information listed in the reply. Not expecting this, but they are moving one step forward to anticipate my needs.I have a room move due to the change of my personal traveling plan. I stored my luggage and hand carry paper bags at reception and came back to pick up the new key in evening. When I went back, I found all my belongings were in the room already. I had a can of beer in the paper bag, it was put into the fridge and they left me a note to let me know. There are so much attentions to the detail during your stay, the staffs were very helpful and friendly, you will find yourself being welcomed once you stepped in the hotel. And remember to join Fans of MO at the official website, you will get a small but lovely treat, also free wifi by logging in your personal Fans of MO account.

During our stay at this hotel, we had several transfers to organise. Which i a foreign country can become daunting. The staff and especially the concierge on duty, 8+9 June, made all the arrangements for us, and assisted us all the way. Arriving back after a week, upon arrival our luggage which we left at the hotel were already waiting in our room. Without us needing to request the porter to bring our luggage. All staff are highly efficient and nothing ever seems to be trouble.
user_name:
Estelle G
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: My wife and I had an excellent stay in Mandarin Oriental Tokyo, room were cleaned and services were exceptional.located at a very convenient location, right above nihonbashi station.Niko is certainly a great asset to the hotel, he personally went to the Mantenzushi Restaurant to make a reservation for us after knowing that we could not reach the restaurant by phone call.we missed the hotel already, and wish to go back to visit the hotel again very soon.

I have stayed in Mandarin Oriental Tokyo from 2-4 July. Check in staff, Ms Sujeong Choi, escorted me to the room and offered welcome drinks. It made me feel very comfortable and relax after early flight from Hong Kong. The room is spacious and l love the Yukata in the room. Love to have a cup of coffee in the morning with nice city view. Check out staff, Ms Satomi, smiled and friendly. All the staffs are lovely and will choose MO again on my next visit.

At exceptional stay here at In Tokyo fromThe comfortable room and fantastic location . Situation above a train station providing easy access around Tokyo. The location is quieter but much preferred. Hotel offers bikes for guest. We borrowed it to cycle to Tsujiki market which is only 3km away. Follow by a cycle around the palace . A great way to explore the city and because the area isn’t as congested you feel very safe to cycle around. Only ten minutes from Tokyo station means you can easily do day trips . Only one hour to Kurusawa to the premium outlets and again rented bikes to visit this little town which offered some amazing Scenic sites.Hotel service was exceptional from Front desk , Concierge to our wonderful housekeeping room attendant. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to escape. Having stayed on several hotels in Tokyo this is now my preferred hotel.

Look I am a massive Mandarin fan and love all their properties. The one in Tokyo was exceptional, great rooms, great food, great service. But it would still not be my No. 1 choice in Tokyo. My No. 1 would be the Palace! I did find it odd that hotel guests are not allowed to use the spa facilities and this property had a small gym and no pool.

Stayed at this property multiple times the location is especially nice because of the train location both for the bullet trains and subways. The views at check in are incredible. The staff are incredibly attentive an excellent even remembering little things that we like to eat or drink they delivered spot on service. It’s proximity to some major attractions and shopping also makes it worth the money

We have stayed in this hotel during an art tour with a great group of art lovers.Hotel is nicely located and everything is very good as can be expected from Mandarin.The food in all restaurants is very good. Service is perfect.However, I have stayed in Aman Tokyo as well and the rooms in Mandarin are little bir older than Aman. At the end, I can easily reccommned it to everyone.

Booked through TA and room was upgraded at check in.The lobby was not at the first floor which we had to take a lift up. The staff on the first floor was kind and very friendly. As I was walking towards the entrance, they came and helped me with my luggage and asked for my last name which they notified the counter as we went up. Check in was a breeze as my friend has check-in before me and they did keep a room card for me. The view of the room was excellent and I've noticed that through out the stay I didn't hear any noise from rooms next to us or even any noise from outside the room. The gym was basic and of decent size.One great thing about hotel was that almost no tour groups stay here. I'm not sure if its by chance but it was definitely much more quiet compared to other hotels I've stayed in Tokyo. The breakfast included in my room rate was of high quality and they advised that the Japanese set breakfast will take a longer time to prepare and it did not disappoint, well worth the wait. Other hotels with a similar price wasn't as good as the one I had here. Another thing I find a little awkward is that a member of the staff will accompany us down to the first floor. At first I thought it was just coincidence but we noted that every time we took a lift down, a staff will follow us in and hold the elevator doors for us. I guess they are just very observant in a way.Just for the fact that there is less tour groups that are staying at this place, I would gladly pay the premium to stay here again.

I stay at Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo last weekend. We were travelling with a small baby which is sometime challenging. From the moment that we checked in, the staff made us feel at home. The room had everything that we could need for our baby: A bottle steriliser, a bottle warmer, little toys and personalized items for my daughter. We were truly impressed! I have never seen that level of detail in any other hotel. We also had dinner at Tapas Molecular, highly recommended. Please make sure that you book in advance as it is only for 8 people!. The food is out of this world and the service was phenomenal, very personal touches through the dinner. It was truly a memorable experience. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it is connected to the metro and the concierge team was very helpful providing tips and itineraries. If we are going back to Tokyo, we will definitely stay here again. It has exceeded my expectations.

Hotel lobby and rooms are rather dim maybe because of the yellow lighting. Service is impeccable. Chris (pardon me if I spelled wrongly) a veteran - his service was beyond describable. He helped us find where our wifi pocket is being misplaced and called up the agency to confirm that it's really delivered to our hotel. On top of that, he even helped us check that out Mount Fuji tour is on. Room 3504 was great. If not for the cloudy weather, we would have seen Mount Fuji from our room. Housekeeping was done morning and evening or at our own discretion. It has a 24 hrs gym with gym attire and shoes provided as well. Wifi is strong and uploading is a breeze. In room dining was perfect. The food was great and we can't wait to enjoy it every single day of our stay. The nearest subway (mitsukoshimae station) is just at the basement exit A7 or A8 so traveling is very convenient. If you find it hassle to change train, just take a taxi from tokyo station - it's only 650/730 yen.

No attention to detail was every missed, courteous and nice staff that go above and beyond to accommodate guest. Staff did not miss a beat and they took very good care of me. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Tokyo.

Our stay was amazing. Everyone really made us feel welcomed and special. I also really enjoyed the fact everyone spoke English, and helped us out. I wanted to give a 10 out of 10 to Shogo at concierge. He really went out of his way to help us enjoy our stay. He also was very personable and just made our stay even more enjoyable. Honestly, I wish we could have a Shogo at every hotel we stay at. He really did a great job!!!The room was very nice and clean. The food was also amazing. Very top notch. If you are nervous about coming to Toyko and not speaking Japanese, this hotel is for you. They really did help us out and made our stay the best.

This is the best hotel ever. Everything after this will feel like a letdown. This hotel has it all: gorgeous decor, fabulous staff—all English speakers—excellent fitness room, incredible views of Tokyo and Mt. Fuji, great food, quiet, wonderful (fast) room service. If you have the opportunity to stay here, don't hesitate. We particularly loved the coffee and pastries in their ground floor shop. We asked the concierge to help us book train tickets for the rest of our stay in Japan and he did so with utmost care, giving us not only the tickets but maps of the train stations in other cities we planned to visit and detailed instructions. This was a truly superb experience from check in to check out.

We visited the Mandarin after a long haul flight and dropped dead on arrival, can't see much better places to rest in the city and get ready to be treated as only the best Japanese places know. Good location if going for business and easy to move around to Akihabara district or elsewhere with the subway round the corner. Foodwise there's a wide range of options and you have the local japanese (go for the breakfast, be brave) or some Western options which are quite good too. Ask the concierge for directions as there are very good restaurants nearby and it's always nice to have a walk, especially at night. Enjoy

We stayed at the MO Tokyo for the first portion of our honeymoon, traveling throughout Tokyo. Could not speak better of the hotel's staff, professionalism, and the overall experience during our stay. While expensive, the hotel more than lives up to its reputation in room quality, facilities, and concierge services. Highly recommend.
user_name:
Beau W
Chicago, Illinois, United States

review_body: Mandarin Oriental is one of our favorite hotel. You get the best service. They are also renovating and upgrading their rooms section by section so Looking forward to our next stay. Restaurants are simply amazing.

The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo has the best views and breakfast of all the luxury hotels in Tokyo. Also, almost all of the employees speak english so you are able to communicate effectively. The only negative is they do allow smoking in the bar and the bar is open to the lobby so smoke to permeates to other areas of the hotel at night when the bar is full.

We had a wonderful 5-night stay at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. We have been travelling to Japan for decades and have stayed in so many different luxury hotels and can safely say the MO is the best one thus far. The staff was always attentive/alert and they quietly anticipated our needs. When we arrived, a concierge staff led us to Reception at the 38th floor and he whispered our family name to the Front Desk staff. I didn't even know he knew which group we were.Weeks prior to our arrival, we had contacted their Concierge to assist us in getting restaurant reservations. We probably exchanged more than 25 emails as they worked really hard to get us the reservations to 4 restaurants we really wanted to try. They replied promptly each time and although I felt we were the ones who were imposing on their time, they were always cordial and nice about the whole thing. At check-in, someone from the Concierge met with us to go through all our restaurant reservations and they had actually printed out an “itinerary” for each dinner with all the details (time, attire, etc.) and a map of each restaurant that we can show the taxi driver. Amazing!The bedrooms and bathrooms were huge for Tokyo! And they had every amenity imaginable...Nespresso machine, a yoga mat, hair brush (not a comb), makeup magnifying mirror beside the vanity table, office supplies, etc. We had sent out 2 shirts for laundry. Later in the day, we received the laundered shirts back and they included a note saying they couldn't get a stain (tiny!) out of one of the shirts and so they didn't charge us for it. The lobby staff (ground floor) were always there to help us get a taxi and they made sure the taxi driver understood where we wanted to go and sometimes they even went as far as making sure the driver input the correct address in his GPS. When it was raining, they immediately ask if we wanted umbrellas. When we said yes, another staff magically appeared in seconds to hand us a couple.Although the location is a business area, there are lots of dining and shopping options. The subway station was directly underneath the hotel and the turnstile for the Ginza Line (which we frequently used) were just a few meters away. Service above and beyond...is really what sets MO-Tokyo apart from the other luxury hotels in the city. The staff really put their hearts and minds into their work and it shows. Well done!I think we finally found our "home" in Tokyo and we definitely look forward to staying again.

We stayed at the MO Tokyo for our first trip to Japan from May 16th to 20th and I cannot stress enough how amazing the service was. From the front desk staff to the staff who delivered our breakfast each morning, it was second to none. We normally stay at boutique hotels because the service is more personable but despite its size the MO staff make you feel like an old friend coming home. I can honestly say that I never experienced such amazing staff. We happened to mention one evening as we were returning to our room that we were suffering from serious jet lag and that night when we returned from dinner, there was a beautiful bath oil set with a note from the staff telling us to have a nice bath to help us sleep. We will only stay here when we return to Tokyo and will now also give MO first preference when we are traveling. Arigato to all, you are the best!!!!!

I have stayed in many nice hotels in Tokyo and MO is now the one I return every time if I am coming to Tokyo. everything is just great , from staff greeting you upon arrival , to check out. it has various restaurants options , great location , metro and department store is just outside of the hotel literally.

The Mandarin Tokyo was a great experience. My 15 year old son asked if he was saying thank you too many times due to the personalized service rendered. The staff all knew our names, our travel itinerary, made excellent recommendations when asked for. Great view with no rooms below the 30th floor. Spacious, modern, clean, great turndown service and spa. There was a misunderstanding with a service and Mr Daisuke Morita handled it with class and convenience. I recommend this hotel highly. Thank you for a wonderful stay,

This hotel is beautiful. The only thing I would say is that they do allow smoking in the bar. It really smells in the lobby area on the 38 th floor. Otherwise this hotel has everything but it is very pricey. The rooms are spacious comfortable and the views are amazing. Its in a great location and easy access to train stations.

This hotel meets all expectations from location, cleanliness, staff, beauty and integrity of design, and dining. The amenities are the best, and everyone working there has the goal of making certain your stay is pleasurable and satisfying. The breakfast buffet is delicious, and at night the spot becomes an Italian Restaurant that rivals those in Italy. The beds are so comfortable and getting places is a breeze as there is a main subway below the hotel--which starts on the 38th floor.

We stayed here 3 nights after a cruise and we were extremely happy with the hotel. The room was very large, the bathroom had separate areas for the tub, shower, vanity and WC, which provided the two of us plenty of room getting ready in the mornings. The breakfast buffet had a very large selection of both Asian and English dishes, as well as made to order selections. The restaurants and cocktail lounges are on the 38th floor, so the view is very nice for pre-dinner cocktails. The Concierge staff was also very helpful in arranging restaurant reservations. A taxi is necessary to go to the Ginza area, but it's only a 10 - 15 minute ride. We were very happy with this hotel and would stay here again.

I love the location. Busy but quiet. Subway directly connected underground. Also connected to a major department store with the awesome food department. Excellent place to get drinks and Japanese treats! Ginza my favourite shopping area is about a 15 minutes walk or 2 subway station stops.Nice rooms, great breakfast and great front desk service.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. We had wonderful service and a great room over looking the Tokyo skyline. All the staff were very friendly in particular NAO who made our stay extra special. Location is great and very convenient to all our favourite restaurants and shopping areas. We can’t wait to go back and recommend that you check out this fantastic hotel.

After a long flight from Europe we arrived at the stunning mandarin Oriental Tokyo. Unfortunately we had no chance to sleep as they were redoing the room next to us.
