Mgmt reacted fast and moved us 30 Min later to another room. That we can have our afternoon nap.Eat also there... Amazing restaurant. Ask for a high floor room or renovated rooms.

Perfect Service - Great Pleaple, perfect Resaurants - we had a great view - great eatings - and the room had a excellent view. Just on the Mail Road with walking distance to station, Parks and excellent shopping places.

I’ve stayed here three times now and once again my most recent stay reminds me why I always stay here when I’m in Tokyo, even if I probably can’t afford it. From the moment you arrive the excellent staff greet you warmly and with complete politeness and professionalism. Check in was in room and they had on their system when I last stayed and preferences. I was staying in a Mandarin delux room (with a very faint view of Mount Fuji one morning) which is by no means a huge suite but perfectly spacious and actually feels slightly larger than the corner rooms I have had before. All the usual MO touches are there from robes, Yakutas tea and coffee facilities, a huge bath although their new toiletries by Bottega are not as nice as the original Aromatherapy Associates (first world pains). I didn’t eat in the hotel apart from breakfast which was excellent. Perfect croissants and the congee and Japanese specials were excellent. Several well made drinks in the bar on 37 which is a nice place for a chilled drink before dinner or bed. I used the spa on the last day as I always like to and the 50 minute relaxation head and shoulder massage was one of the most effective I’ve ever had in an MO or anywhere. Drifted off a few times. The hotel is also conveniently located about Mitsukoshimae subway station. To sum up what shinesthrough every aspect of this very comfortable hotel is the flawless and impeccable service and that makes me always return.

The hotel facilities are very good but its staff are simply outstanding. This might be the best hotel that I have stayed in. Stand-outs were the bar, afternoon tea, mens' stand-up toilets with a view of Tokyo 38 floors below and the room.
user_name:
Christopher E
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: The best hotel I stay at anywhere in forty-four years of business travel. The staff is utterly at your disposal, the rooms are large and wonderful, the views of Tokyo spectacular and the breakfast is outstanding. The 37th and 38th floor bars are the best.
user_name:
nrb2018
New York City, New York

review_body: This 5 star hotel is one of the best that I have stayed in. Located on the upper floors of a new office building, it is the essence of luxury. From the floor to ceiling windows with views of Mt. Fuji to the fine cuisine in its restaurants, it is picture perfect. The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms filled with all the immensities possible (rain shower), and chase lounge in the bedroom, it has it all.

The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is what you get when you cross the world's best hotel chain with a country known for amazing service.There is nothing big or small that the staff at MO Tokyo won't do for you... and the best part about it is that they mean it, they want you to have an amazing stay.When we arrived early before check-in, they apologised to us for not being able to check in by sitting us down with complimentary drinks. Other hotels would just say that check-in is not ready. On the day it was raining, they made sure we didn't leave the hotel without umbrellas, every staff member stopped us to offer one. Their gift/food store downstairs arranged for a cake to be delivered to our room at the exact time we requested.It's the little touches that make a stay amazing, and the MO Tokyo is just incredible.

When we knew we were going back to Tokyo, staying at the Mandarin Oriental again was never going to be in question. We had previously been here as part of a tour and wanted to stay independently, thus this trip was arranged. From arrival to departure we really do have to mention how wonderful, professional and friendly the entire staff were. Check-in was swift and our room was ready, Concierge and Front desk staff all had excellent knowledge of local amenities and transport options; breakfast was very generous and a good selection of buffet and a la carte options, staff really seemed to know their guests and even remembered orders from previous days. Thank you all so much. What we didn't notice the first time around but what was all too apparent this time was the overwhelming intrusion of cigarette smoke that permeates the lobby and accommodation floors - hotels of this category really should be non smoking.

Fancy hotel with stunning, stay there whenever I travel with my spouse. Shame they only start the MO fan recently... got very busy at night in the bar, I would recommend a peaceful breakfast with the stunning view. Love the sunrise looking over the city in the room. The gym is good, like the swimming pool area and sauna( again with a view). service could be more friendly, don't get me wrong, they are polite, sometimes is nice if they can be warmer. That would be nice touch.

The staff are great they are extremely friendly and want to help in anyway possible. The concierge service is absolutely incredible, with the very best restaurant suggestions. Everything about the hotel was excellent.

The rooms in this hotel are spacious and have gorgeous views. Amenities are top quality. I especially appreciated the scented oil on the table in the evening. Staff was all very helpful and courteous. Very nice location with subway you can reach without even going outside as well as lots of eating options within a block of the hotel.

Where to start from...My wife and I visited Tokyo and stayed at the Mandarin for 8 nights for our honeymoon. I already knew about the hotel from last time I had visited Tokyo but did not get the chance to stay there but always wanted to. To put things to perspective, it is not a coincidence why this hotel has the best ratings place you search on the website (Tripadvisor, Google, Expedia, booking etc.). Having stayed in many hotels around the world, the Mandarin Tokyo certainly is a superb hotel that combines all the needs of a leisure (and business) traveler. Location, service, room quality, cleanliness, amenities, facilities, spa, access to the train station and the metro in every way were just perfect. The staff is exceptionally very kind and helpful wanting to make their guest experience perfect in anyway (even though service in Japan is great, the Mandarin was exceptional). They made us feel like we were at home from the time we arrived. During our stay in Tokyo we had the chance to visit other top hotels for dinners and drinks at their bars and trust me each time we said to ourselves

Traveling much for work and being visiting Tokyo regularly I wish all hotels were like this. The service and the attention to detail is above what one would reasonably expect even for Japan. From arriving and being greeted as a welcomed returning guest to the always well organized check and swift check in to an equally swift check out, staying with the MO is always a pleasure. Although not an in-expensive stay you get your money’s worth.

The hotel from head to toe, from beginning to end is extraordinary. This is the second time I stay there and it is worth every single penny. From attention to detail, to making you feel like a million dollars, to extraordinarily breakfast, to the Best SPA i have ever been. Perfect ! Pamper yourself to this experience, is well worth it

We stayed for 3 nights in this well located hotel. The room was of a good size with views towards Mount Fuji (which we never saw despite the binoculars they make available for this purpose). It is a typical Mandarin Oriental hotel in terms of the quality of the furnishings and the standard of service. The room was always clean and the bathroom was well appointed with a wet room, large bath and typical high tech Japanese toilet. The buffet breakfast was good quality although not as much choice as we have had in other Mandarin Oriental hotels. Staff were all professional and friendly. The only area we felt needed improving was the concierge staff who did not seem to take into account what we were telling them when making restaurant recommendations or places to visit. One member of the concierge team did not seem to know how best to go by metro from the hotel to our required destination. In the end we suggested a route which she agreed. Nevertheless, we would stay again here as we enjoyed our stay.

One of the best properties! Very polite staff and lovely location ! Must stay hotel . Mount Fuji view Grand room is a must to have . And awesome Bottega toiletries...Rooms are huge and one of the best ! They have 3 Michelin star restaurants and bar 37 is must a visit !

My daughter and I really enjoyed the luxury of this hotel. It is located on the top floors of a tall building and has fabulous views. The lower floors have some very interesting shops which is fun. Our room was quiet and comfortable. The western breakfast buffet was beautifully organized. It had a tremendous variety of hot and cold options. A wonderful selection of newspapers was available. The service is impeccable. We appreciated the somewhat central location - with many things being only a short ride away. I have heard they have some of the biggest rooms in Tokyo. I have nothing to compare it to but our room was a very comfortable size. Great hotel.
user_name:
Cosima21
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved the location, property and staff. Room was large but a little tired.... Perfectly acceptable. Our only gripe was the ridiculous prices for food. The very average breakfast buffet was $50 per person... club sandwich via room service $40. I have no problem paying $50 for breakfast... but be something special for that price. When paying $1,300 per night I don't expect the staff at checkout to add $0.70 to the bill for mailing a post card...

We’ve stayed in the Las Vegas one and we’re impressed with the Tokyo on as well. Our granddaughter loved the automatic blinds and curtains. What a view, particularly as the sun went down and city lit up.Quiet, service great. Remember, lobby is on the 38 floor!

It is a pity that a hotel that charges 900 euros a night does not meet the expectations! Sadly old, in need of urgent refurbishment!! Gym room a disgrace, spa acceptable, no pool. Couldn't get a reservation at any of the top restaurants, no creativity in giving options to guests ( but very polite and with wishes to please but unable to come through). One night we went to the hotel's chinese restaurant at 21:30 and before we could even say a word the hostess informs us that the last order is at 10:00 pm. It is 9:30 pm!! How about good evening you are welcome, how many in your party? Just shows how little they care or how lazy they were! Not very typical in Japan. The whole atmosphere is that of a lazy agonizing Dinosaur! A disgrace to the Mandarin Oriental Hotel chain. Never again.

We absolutely love MO Tokyo. It is THE hotel to stay in Tokyo. The staff are incredible. Traditional Japanese service is rather gated between guest and host. MO they really do want to chat and help and get to know you. Our stay was immeasurably elevated by all of the staff there. Of course the food is top notch. Sushi Sora was delicious and the sommelier Makoto made the meal extra delightful. Tea service overlooking the city is almost scary how luxurious and wonderful it is. K'shiki for breakfast and lunch are the best. Try the squid appetizer. The gym amenities are superb and try the sauna if you can. 10 out of 10 will stay there again next time we're in Tokyo.

There's nothing terrible about the hotel but I'm baffled by all of the 'excellent' reviews on Trip Advisor. We booked this hotel for the last night of our stay following 4 nights at the Shangri-La and 4 nights at the Four Seasons in Kyoto, both of which were excellent. The hotel is very dated in comparison and felt like a 4* hotel, I wouldn't rate this 5* as it needs a refurb. The service was excellent, as was the bar area but the room and overall hotel decor were disappointing. It's damaging to the brand to operate a hotel of this standard. I'd be unlikely to stay in another MO hotel due to this experience.

The staff were nice, the rooms were clean and near everything! We had an amazing time in Tokyo and we will definitely recommend this hotel to other people. Plus the food was amazing! At breakfast order the pancake it is a literal pan cake!

The hotel is in a very lovely part of town, the streets outside are beautiful at night. The room, breakfast and facilities are amazing, however the stand out of our stay here was the concierge team that was able to accommodate all of our requests on the date and times that we needed. It was like clockwork. Amazing service and we would definitely stay here again.

The high parts of this hotel is the view (can't get any better) and the staff. The staff are so attentive and ready to help you with anything. The rooms have great view but are a little old but well mantein. But for the food quality and service its really top notch.

There are few Hotels were one can say, I felt like a guest of wonderful and professional hosts. The location is great for sightseeing, shopping and you are not to far from the fishmarket. Any time again.

It's hard to fault this property. The service is exceptional and the atmosphere quite stunning. The main floor is on the 38th floor and the view is spectacular. It was great eating breakfast overlooking Tokyo every morning with a nice view of Mt. Fuji in the background.The location is great, sitting right on top of a subway station. In Tokyo subways re the way to go, they are clean and super efficient. I would comment that the hotel can be a tad pricey. For example an 80min massage its about $400 US which seems a bit much to me. Try and get a "Virtuoso" booking via a travel agency which will give you an upgrade and free breakfast every morning.

Mardarin Oriental offered is top class, the services are excellent sand the best is 24 hours gym room and a min away from the Metro. Location is very convenient. Also worth take a look in their gourmet shop as well as the fruit shop in the ground floor of the hotel building. The cake, flower and fruit are in top class quality!

Mandarin Oriental is continuously our preferred hotel in Tokyo. The staff go above and beyond to make you feel at home, especially appreciate the spa, gym and concierge staff. Location is within walking distance to department stores and Ginza, plus direct access to the metro.Breakfast is delicious and serves great croissants and Japanese style breakfast.Italian restaurant serves innovative pastas and great pizza.Stunning views of the Tokyo skyline and Mount Fuji all across the hotelDon't miss the Gourmet shop!!

For my first stay in Tokyo, there was only one choice for a number of reasons. This hotel, part of the most prestigious hotel group in the world, comes immeditely to mind for its excellent address, pristine modern building, and perhaps most importantly their reputation for irreprochable service. We were not disappointed. I don't think that I've ever stayed in a hotel with this level of warm welcome, discreet, high performance service, and high end amenities. Here you have everything, and although Tokyo is one of the most vibrant and exciting cities in the world, the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo is so amazing, you won't want to leave the hotel! The entire team, from the smiling, ever present door staff (who always remember your name), to the front desk staff (special mention for the superb concierge team (Kumiko and Masumi are stars), the pizza bar chef Ito (better than Napoli!) to the ever gracious Yuka from the K'shiki restaurant, everyone is warm and welcoming, highly professional. If you want the best in the Land of the Rising Sun, this is your only option! It's a reason to come to Japan.

We have stayed at several of the groups hotels around the world. Having lived in Japan for several months we decided to take a family member here for dinner. We used to live in Hong Kong so we expected the food to be excellent. Unfortunately while the food was good it was not overwhelmingly good. Chinese food is meant to be shard in a group. This food was served as if being eaten alone. The portions were extremely small and the prices disporoportinatept expensive. ¥64;000 with drinks for three people was overly expensive. I would not recommend a visit to eat at the Chinese restaurant. The experience does not match the high cost. Take a plane to Hong Kong and enjoy exceptional Cantonese food at a fraction of the cost.

Modern design. Fantastic service.Clean and comfortable rooms.Lovely breakfast, for every taste.Be sure to visit the hotel spa. After a wonderful massage, it is nice to relax in the whirlpool overlooking the city.

We loved this luxurious elegant hotel. Best city views of our life- sunrise was breathtaking and we had a view that we stared at for HOURS of Mt. Fuji from our room. Night views from the bar were spectacular- just great.Service here was outstanding. We were treated like royalty and it felt genuine.Breakfast was AMAZING. DO NOT MISS the Tapas dinner- seriously such a fun delicious amazing night- DO NOT MISS IT. Thanks for making Tokyo so special for us- this hotel just nailed it.I was leary of the location- but honestly- it felt great to be in a quieter ritzy part of Tokyo. We loved it and everything was accessible. Super great experience- worth every cent.

Downers:- Ordered roses pre-arrival to be set in the room as a surprise: the flowers were not placed in the room upon arrival, I needed to chase concierge after check-in, ruining the surprise- Bell-boy kept insisting for our passports in the fully-packed elevator- Saw a cockroach in my room- Refused entry into buffet breakfast because I was wearing slippers- Room service barged into my room with key without knocking- 38/F lobby smelled of smoke because of the lounge on the 37/FDefinitely not the kind of service I expected when I'm paying ~US$1k a night.

This hotel is very conveniently located in central Tokyo and it is very easy to the station, shopping districts, and metro system. Staff were exceptionally hospitable and able to communicate in English. I highly recommend visiting as well as enjoying the range of high quality restaurants at the hotel.

Short stay following trip to snow as a family of 4 (2 boys age 10 and 15 plus my wife and I) . 2 interconnecting rooms with views. Service was excellent in every way. Concierge booked some events and dinners for us which made everything very easy for us.

We experienced impeccable service with staff that attended to every need. It almost seemed that they read your mind before you could even articulate your request. I will surely come back! Thank you very much.

Great place with great service and fantastic views of Mt Fuji. Try the Tapas Molecular restaurant which is an amazing experience. Spa jacuzzi is also great again with great Mt Fuji views whilst resting on level 37

I was impressed by everything they served. It was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at with heartwarming and sophisticated room and services. Wonderful place to relax. I will definitely stay there again.

We stayed for my wife's birthday and the hotel did not disappoint. Amazing views from the rooms, and the facilities were incredible. Nice restaurants and a fantastic bar overlooking the Tokyo skyline. Expensive room rates, but if you can afford then definitely worth the money! Hope to go back one day..

I’ll make this short and simple. You will not find a better hotel in Tokyo with a better staff. I’ve never experienced such hospitality and kindness. This was our second time staying there. It was even better than the first. Great Spa. Great bar. Amazing views. A++

Recently stayed at the MO Tokyo on vacation in January 2018. This was our second visit and as usual the service and staff were excellent. Super convenient location next to the subway and shopping. We had a superb Chinese meal at Sense, and definitely one of the best for Cantonese cuisine in the world. Wonderful stay and special thanks to Rix and Ayaka for their warm welcome and delightful conversation in the lounge. We will return as soon as we can and highly recommend.

My boyfriend brought us here as a surprise anniversary meal on our last night of a 3 week trip to Japan. The hotel really is stunning and the staff made us feel incredibly welcome. We had the Chinese vegetarian set menu and I really cannot say enough good things about the food. The flavours were incredible and the courses seemed to just keep coming. The staff were great at adapting some dishes to meet our dietary needs and even swapped one for a glass of rose wine. We were seated with an incredible city view and enjoyed a cocktail at the bar after dinner. A truly unforgettable experience. Only improvement I can suggest is to impose a smarter dress code as some guests weren't dressed smartly, but it did not impact on our evening.

I cannot recommend the mandarin Oriental in Tokyo highly enough. It is everything you expect a Mandarin Oriental Hotel to be and more.The hotel itself, food and service is wonderful but the genuinely warm staff are what make people come back.

World class facility in convenient location located on a subway stop. Rooms are spacious, well appointed and offer spectacular views. Access to rooms requires transfer in Lobby on 38th floor. Exercise area is small with more Nima lumber of machines.The hotel imposes a 15% service charge on the price of every room and all services secured by the concierge are again marked up. I regularly stay in comparable hotels and expect more transparency in the rate.

It was my first time visiting Tokyo and also the first time staying at a Mandarin Oriental. The service is beyond my expectation. If you were as lucky as me to check in at evening, the city view in the lobby is so stunning and breath taking. The room design use lots of light color wood combine with dark color large desk , the decoration over the bed and sink in the bathroom. Overall they might not be as luxury as some other top end hotels, but elegant, simple and very Japanese. The location is in the business district. There are so many restaurants and stores within 5 minutes walking radius of the hotel, which people can enjoy all type of japanese food and looking for gifts and souvenirs. Two of my favorites are Naku, the 24/7 open fast food chain. Use machine to order beef bowls etc. The other is Kiya, which sells kitchen tools include the iconic Japanese knives. The oldest High end Luxury department store Mitsukoshi is on the other side of the street. The basement is heaven for all foodies, traditional japanese food, beautiful wagashi, fresh made sashimi, sushi and the ultimate kobe beef which doesn't come cheap. Heading north, about 20 minutes walking to Yodabashi Camera in Akihabara. Heading south, about 15 minutes walking to Tokyo station and another 15 minutes to Ginza shopping area.The concierge is exceptional, help me locate the items I look for within a few hours. I want special thank to the night shift crew Daisuke, Satomi and Kodai. I couldn't sleep due to jet lag during my 4 night stay, so I went to front desk every night and had some very nice and warm chat with them around 3AM. I also went to the bar after they closed. Though they were busy on the paperwork, we still had happy conversation. Overall, Tokyo Mandarin Oriental deserves the reputation of the best service hotel.There are restaurants in the lobby. Sushi Sora is excellent. The standard buffet breakfast is decent which offers large selection of food. But I highly recommend the Oriental Lounge which offers traditional Japanese breakfast set.I could only come up with two drawbacks about Tokyo MO. One is lack of a swimming pool. The other is regarding the Japanese breakfast set at Oriental Lounge, the salmon has too much salt.

I had a such great stay at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo! It was my family’ Birthday, hotel prepared so well to welcome us, we will very touched by the thoughtfulness and surprises. There is subway right below the hotel, very convenient, good location, good service, good atmosphere!!! For sure I would choose Mandarin Oriental Tokyo again!!!!

My first time ever staying at a mandarin oriental. They exceeded all of my expectations. The concierge was on point and helped us with every single detail - they even took care of a misunderstanding with a restaurant that charged us a whole meal because we did not show up. Will recommend this hotel to anyone staying in tokyo - over any other hotel. The breakfast buffet is by far the best buffet we have ever tried and any hotel!Stayed at the aman hotel on our way back from kyoto and it is almost double the price but half of the service - was not worth it. We should’ve stayed at the mandarin again. Hope this helps when deciding where to stay.

As always, Mandarin Oriental hotels would not come cheap. Could not find any good deals for a room but it was ok. The room itself is wonderful. Classic and decent. The service is top notch as well. The Concierge desk told us a lot of good places to go with clear directions. They can also help book a table! Definitely 5-stars.

MO is one of the best hotel chains in the world, in my experience. But Tokyo MO beats all the other MO's (that I have visited) hands down.Rooms are great. Food was great (for veggies they should have pici pasta at k'shiki), I like a good breakfast spread - which they have...But to top this is the service level....exceptionally cordial (maybe b'coz it's a combination of MO and Japanese hospitality). It's expensive but if you can stay here, this is the place to stay in Tokyo.

My wife and I just had an incredible time in Tokyo staying at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. I need to mention we have stayed at five star hotels around the world and have never had this type of experience. All the staff and management went out of their way to ensure our comfort and experience were met within both the hotel and Tokyo. We felt like VIP guests throughout our stay.Our hotel room was comfortable and wow, what a view! Our room had plenty of room, comfortable bed, and roomy bathroom. The housekeeping staff did a great job and very courteous even bringing multi pillows for my wife to ensure she had the right one. The hotel had multi restaurants though we did not visit them all, we wanted to mention our experience at the hotel bar and where we had our buffet breakfast each morning. The hotel bar was attentive and made sure we were comfortable though it’s our experience at the breakfast each day that made a big impact. We saw the same servers each morning and by our second day, they knew our likes. Our daily server was off on our last day and even though she was not working, she left a note with the new server of what we ordered each morning. My wife used the hotel spa and had a relaxing and pleasant experience. The hotel concierge desk was outstanding. They went above and upon our expectations each day. They spent time with us to plan out our short trip in Tokyo and make sure we knew our way. They booked two dinners for us and both were great however one was a Michelin Star restaurant which was very difficult to get a reservation. The hotel was situated conveniently above a subway line and walking distance to the Imperial Palace and shopping. The entire hotel staff from the bellhops to management did an outstanding job each day. We have a friend who will be visiting Tokyo in the spring with reservations at a different hotel and we have mentioned to her to change her reservations to stay at the Mandarin. Great Job and thanks for a wonderful stay!

Nice place to have a drink or lunch amaaaaazziiiing view of Tokyo and we are in Tokyo so the attention to the customers is amazing even more in a luxury place like that The atmosphere is also very nice

Been here multiple timesPros:- Great direct access to the train station- Spacious room- Friendly service- Delicious breakfast buffet with much variety- Great city viewCons:- Toilet area in bathroom sometimes can stink and could be cleaner- Bathroom can be brighter and bigger- No kids pool

we loved this hotel. We celebrated our new year there and had a great time. The staff go way out of their way to make you feel welcomed and ensure that you are taken care of throughout rooms are clean

First of all, the people that gave 5 star reviews that claim they've stayed in luxurious hotels across the global; Aman, St. Regis, Four Seasons, Ritz-Carlton, and Rosewood, must have been wearing earplugs, an eye mask, and a nose plug when they stayed at this property. I have been a long time "fan" of the Mandarin properties and have frequented various properties of theirs around the world including London, Hong Kong, Paris, New York, Geneva, and Las Vegas - which has a gorgeous Mandarin Suite and phenomenal spa by the way. We even had friends warn us about their experience before staying there but we booked anyway thinking, it's the Mandarin - how can it be bad? The cigarette smoke hits your nose the moment you step off the elevator into the lobby. It was so pungent on every floor of the hotel and everywhere else except the gym - which was our only solace from the stench. I was dumbfounded as our room was non-smoking yet it reeked (please see photo of air filter). They had air filters or what seemed to be some sort of air purifiers on the floors but they did not provide any relief. Secondly, the rooms have not been updated since the hotel opened in 2005 (even though it looks like it's from 1995). The wood furniture was damaged and chipped, the black sink had caulk or silicone everywhere as a bandaid repair for whatever damage was underneath. The wallpaper was peeling on one corner and the bed was stiff with thin sheets. We could also hear the people on the floor above our room walking around which I've never experienced before. How thin are the floors? Seriously, this room felt so gross that we didn't want to spend any time in the room when normally I revel in lounging around and ordering room service in a 5 star hotel. The only saving grace was that the food at the restaurant was good, although the staff was not attentive. I'm sorry to say that this experience has deterred me from future stays at other Mandarin properties because of the mere fact that they would even operate this hotel under their prestigious brand. I normally wouldn't make a fuss but the fact that the hotel still charged an arm and a leg for a horrible room but I guess since other patrons are willing to overlook normal amenities then I guess they do not have to improve or update in any way. We traveled around Japan for a week staying at the Shangri-la, Four Seasons Kyoto, Ritz Kyoto and all of them by far surpassed this hotel. The management can look up my previous stays at their other properties to verify.

It seems nothing can compare to the service of a Mandarin Oriental and Tokyo Mandarin was beyond the best. They anticipate your needs, do so many extra touches from services, staff. We stayed at 4 top hotels in Japan on this trip but the Mandarin was far above the others and happy that it was our last hotel - we hated to leave. It was relaxing, first class, warm, friendly and they thought of things to help us that we didn't know to do - from subways, trains, how to get to the airport, telling us how to get around the airport, city, shopping, etc. The breakfasts was superb and all food venues. The bar was beautiful and they even remembered what we drank and ate the 2nd night - impressive. The BEST

Absolutely top quality service. Highly attentive and personalized. All staff members from bell hop to check in to the resident bar tenders are amazing. They treat you like a regular customer from your first stay on. Accommodations are excellent as you would expect. Great spa. Didn't use the workout facilities but id expect they are top quality as well just by extension.
user_name:
FreqBizTrvlr
New York City, New York

review_body: The Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo is a fantastic hotel. The rooms are very spacious and well designed and the level of attention to detail is top rate. Housekeeping was excellent. The location of the hotel was ideal, with direct access to the metro system to a station located next to the building where the hotel is located. What sets the Mandarin Oriental apart is its staff. Their level of attention to their guests needs goes above and beyond what you might normally expect. The staff at the Mandarin Oriental made a great stay in Tokyo into a truly memorable one.

We stayed in MO for 2 nights this summer, and this is the best hotel experience we ever had in Japan, I would say. From the very beginning when we checked-in, all the staff were well-mannered and always act professionally. MO even offers free spa and sauna, not to mentioned 24-7 fitness center. And surprisingly, you could rent sneakers for free if you don't have one with you doing the work-out.The breakfast is pretty good as well.MO tokyo absolutely have my high-five in overall rating, and I've booked another 2 nights in the coming vacation.It's not only worth a stay, it's the best luxury accommodation you have to spend a night in Tokyo.

You really can’t appreciate the vastness of Tokyo until you see it from above, and this must be one of the best places to enjoy it. Beautiful Lounge, drinks, staff - and the most amazing view of the city. Don’t miss the bathrooms!

We stayed one night only and were so amazed by the hotel facilities, design and the view. View from the room was just breathtaking. Most importantly, we were blown away by the professionalism of the team that welcomed us so warmly- we were wowed from check in til the next day at check out. What an impressive hotel and special mention to Jenny Miu at the front office and Jihyun Yee at the guest relations.Nadia & Jules

As a loyal fan to the Mandarin Oriental hotel group, I have to say that the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo is one of the best properties worldwide. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city with easy access to main shopping areas and business districts. The hotel occupies the top floors of a commercial building and the views from the hotel were simply breathtaking. On one side you could see the Tokyo Sky Tree, while on the other you could see Mount Fuji. The service at this hotel was excellent as your would expect at any mandarin oriental hotel, however Japanese hospitality elevates the experience furthermore. The rooms were extremely spacious and I enjoyed the Bottega Veneta Amenities very much, Kumiko at the concierge desk was so very helpful and arranged hair salon and restaurant reservations for me during my stay. The hotel is very calm and never crowded in public areas. The spa was fantastic although I did find it quite odd that they only offer hotel residents complimentary access to the heat and water facilities in the morning. Overall I truly enjoyed my stay at the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo and I look forward to returning soon.

Excellent Hotel. No doubt about it!!I have been using to stay this hotel at least 5 years now.I live in US and I stay this hotel every time I visit Japan 4 - 5 times a year.I feel very comfortable to stay there, all hotel staffs are very nice and they know how totreat guests. The room is very nice and clean as well. My wife loves to stay this hotel as well. Both of us enjoy to stay, enjoy to talk to hotel staffs and eat delicious foods in hotel restaurants.I just stayed there last week and I will be back to MOTYO in Feb' 2018 with my wife.Thank you very much MOTYO!!

My husband and me returned to MO Tokyo for our anniversary stay and the stay was as best as those stays before. A lot to mention about how excellent the hotel is but not to repeat the previous comments that we posted on tripadvisor we just want to say one thing here: the hospitality that this great hotel provides keeps on to be perfect. We love the hotel and simply look forward to our next visit there. Thankful to the staff who exemplifies true hospitality.

what a place. rooms are great, views impressive, you just want to sit in the room and watch the horizon, a wide range of restaurants. makes it tough to leave the hotel. also staff is very nice, polite and professional. only disappointment was the prices of the spa: overpriced compared to competitors.

I am a fan of Mandarin Group and this is my second year staying in hotel to celebrate my birthday with my family! It was a big surprise that as long as I got off from taxi, the doorman said “ Happy Belated Birthday! “ to me … If I remember correctly his name is Li Bing and he is a gem in this hotel! This gem makes me feel “ at home” and being valued !The room is as cozy as usual and wake up by the view of Mount Fuji. Shibuya-san at Front Office made an efficient check-in with the nice back drop of Tokyo night view. Special thanks to Concierge Team – Kyoko Okada, who helped us to book the restaurant so that I could enjoy the best eel rice in Tokyo! Really appreciate that they tried their utmost effort on helping us to book all the restaurants last minute in our journey. Also, the extra touch made by the housekeeping staff is exemplary! My daughter got a little stuffed toy and every night after turn-down she made the puppy slept so well in bed and my daughter felt so sweet.Thank you for making our stay memorable and I hope I will see you on my next birthday! Look forward to the Tapas Bar and Pizza bar..

The Mandarin Oriental was the perfect hotel to stay at, from the food to the rooms, amenities and the staff were amazing and we cannot wait to come back to this beautiful hotel and city! Everywhere we went we were treated with respect and everyone willing to help!

The hotel is located on the upper floors of a high-rise building. Reception was on 38th floor. Our room was on 31st floor. To leave our room and exit the hotel, we had to take the elevator from the 31st floor to the 38th, walk about 50 meters through the reception area and then take another elevator to street level.Location of hotel. We took taxis everywhere we went. To Asakusa and Skytree tower cost about 1500 yen. To Disney Sea cost 6500 yen. To Kabukiza Theatre cost 1200 yen. Hotel to Shinkansen station was also 1200 yen. Obviously, prices vary depending on the traffic and road works.Check-in good. Room ready at 1pm. Helpful information from Concierge about places to visit in the vicinity and how to get there. We were told that there was a hop-on-hop-off bus service which passed close to the hotel every 20 minutes. We found the bus stop, but no buses arrived. It seems that that service does not operate in the winter months.Room:One of the most pleasant hotel rooms we have stayed in worldwide!! Great view, even Mount Fuji on a clear day. Large windows. Curtains providing complete blackout. Also, a blind for privacy.Single hand basin in bathroom. Large bath and separate shower area. Dark Marble floors in bath area. TV in bathroom and sound bedroom from TV..Most of the floor area was a light wood with carpet around the beds. Much of the wooden floor area was badly marked probably from guests dragging heavy bags across the floor. Also damaged by heals.Light, curtains and privacy controls on small bedside console. 8 switches, several with dual function. Not easy to select the desired button especially at night..Large TV with external sound system. Many foreign channels.WiFi – we were told was not included, but we did not receive an extra charge. Probably a misunderstanding.Nespresso machine and kettle filled with filtered water. Tea and coffee. Fridge with minibar.Large writing desk with 2 office style chairs. 2 single beds. Large, slightly firm for our taste. We slept well (apart from the noise from the room above).Noise from people walking in the room above. It woke us at 5am on our first morning. Quite loud. Also, resonant mechanical noise at times, maybe from a water pump?A man was admitted to the breakfast room (having apparently just come from the fitness room) wearing shorts and carrying a towel. My wife and I (and judging from the reaction of Japanese guests) would have preferred if the person on reception had refused the man entry to the breakfast room until he was at least wearing trousers. Sometimes Japanese should be a little less tolerant of westerners who disrespect their culture and the other hotel guests.Apart from self-service breakfast, we did not eat at the hotel restaurants. In the lower floors of the hotel and across the road from the hotel there are several buildings with every kind of cuisine you can imagine.Pleasant lounge area to relax with live music on 37th floor.

Great room with a great view and good location above a subway station. The staff was very helpful on offering advice and making sure we got on the correct subway train. The hotel's concierge was also able to get us a reservation at Jiro (the original one in the documentary) which was a great experience. We ate at Sushi Sora in the hotel which was also great. Their airport pick-up also worked well.The only negative was the hotel concierge which we contact via e-mail a number of times before our stay. Each time we followed up on restaurant reservations or the airport pick up they initially acted like we were starting from scratch until we reminded them we had already enquired or given them our flight info. They need a better system for tracking these things. It also took them several days to respond each time (slower than other hotels and guides we used on the same trip in Asia).

Wonderful located in Nihonbashi this is really on of the best places for a luxury stay in Tokyo. The service is outstanding. The quality of the food is excellent. Don't miss the perfect breakfast with a view on Mount Fuji.

We keep coming back to this amazing hotel because of its incredible staff, gorgeous rooms (and views) and their great bar (I keep saying--try Ajisai!) The hotel is located in a central, very accessible place which means a lot in a metropolitan city like Tokyo. I am convinced they have the best concierge staff in the city, maybe the world. They go above and beyond (all of their staff members do) for their guests. Fully recommend.

I arrived at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo with three family members after a 13-hour flight and overall very long travel experience. To say we were jetlagged would be an understatement. What a welcome relief it was to arrive at the Mandarin Oriental. Check in was smooth and seamless with beautiful views of the city. We were escorted to our rooms immediately, one being a corner room and the other being a deluxe city view room with double queen beds. The rooms weren't adjoining but shared a small private entry hallway which was very convenient. I didn't make it to dinner however my family members said the food was delicious at the Italian restaurant located in the hotel. I took advantage of the pillow menu located in the room and was brought a body pillow within 5 minutes of calling in the request. The breakfast spread was absolutely wonderful and had a variety of freshly squeezed juices, made to order eggs, meats, cheeses, fruit, pastries, in addition to an array of traditional Japanese breakfast options. A member of the hotel staff escorted us to the train station and helped us with our bags so we made it onto the bullet train on time. I don't think we would have made it without his help and were truly impressed with his and the hotel's customer service during our stay. This was a great way to start off our trip to Japan and I highly recommend staying at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo if you are seeking a luxury hotel experience with attentive staff and wonderful service.

I’ve stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo many, many times. This last visit was one of the best, with the type of truly outstanding service that can distinguish one luxury hotel from another. Regarding basics: the rooms, views, restaurants, and location of the Mandarin are all excellent in every way. The hotel has a great location, whether you’re walking to shop, taking taxis or taking the subway (which is surprisingly easy to use). The rooms have every luxury you’d expect from a top hotel.During this visit, the Mandarin demonstrated over and over how much difference great service can make to a hotel experience. The concierge desk was helpful and thoughtful, the (excellent) restaurants went out of their way to be accommodating and generous, and the staff made us feel cared for at every step.

The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is the third location I have stayed at in the Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group. The service at this property was the best of them all. The staff here really try to anticipate your needs before you make the request. My room was on the 36th floor and offered a great view of the city - unfortunately Mt. Fuji was in hiding during my stay but you should be able to see it when the weather is cooperating. I would also like to mention how the fitness center exceeded my expectations. There was water, Pocari Sweat (sports drink), and two juice options available for dehydration. A good variety of strength training equipment supplemented the exercise bikes, treadmills, and dumbbells. My only complaint would be that it's a little further from Tokyo Station than some other hotels but the closest metrostation includes the Ginza line - which is a popular metro line so it's not that big of an inconvenience.

I only had two-nights in Tokyo and decided to try MO for the first time. Located next to Mitsukoshi in Nihombashi, it’s right above the Ginza line Mitsukoshi-Mae station exit A7. I was greeted with a beautiful view of Tokyo Sky Tree at check-in on the 38th floor, and enjoyed the same views from my room and at the spa every morning (free from 6:30-9am). The staff were extremely friendly and attentive! I was able to get a perfect table to enjoy cocktails and live music at the Mandarin Bar, and breakfast was always by the window. It was everything I would expect from one of Tokyo’s finest hotels, although not the largest in town. The porter even walked my luggage down to the subway on departure. I will be back for sure

Walking into the reception of this hotel is just beautiful...the views are great and the rooms are beautifully done...so comfortable. Breakfast was a delight, had one meal which was lovely and the bar area for after dinner relaxing was a perfect place to wind down after work. Would love to go back!

This is one of the best hotels in Tokyo. It has everything you need and close to Tokyo station by walking. The quality of the rooms and sleep is the best i've seen. The customer service is perfect. I always have a great stay there. It is expensive which is the only thing I can see a fault in this hotel.

The rooms and amenities are delightful and the location only a mile and a half from the Ginza district makes this very convenient. Restaurants in the hotel are excellent and the concierge service is superb. The views from higher floors are spectacular and on occasion one can see Mt. Fuji.

Big sized rooms, excellent service. Good view , english is widely spoken by all staffs. Busines center small and not convenient u need to go all the way down to level 3, Internet browser in Japanese. Over all hotel is value for money

Our 1st trip to Japan and 1st hotel.Very impressed with everything.Check on was at 38th floor with a lovely view.Pleasantly surprised when everyone including house keeping spoke perfect English.It is located a short distance( taxi or train) from Ginza.

We had a recent outstanding stay at the MO Tokyo, and rate it as our best experience in Japan (and we’ve stayed in some of the finest in the country). Several exceptional instances include:• The room service team was extremely accommodating, customizing the menu to our needs and preferences. All of our orders were delivered fresh and hot, and always with a smile. Dining in was such a treat that despite the great temptations outside the hotel, we were often contented with dining in the comforts of our suite.• The staff and cuisine at K’shiki are exceptional. We hosted a dinner one night and could not have asked for better service and attention (despite having restless children at the table). The pizza was one of the best that I have ever tasted – better than even the “original” in Italy (and New York!). Breakfast was served efficiently and again our off-menu requests were accommodated without any fuss. The vibe was casual but the service and food were up there with the best establishments.• We were extremely thrilled with the special treats that we received everyday – be it a carefully curated souvenir from the local craftsmen or a creatively concocted dessert for the children (a pizza made of fruit, tic-tac-toe game made of cookies and chocolate, fruit parfait made to resemble a dolphin … what works of art!). This really goes a long way towards providing us with a personal and unforgettable experience – and not just another run-of-the-mill “5-star hotel stay”. In this day of customized luxury, I must compliment you for being ahead of the game.• Finally, I'd like to compliment the senior team for taking such a hands-on approach to managing the property. We met the director and assistant director of rooms, assistant director of F&B, restaurant manager also had the privilege of meeting the GM during our brief stay. The attention to detail and lead-from-the-front ethos shone through and go a long way to explain why in my opinion this is one of the best “home away from home” that one can experience. This stay has definitely cemented my faith of and loyalty to the MO brand, and unfortunately I will now measure all other hotels against this very high benchmark which means a high probability of disappointment! I remain a Fan – and even more so now, and look forward to my next visit!

well excellent mandarin oriental (my first one )but take care of booking at the japanese restaurant for only 8 people that costed us 250 dollars the meal! They have also a french restaurant ,a tapas one (spanish) and an italian more casual.All very good food.Beautiful reception on ground floor and also on 30th floor where you can see mount fuji in the distance.What a hotel! Very modern but still very japanese!

Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo, has one of the best views of Tokyo. It's worth spending at least one night here. Front desk, restaurants, bars and overall the elegant and comfortable Rooms offer some of the best views of Tokyo. Rooms are big and very comfortable, with amazing bathrooms. Accommodating staff and service -Great and well-priced breakfast, both: oriental & occidental options. Excellent spa/sauna access in the morning with incredible views. Mitkusoshimae subway station is in the basement of the hotel. As in all Japan, the best of the Mandarin Oriental is its people! The staff is incredible! Japan is a beautiful country, Tokyo is an amazing city, and the best place to stay is the Mandarin Oriental! We loved it and it made our vacation.

Visited MOTYO on a Family trip recently - and there is not much to complain about. Perfect atmosphere, spacious rooms, all possible amenities, wonderful spa and spa Team sums up to perfect Japanese Hospitality. Buffet breakfast could be a little bit larger (more fruits, more breads) but in fact it is just a outstanding hotel.

It was not our first visit to Tokyo but our first time staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo. This hotel is by far the most excellent hotel we have ever stayed at in Tokyo. From the arrival experience to the quality of the room and amenities we could find no fault. The staff at every turn were warm, polite and always accommodating. It was also comforting for us that everyone working in the hotel spoke English fluently. Special shout out to the entire concierge team that helped us plan our visit seamlessly, to Kai Jansen for noticing that I was not well in the morning during breakfast and had deconstructed ginger tea sent to me and to Yue Yamasa for making our evening cocktails at Mandarin Bar ever so enjoyable!

The Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo is a superb hotel with superior service and a room with a view. Its one of the few hotels in Tokyo that offers a free fitness club. The bar is awesome and allows for an easy after dinner experience

2N stay... A charity bid packageFirst I want to thank MO Tokyo for making the arrangement to extend the validity of the charity coupon and was still able to serve us when I left the coupon at home.Pro:- Fantastic room. I liked it better than Peninsula Tokyo- Top quality furnishing and well maintained- Brilliant service. Hats off to Ms. Miu who was excellent- Great food at The SenseCons:- Nothing but I guess if I had to name one, I prefer Peninsula's locationOverall, top hotel! Well done... Slightly sad that my charity bid was by far more expensive than booking direct but all in the name of charity...

We stayed for six nights in a deluxe room at the start of a three week trip around Japan. Our room was on the 34th floor with great views out across the city - this is the entry level of accommodation, and included a generous seating area and a desk. We certainly didn't need anything larger. The bed was extremely comfortable with a firm mattress (which we prefer) and a pillow menu offering a choice of around a dozen different pillows. The bathroom had a generous size bath, and a large walk-in shower. The service was excellent and everything was spotlessly clean. Good quality buffet breakfast. Our only complaint was the absence of a nespresso machine in our room, which at this price level, we have come to expect.

Just visited Tokyo few days ago , and I went to Mandarin Oriental Tokyo for a cup of Latte and a piece of cake at the coffee shop of the hotel. First , my eyes were caught by the shape of the cake Kumo , which is the autumn edition of the chef. The shape of the cake is like the clouds , and the detailed introduction card of the cake let me want to give it a try. After eating the cake , I found it brilliant. Although Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is a luxurious hotel , people still can find something affordable such as this cake there.

Stunning service is just the start of this review but it’s the start and end of the experience at this hotel. From pulling into the forecourt of the hotel upon arrival at 1am after an hour queuing at HND airport to clear immigration, the bellman had already worked out we must have been the last guests checking in, so when he opened the car door we were greeted by name...now that’s GOOD!Escorting guests around the hotel is something the staff always do, so you never feel you might get lost...which is good as you check in on one floor, then get lifts to your room floor that are below the floor you checked in on...you get used to it. The rooms are stunning! Everything you possibly need is already in place. Water, coffee machine, amenities, plug sockets (lots of them, including a universal one). Japan is famous for its automated toilets, they take some getting used to but I really think we need them in Europe. Breakfast is a wonderful spread of various cuisines. The bar area is chic and has a mixed crowd, it’s not too stuffy and very relaxed. There is a Lounge area for Afternoon Tea and after dinner drinks. I also visited the Spa...the sauna has floor to ceiling windows with views of the city, quite an experience. The gym is a good size with lots of equipment, better than most hotel gyms with healthy snacks and drinks.In EVERY area of this hotel the staff are exceptional. A true 5 star experience. Congratulations to the management on creating a workforce who want to help and will anticipate a guests’ needs. One of th best hotel experiences I’ve EVER had.

Highly rated, not a large property which we liked, but the property was splendid, immaculately maintained, the room was large, great view, and whisper quiet. Housekeeping service was excellent. We took advantage of dining in a coupe of the restaurants including the pizza bar and the French 'signature', both excellent. The bar was always busy, service solid. Check in and check out smooth, super fast free WiFi. All in all an excellent stay, we will return. Oh and easy access to the underground train system - access to the Ginza line is in the basement of the hotel building.

My stay in Tokyo was fantastic due in part to the beautiful Mandarin Oriental Hotel. The service was some of the best I've ever received! Views were breathtaking. When you walk in you are made to feel as a very honored guest.

First of all I would like to thank to the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo's concierge team who did realize my Sukiyabashi Jiro lunch reservation. There was a direct acces to the hotel from the Mitsukoshimae subway station.The lobby was located in the 38th floor. Reception staff was very kind and I had an upgrade to a Shinjuku view room with an amazing sights of the city and the mount Fuji far away. The room was large, beautiful and comfortable. Bathroom with la Bottega amenities was amazing. After check-in, I had a complimentary green tea service in the room and a prayer rug, what a detail this was because they knew I was coming from a muslim country. Mandarin Bar serving super cocktails was beautiful The breakfast with views was buffet style with high quality ingredients and with some japanese cheeses I had never tasted before. The spa was amazing with a nice small pool type jacuzzi and sauna facing Shinjuku. In this hotel every coin had amazing views even the restroom in the lobby area. Next time in Tokyo I would like to try afternoon tea in the hotel's tea lounge.

One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at (city wise). Every member of staff was amazing, the food, room service and helpfulness of everyone made me feel like a million dollars! You defiantly get what you pay for.

The hotel staff members are so kind and helpful. Everyone knows your name and basic information (in a small notebook) in order to provide further service. The spa is small but good enough to be categorised as a luxury hotel. This hotel combines mandarin culture, and Japanese style service, and I feel calm and peace when I entered the hotel lobby.

Staying at this hotel was a great choice! From check in the service and hospitality of the Staff was warm, welcoming yet unobtrusive. The room we had was on Level 32 and simply amazing - spacious, very comfortable, exceptional amenities and spotless with brilliant views of the city. Breakfast was a mix of Japanese and western fare, beautifully presented and served with a rich black coffee. We will definitely consider the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo for our next visit. Whilst the hotel is superb, the service tops the score.

One of the very best anywhere. Service was both friendly and outstanding. The concierge team are an absolute credit to the hotel; so professional, capable and proactive. The views over the Tokyo skyline are worth the stay alone but all the small touches make this place a truly luxurious place to stay. A good location too with a metro station and top quality department store in the lower floor levels

A super hotel with great ambiance with perfect location, Hotel lobby is in the 34 or the 36th floor i believe. Good hospitality. Excellent customer service. lovely view from room. spacious rooms. great food. The pool, Sauna and Jacuzzi are extremely good. spend 4 beautiful memorable nights.

Stayed at MO Tokyo for 2nights during my business trip in Japan for 1week. The service was excellent-the brand speaks for itself. When it comes to MO, everyone expects for perfection and that's exactly what we got. The check in was done in the room without having to wait at the lobby. They had 2 options for breakfast at K'shiki and Oriental lounge. We ended up having breakfast at K'shiki for both days as it offers an array of buffet as compared to Oriental lounge which serves ala-carte. Be sure to try their Signature crab egg Benedict/classic. It was to die for, I had them both days. The room was gorgeous and loved the bathroom and bathtub. Managed to spend sometime indulging the beautiful bathtub with Bottega Veneta amenities. Do check out the Mandarin Bar in the evening which overlooks the beautiful city skyline-a great spot to have a drink and unwind after a Long day. It's quite convenient to the train station, 10-minutes walk away and if you would like to get more adventurous it's about 20minutes walk to Ginza area, we walked both the nights to Ginza which was a great way to explore the surroundings and there are various eateries around the vicinity which will get you tempted to try. We didn't try the eateries unfortunately as we were too stuffed after heavy lunches/dinner Everyday. Hopefully the next time :)

The MO is a wonderful hotel in Tokyo. Five star service, beautiful rooms with awesome views. Concierge service is excellent. For a real treat try the pizza at the Bar on 38th! We ate it everyday for a late afternoon snack - special dough makes the difference. Excellent high end hotel that will make your trip to Tokyo special. Great location too!

From the check in done in the room to the check out, everything was close to perfect. Room was spacious and nicely decorated, welcome amenities excellent. Customer service reps checked on us multiple times during our stay, making sure that we were enjoying our stay. And we did! Breakfast was very good, and dinner at Sushi Sora and particularly at Tapas Molecular were exceptional. Difficult to find a better place to stay in Tokyo !

The hotel is perfect. Great staff, location and updated facility . I spent 4 nights with me wife and two small kids. When we left me wife forgot her mobile and hotel receptionist took a taxi and delivered the device at tokyo station as we were late for our train.

A very memorable experience to stay at this impressive hotel. Right from the entry to the beautiful lobby, every amenity and courtesy was perfectly in place. Attentive staff and great concierge. Peerless cocktails and great views. Excellent gym. Room was spacious and comfortable, especially by Tokyo standards, and I could not have asked for a better inaugural trip to Tokyo.

Really liked my stay at mandarin oriental Tokyo. Service was flawless. Food was great. Room was spacious, and location is convenient. I especially loved their blend tea. Should have bought some home. It was a pity that we didn't get to try the bar and the other restaurants. Will be very likely to stay there again for the next trip

MO Tokyo offers true hospitality. This was our 8th stay already and it has never failed to give us impressive experiences. We love it because the people there are true professionals. They know your preferences and pay good attention to your needs. We could relax both in our body and mind with the great care they offered. Time was just too short each time we stayed with them. Our conclusion now is: MO Tokyo is the hotel that we like the best. See you soon next time when we travel to Tokyo.Mr and Mrs Liu

Stayed here for a week in two joining suites with my children aged 16 and 12. Its the perfect set up for touring around all day and coming back to a hotel where you can cool down, relax and watch the sun set over Tokyo. My second time staying here and would recommend it highly.

There are various luxury hotels in Tokyo, but in my opinion this hotel is absolutely the best in Tokyo. Every time I visit Tokyo, I stay here. The service is excellent and the room is extremely clean. All the staffs are very pleasant. I highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel is located on the top floors so our corner room on floor 35 had exceptional views over all of Tokyo - best time is to open the blinds and watch the sun rise! Carpets and soft furnishings could do with an update for the price one is payingThe SPA massages are excellent but a bit pricey relative to others in Tokyo. Hot baths in SPA are worth a visit to sit in while watching the viewBreakfast are fine and service is efficientThe lobby and restaurants are on the two top floors with an atrium connecting them. The unfortunate thing is the smoking area in the bar is in the lower atrium and the lobby frequently smelt of smoke - not what one wants after coming in from a hot Tokyo dayWe did not find the meditranean restaurant on the third floor till our last lunch time - well worth a visit as it has an very appetising buffetThe connection to Ginza line G12 station via exit A7 is worth mastering as it avoids walks in the humid heat

This Hotel is on the floors 30 to 38 of a tall building in Nihonbashi, very close to Tokyo Station (only 10 minutes walk) and Ginza. We had a wonderful room on the 31st floor. The service is impeccable, all personal speaks excellent English (which is still not common in Japan) and they are really friendly and helpful. Every day you find a small present in your room (from fruit to small Japanese souvenirs). Just wonderful.
user_name:
FLuisi
New York City, New York

review_body: We spent 2 nights at MO and this was by far the best hotel for service we experienced in our 2 weeks in Japan and possibly the best service we have experienced anywhere, you don't need to ask the team here at MO they just know what you need without asking , one request for table in the lounge meant every other occasion all the team knew our seating preferences during our stay , I was in Japan to celebrate a special birthday and the whole team at MO made this a truly memorable experience , with a gorgeous cake , card from the staff and champagne. We had the extreme pleasure to share a dining experience at Molecular Tapas, wow wow - just incredible . Just one other thing to mention what a perfect location, with direct link to underground and shopping. Breakfast here is also a fantastic experience with a choice of 2 dinning areas for breakfast , really enjoyed the eggs Benedict with Lobster, again service at breakfast is perfect , the whole team at MO are the best

Simply brilliant. Best staff, amazing views, amazing location. Great gym, excellent restaurants. Rooms outstanding. I cannot think of a hotel anywhere in the world as good, (but then again you do pay a lot).

Beautiful hotel! Very nice location. Subway station underneath the hotel . Walkable to Tokyo station, Mitsubishi department store. The hotel has great restaurants! No swimming pool . Wish the gym could be a little bit bigger.

I was amazed by the city views from my room (floor 36). A superb hotel with superb staff. The perfect place to relax after a tourism day around the city. Every detail has been meticulously taken cared of, nothing to complain about. I'll come back whenever I can.

We arrived at the Mandarin Tokyo yesterday and had very high expectations for the property. We travel all over the world and only stay at top level hotels and resorts. I can say with confidence that the Mandarin Tokyo is not one of them. After checking into the room, my wife wanted to take a nap as we had taken a 13 hour flight to get to Tokyo. We were asked when we wanted turndown service and we had requested 7PM for each evening. I went out for a walk and housekeeping came into the room without knocking and proceeded to start the turndown service while my wife was sleeping in bed around 5PM. She woke up and thought I had come home from my walk and was shocked to see a stranger standing in our room. I reported the incident and someone did come to the room to apologize but this should never happen in any hotel. Today, we left our room at 1230PM and asked to have the room cleaned as soon as possible as we had slept in this morning. We arrived back after 4PM and housekeeping was just walking into the room. We wanted to shower but we didn't have clean towels or a clean room. I don't understand how this lapse of service could happen at any good property let alone a Mandarin.We also had issues at the breakfast buffet. Most of the hot food on the buffet was cold and many of the pots holding the items were left empty for a period of time. We also had dirty plates left on our table throughout the meal despite having asked to have them removed.Last but not least, the concierge service has not been good. We emailed the concierge in advance of our trip asking for help with restaurant reservations. Five days have passed since our first email and they were only able to secure one reservation for us. We also had several conversations with the concierge to discuss the restaurants and we had an issue with a language barrier earlier today and they also gave us a horrible recommendation for lunch where we had to leave the restaurant because the smell was so bad.This is not a good start to our wedding anniversary trip and I will not be returning or recommending the Mandarin Tokyo to my colleagues or friends.

This is an extremely nice property in a great location. The bar is world class and a place to meet the glitterati of this stylish city. An asian dream come true. And dont forget to do two hours on the treadmill overlooking the vast grey cityscape.Rooms are nice, the people even nicer. Service beyond excellent and the concierges can score impossible reservations if you give them time.

It has all the ingredients of a 5 star and the MO touch. We liked the warm welcome and the room was comfortable. Yet we did not feel the magic that you might have in Bangkok and Barcelona which is related to the location. However the hotel is always worth a stay

This hotel aligns to everything you expect for a Mandarin Oriental. Staff are impeccable, anticipate needs and are discreet. The food is excellent across the various restaurants.I used the spa and it was fantastic.The rooms are spacious and comfortable and are well looked after. My only negative point is that they are somewhat dated in their design and some of the furniture looks tired. For example, the TV is a fairly dated model and the bathrooms are slightly small compared to the rest of the space. With some simple refreshments the hotel would beyond excellent.

Stayed for business at the Mandarin Oriental for a week. The room, the view, the attention, the breakfast... everything, absolutely everything was top notch. One of the best hotels you'll stay in your lifetime...

from the booking process to the greeting upon arrival to the spacious accommodations to the otherworldly spa, the mandarin oriental tokyo is everything you could ask for. the concierges are attentive and truly helpful. when we had a problem with a taxi driver dropping us off with no direction for dinner, the hotel concierge stayed on the phone with us, connected with the restaurant and had the maitre d come out to the street to find us. this was indicative of the superb service we experienced throughout our stay.

Had larger suite this past July and immediately noticed the service from all. It was exceptional and much above the level of most M.E. and European luxury hotels. Suite was large and comfortable (could have had a better, more comfortable couch as the only exception). Degustation dinner was fine dining with fresh and tasty/delicious courses. View from room of only downtown Tokyo. Spa was quite excellent and serenely restful, visually and with sound of gentle water.Other dining options were a bit out in the open and a bit more noise, but most of the diners were Japanese and whose manners we could all learn from (me too).

We had a wonderful stay at The MO Tokyo. The service in every part of the hotel was incredible. The concierge staff was amazing- assisting with dining reservations and my myriad questions on every topic as this was my family's first trip to Asia. All staff bent over backwards to help us with everything and were so friendly and hospitable. The breakfast buffet was fantastic as was dinner at Sense. The rooms were very large and the location was perfect with a subway stop beneath the building.My only complaint would be the strong smell of cigarette smoke in the lobby area. We are very sensitive to smoke and it did not make a pleasant impression when arriving each day. Further, we might have enjoyed more time in the bar area if the smoke wasn't as pervasive. I will say that it didn't bother us at all in our rooms at all.I would definitely come back again on a future stay!

Amazing hotel, we had a wonderful time and wished we had stayed there the whole time we were in Tokyo. Check in by Shiki of their FOH team was outstanding including her follow up and customer service and care, booking a restaurant for us and also tickets on the Airport Express train. The views are spectacular and we loved the cocktail bar including the view over the city at night. all in all an amazing experience and we thoroughly enjoyed it and vowed to come back next time we visit Tokyo.
user_name:
Mark C
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: The MO Tokyo is located on the top floors of the Mitsui Tower in the Nihonbashi area. It is a short taxi ride from Tokyo station. I could not give the hotel 5 stars, but if I could, I would have given them 3.5 stars. FIRST IMPRESSION - On arrival, we took the elevator to the 38th floor hotel lobby. As soon as we walked out of the elevators, we could smell cigarette smoke. The Mandarin bar mostly consists of smoking tables and is located one floor down from the lobby, connected by stairs, so the smoke persists in drifting upwards to the lobby. Not a pleasant welcome at all. The lobby also can be very busy as there are many sofas and chairs, so you never feel this is an "exclusive" hotel. LOCATION - Nihonbashi is more a commercial district than a tourist district. There are many restaurants nearby in Coredo, but most of them do not have English menus (not even photos), and if they do, the menu is very limited. The hotel is a short walk from the Mitsukoshimae station which is very convenient if as services on both the Ginza and Hanzōmon Lines. SERVICEEvery staff member at this hotel goes the extra mile for guests. They call you by name, and are always one step ahead. This is the only thing I cannot fault this hotel for. RESTAURANTSThe hotel has many small restaurants. We dined at 3 of them during our stay. Sushi Sora was an amazing experience. We were disappointed with the breakfast at K'shiki, as the buffet was very small and crowded, and the restaurant has poor sound insulation, which means it is very noisy. We just didn't think what was offered in the breakfast buffet was anything outstanding for MO. Next morning we went to the Oriental Lounge for their set Western and Japanese breakfast, and although it was a much more quieter experience, the Western breakfast was lacking in presentation and taste. Room Service is also very thoughtful as they replaced a drink that had been spilled. BARThe hotel seems to run its F&B outlets mostly for non-hotel guests and such is the case for the bar. 70% of the bar tables are for smokers. Non-smoking tables are near the windows but behind the live band, so you don't hear the music. If you want to listen to the music, you have to sit in the smoking area. The service here was very good though and again, cannot be faulted.SPALocated on the 37th floor, the spa has great views from the Heat and Water facilities. However, most of the treatment rooms are small and do not have windows. The treatments we had were good but not worth the price charged.ROOMSWe would not recommend the corner rooms as they have an odd layout. The views and layout of the deluxe rooms are much better, but the bathroom is not as nice. We were bit disappointed the toilet did not even have a dryer. If you pay over 50,000Yen for a room a night, you would expect a better Japanese toilet with automatic open/close and dryer. Overall, even though the service was top notch, we could not rate the MO with 5 stars. The hotel didn't feel like an exclusive 5 star hotel due to too many people, smoke filled lobby, and disappointing breakfasts. We will not come back to stay, however we definitely will come back to Sushi Sora.

I stayed 2 nights at the Mandarin Oriental and can say easily it is worth every penny. The staff is very friendly and was happy to invite me in a little early. They were still preparing my room so they provided me complimentary esspresso and cookies. The view is the best in Tokyo and the hotel is located close to the subway lines so access to the city is at the base of the building or by walking right outside. It is very close to the gardens and you can walk to several things if you wanted to. The room is amazing just to look at as well as to look out. The view is simply amazing. Ultimatly, the comfort is on par with the rest of the hotel. I slept like a baby and throroughly enjoyed the level of attention they paid ensuring the comfort of my stay. A+

Top quality in all aspects including services, food and beverages and the room. My friend is vegetarian and their Restaurant does provide vegetarian options that fits us well. The staff are all helpful and willing to give us help proactively whenever we looks in doubt.

A thoroughly enjoyable stay at this excellent property in the centre of Tokyo with the convenience of the Tokyo subway just 3 mins from the hotel. Special thanks to Ms Fiona Villa, Front Desk Assistant Manager who ensured that my stay would be exceptional. It's this kind of attention that encourages my continued loyalty to the MO Group. It is appreciated that my loyalty with the various MO properties is recognised; where one may get an enhanced service. However, as with the many hotel loyalty programs notably the World of Hyatt, SPG & Hilton Honors, this system will further enhance the transparency & capture ones patronage with the group to obtain instant recognition. The rooms were spacious and beautifully appointed. However, perhaps there were some interior touches that need to be updated. The bathroom was a little too small where 2 basins would have been more convenient. And would love to have had a Japanese wooden tub to differentiate from the other MOs which would have complimented the Japanese style WC. The bathroom amenities were a joy, Bottega Veneta toiletries and even the fine design details of the cotton swabs, where those of my generation & culture would appreciate. In conclusion I would definitely recommend this hotel where the software & hardware were impeccable & where I look forward to my next stay at the MO Tokyo. Alan Leong Singapore

Mandarin was beyound our expectations. Well located and good value for what where are looking for, it helped us to consider Tokyo (Japan overall) a must come back place."In dubio pro" Mandarin always.

I returned again only 6 months after my last visit and made sure to extend my trip this time and stay a full 4 nights. Can't believe it was possible but it exceeded last years trip and then some. Everyone in the hotel made me feel so welcome and I was greeted by name by pretty much everyone from bell, to breakfast staff, to spa, to concierge they all seemed to know your name and give you a friendly smile. Special thanks to Raul and Masumi for all their help, especially with all the restaurant reservations (they got me a seat at Jiro, my first time after many tries). I am already planning my next trip back. Not that you'll necessarily need outside reservations, I think you could spend a week trying all the options at the hotel itself, Sushi Sora is top notch. And the breakfast every day is divine, best French toast in the world. I could go on and on about this hotel.You won't be disappointed.
user_name:
Anonymous760D
New York City, New York
