After learning the ways and reading the subway maps, we could get anywhere in the city easily. There is some shopping and sushi in the immediate area, but we did not feel it was hard to get anywhere. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Tokyo. However it was too brief! We will be back and will always choose a Mandarin now in our travels in the future!

My second stay at Mandarin Tokyo. This trip my friends stayed elsewhere but I stayed here on my own. Very impressed with the hotel's service. The doorman downstairs already has a list of names of guests to expect. At check in was immediately given the maps and Japanese directions to the restaurants that I've booked, the staff at the taxi stand always spend a good amount of time explaining the address to the drivers. I had the most restorative spa treatment, the therapist had butter soft hands yet was able to apply deep pressure. The spa lounge even has adjustable beds. On the hardware side, having been recently to the Aman & the Palace hotel, there is no longer a wow factor in the spacious room, MO is really about quiet elegance, but I'll easily come back again just because the polished service, consistently good, and memorable staff.

Thank you for such and nice stay in Japan, the service was exceptional. I travel alone many times and the hotel made me feel like I had plenty of friends to talk with and share my thoughts and travel experiences with.

I sing the praises of this hotel often but it only gets better. Accommodation, public areas and restaurants are great but the killer attribute is the service. Subtle efficient anticipating every need and always professional it the people that make the hotel outstanding Try you will like it

We stayed here the last few nights of our Japan tour. I wouldn't say it's the nicest hotel I have ever been to but it's certainly nice. It's a typical mandarin oriental so you know what you will get. The views of the city are spectacular, beds are comfy and the bathrooms are spa like

amazing view stunning hotel very expensive but worth the money! need free wifi! excellent location. rooms were very nice and well equipped staff were very nice. very helpful staffs with lots of info about the city

The staff was wonderful and the view amazing... but for the price, WIFI and breakfast are not included. The location was perfect since it was only a few blocks from Tokyo station. The staff and service was very attentive as well.

This is my first stay at a Mandarin property and we had a lovely experience. Rooms were well-equipped and the staff were very friendly. And I was extremely impressed that they even have gym wardrobe to lend to guests if needed. A very enjoyable stay afterall and would love to come back!

The concierge set this property apart! They gave some phenomenal restaurant recommendations which I thoroughly enjoyed. The breakfast was also very good - try the juice selection and the crabs benedict. Did not spend too much time at the hotel as I was in meetings.

This is where I stay when I am in Tokyo, and it is reason enough to go to Tokyo in itself. It is a hotel that sets the standard for other hotels, across the board, and I can only wish that other hotels strive to meet the same standards.

When we checked into the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo, we were taken to our room by a staff member who graciously showed us the features of our room. He explained that the desk phone had an LED touch screen that would allow us to access several of the room features at the touch of a button. However, in this room, the screen wouldn't work. He apologized for the inconvenience, called someone immediately and the phone was fixed within the hour. NOT a big deal to us but we ended up getting a written note of apology from not only the head of housekeeping, Takehiro Hosoi, but from the hotel general manager, Thomas Combescot, as well. In addition to that, the front desk staff also apologized to us and sent up a tray of specialty chocolates for our inconvenience. WHAT??? I spent the rest of the week earnestly looking everywhere for other faults or issues so that I could peruse myself of more of those tasty morsels but alas there were no further problems to be found. In truth, this is the kind of place that you read about but you must experience to understand the level of service that is routinely given here. For instance, months before our arrival, Maria Yano, in guest relations, reached out to us to inquire about anything that we might need during our stay. Whether it was directions or suggestions on places to dine or how to figure out the best way to negotiate Shinjuku Station, she was always ready to assist us. Niccolo Brachelente, the breakfast manager, would stop by our table each morning to inquire about how our day went. He made sure that all of our requests were taken care of promptly and went out of his way to make our dining experience a pleasurable one.Chef Kento at the Tapas Molecular Bar-many thanks for a wonderful time! This guy was channeling chemistry, biomolecular physics and Michelin-starred cuisine into a night that won’t be forgotten!  Lastly, I would be remiss if I didn’t mention our maid. I never got the chance to meet her but her efforts on our behalf were fantastic! She kept that room spotless and beautiful. Everything had its place. I accidentally flipped over one of the sugar cube packets in the small lacquered box by the Nespresso machine. My fat fingers were too big to turn it back right side up so I left it there never thinking that anyone would take the time to place it back right side up. Lo and behold, when we returned to our room that night, I opened the box up and saw that they were all back right side up! Impressive…We’re already making plans to return next year. Save yourself the trouble, if you want the best hotel in Japan, this is it!

The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is lovely, but not my first choice in Tokyo.The Mandarin Oriental Hotel is located on one of Tokyo's priciest streets right down the block from the original Mitsukoshi Department Store. The lobby is situated on the 38th floor of a high rise building , but the rooms are on lower floors. So, to go to your room you go up to the 38th floor and walk across the lobby to an elevator to go to lower floors. There are broad views of Tokyo and the rooms are supplied with binoculars. I was surprised to find that our Grand King room had a bathroom with only one small square sink. The charming Rooms Manager Raoul explained that the suites had two sinks and that they were planning to renovate the hotel. The hotel has no Club lounge and the buffet breakfast is $38.00. The selections were ample and the smoked salmon was excellent .There is no swimming pool, though there is a well appointed fitness center. The Bar is particularly attractive with tables set on stone islands in the midst of running water. The Assistant Director of Rooms, Mr. Kaseda was particularly helpful as we tried to figure out where in the room to place an extra bed for a child . It was adequate for two nights. When compared to other hotels in the price range in Tokyo, I felt it was not competitive. Another hotel of similar price and stature offers a concierge lounge that includes free drinks, including alcohol, and four different menus all day long . A swimming pool is also included and upgrades more often available. Be careful if you ask the Mandarin to provide transportation to Narita, They were about to confirm a van for three people at a charge of 725 dollars. Luckily I caught it before it was too late. A similar van from Narita Air Transport was 225 dollars.

When you enter the breakfast area the 2nd time the service will know you by name an will remember your preferences. Rarely seen these days. Comparatively large rooms. Public space on the 38th floor is very warm and cosy. That's exceptional and to be appreciated in Tokyo. My #1 pick in Tokyo after trying out many options.

I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo for a week in June 2016 for business. The hotel offers the best of Japanese cleanliness and service - both were immaculate. The views from the rooms and the lobby were exceptional. No detail is overlooked.
user_name:
Joanne B
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Excellent location. Its staff was kind and willing to help. In-room dining staff was very pleasant to talk to. I've stayed at several different Mandarin Oriental hotels before and unfortunately, this was not the best one. Actually, a couple of front desk staff were dry and didn't want to go extra steps to help me out. Room was little outdated and needs renovation soon. Too bad, I liked the location...
user_name:
Ryan P
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a fantastic experience at the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo. My husband would stay there for the breakfast buffet alone. Our flight arrived incredibly early - 4:30am and we went straight to the hotel. Though our room wasn't ready and the hotel was at near capacity, the staff found us a "temporary" room to relax in until our room was ready. We appreciated the elegance of the hotel, the incredible service from the staff, and the luxurious rooms. Truly a top-notch experience for us. Thank you.

The Mandarin Oriental is a fabulous hotel: great views of Tokyo, food is excellent, attention to detail and guest needs is impeccable. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough - consider asking for transfers to/from airport to smooth the trip.

The Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Tokyo is the one and only place to stay when you are looking to book a hotel.My wife and I have stayed previously at the MO Hotel in Singspore whilst there for a Conference and were hugely impressed by the Hotel.For our visit to Tokyo we decided to stay at the MO Hotel and were not disappointed.From the moment we arrived at the Foyer the conceirge staff greeted us warmly and ushered us up to the 38th floor to check in.The MO Hotel occupies the top 9 floors of the building which is in the financial and shopping district of central Tokyo and close to the main train station.The room we had booked was a deluxe room (3509) and was stunning.Everything was exceptional.Very stylish, plenty of room, decor was Japanese/Western modern, excellent bathroom (bath and shower with excellent features) and the whole room had a stunning floor to ceiling panoramic window overlooking the cityWe even had a distant view of Mt.Fuji.The staff were incredibly polite, helpful, and attentive to what you wanted or would like to have. They went out of their way to make you feel at home.We dined in the room in the evenings and had breakfast delivered in the mornings and the meals were First Class.The conceirge staff were fantastic when we enquired about catching a train.The Hotel is built over the subway station and the staffer accompanied us to the station and showed us how to purchase a ticket, and what line we needed and got us on our way. Brilliant service.We would highly recommend this Hotel if you are coming to Tokyo.

I judge Hotels by their own standards i.e. 4 Star, 5 Star etc and what they say about themselves. I have stayed in many 5 Star Hotels all over the world but in terms of what this Hotel offers and its rating it is the best. Other 5 Stars have more Marble, Columns,, Landscaped gardens, Impressive settings, Larger Rooms etc., but in terms of true 5 Star Luxury, Service, amenities for 5 star city travellers the Mandarin Tokyo is extraordinary. I have stayed many times in the Mandarin Hong Kong and London and they are super but this is a step up. The Japanese concept of service is applied to this 5 Star Hotel superbly, everyone goes the extra mile to help out ( little details - at Breakfast a note is kept of what you ordered before for Breakfast and consulted by staff before approaching your table,, we left after a week and came back after a few days touring and ALL staff were made aware of same and in Bar, Breakfast etc said welcome back to us by name - clearly well briefed. Certain receipts I had left on first trip were kept and put in my room on arrival. We left bigger bags in storage on our tour, they were in out rooms, two of them, correctly when we returned and rechecked in etc...). I have been to Tokyo many times and stayed in other 5 star , but this is the best. To be clear, its very expensive - but they deliver accordingly which is unique in my experience.

Great location and staffs. However, in terms of the price value, they should provid free welcome fruits and drinks. Also to avoid none resident to enter the lobby and bar area which the privacy seems low.

Everything about this hotel is first class. You'll fall for this place as soon as you arrive and see the breathtaking view from the reception area. The incredible rooms are made even better by the views. It doesn't matter which direction you face, you'll have great views of the Tokyo cityscape. We stayed in a regular room the first night and upgraded to a suite for the remaining portion of our stay. If you have the means, upgrade to a suite. We found the space a little tight in the regular rooms, especially the bathrooms. Suites have expanded bathrooms with great views.Don't miss the breakfast buffet, it has a great mixture of western and traditional Japanese foods. The service is on point and they remember your preferences from day to day.The hotel is located in a business district, while there isn't a whole lot "to do" around the hotel, you can't beat the location of the subway directly under the hotel. The Tokyo subway system is like no other and you rarely need to rely on any other mode of transportation.Highly recommended, can't wait to return!

Amazing experience in the heart of Tokyo. I was quite impressed with the hotel ambiance and quality of the service, especially the Concierge. Ana Gervasio from the Concierge did an amazing job helping me plan my days in Tokyo. She is awesome and super professional. Mandarin has a superior quality. I strongly reccomend.

Wonderful hotel with the best service.great location about 10 min walk to tokyo station ,also there is the subway below the hotel. my room was 5 star. I had a great view of downtown tokyo.the room had plasma tv safe seperate bath and shower.I ate at two of the resturants,k shiki and ventaglio.both dad wonderful food and fantastic service.there is a great department store with a great food court one block from the hotel named mitsukoshi.I would like to thank the following staff members hiroyuki shioji,niccolo brachelente,daisuke morita,daniele cason who made me a great veggie burger and lobby ambassador rika fukada who showed me my room and around the hotel also my waiter yu fujisawa.If I return to tokyo I would stay here

What can I say the Mandarin has always lived up to its name. But I was surprise to find this 5 star hotel does not have a swimming pool. We have two kids ages 11 and 15yrs and it is always nice to take a quick swim to relax after a great day touring. They have a spa pool but kids under the age of 16 are not welcomed. But the rooms and restaurants were excellent. The staff was excellent to the kids and they felt welcome. We will be back again, but not with the kids the next time.

The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo, is a high end luxury hotel whose main aim is to provide unparalleled luxury and comfort to its guests. The views from the Lobby are one of the best I have seen of the Tokyo skyline. The rooms are large and very luxurious with fantastic views, and the shower in the bathroom is absolutely amazing. A truly neat feature I liked in the room was near the wardrobe section they have a small cupboard wherein a guest can place his shoes for shining or his laundry bag and lock it in and press the service button. The housekeeping staff will open that section from outside the room and take your shoes or laundry without disturbing the guest.The breakfast spread is truly superb with a wide variety of local and international dishes and want you coming back for more. Must have the Eggs Benedict with Crab!The Hotel is very conveniently located in Chuo-ku in Nihonbashi with easy access to the Metro station located below the hotel. Just next door is the high end Mitsukoshi department store and a short taxi ride away is Tokyo Station.The staff is extremely polite and hospitable and go out of their way to give each guest a spectacular stay. Top marks to the concierge team for their impeccable level of service. The overall service is truly one of the best I have experienced in any hotel.

It located center of Chuo-ku in Nihonbashi. Extremely convenient and surrounding area many place to walk around. Metro station is just underground of property. To go to Tokyo station just three mins by taxi. Cleanliness of room is perfect and even small dust cannot see. Amen it is also selected item only placed in room. Welcome amenity also placing season fruits in Japan. Fabulous!! Quality of service is also tip top and each individual staffs are used to handle any guests from all over the world. From welcome to farewell they always greet us with elegant gesture. Staffs are well trained and nobody say "No" for any kind of requests. Most excellent part was consistently delivering and delight guest experience to be memorable and unforgettable. Special thank you for professional assistance for Mr. Kaseda who welcomed us with cautious approach. Mr. Abe chief concierge and Ms. Wakita who pay attention for our needs. Once again thank you so much delight our stay.

Fantastic location in Tokyo. This is a high end, high service, luxury hotel with all the bells and whistles and upscale amenities. The view of the city from the reception desk is one of the best that you can get in Tokyo. The high ceilings and luxury appointments make this a visually stunning hotel. The overall service is one of the best we have experienced in any hotel. The rooms are beautiful and we had a fantastic view. There is a great bar off the main lobby with great drinks and great views. There is a pizza bar with outstanding thin crust pizza and excellent italian specialities. The breakfast buffet is worth the trip. There are western style and japanese choices on the menu. If you are looking for upscale elegance and high end service this is one of the best - if not the best choice in Tokyo.

The Mandarin Tokyo lives up to its reputation and is a luxurious example of excellence and service for the Mandarin chain. The staff have been unbelievable and so attentive towards making our getaway a great one. I would come back to this property again and again.

The location of the hotel is good,easy to access with metro and surrounded with restaurant as well,both international cuisine and local food. The hotel is well maintained even is already nearly 10 years of operation and the breakfast quality is good.

Young Aika that greets guests at the ground floor entrance of the hotel typifies the high level of service, professionalism and dedication of the staff. She us courteous and very helpful. At first I thought it was a joke that she would sprint (flat out running) to find taxis when none waiting. Little did I realise that this 'beyond the call of duty' service runs throughout the hotel. The concierge are excellent and secured many hard to book restaurants. Breakfast flawless even though narrow in range, in part due to the restricted space of the restaurant. Rooms are nice if a little dated. Gym sufficient but no pool. Hotel location is Ok and far more central than the Park Hyatt if you wish to explore the sights. This hotel is good but it will be remembered most for the service of Aika and other nameless staff members.
user_name:
Topcat212
New York City, New York

review_body: From the minute you get out of the car , until you check in , every step of the way there is staff greeting you. First class all the way. Go to the molecular dining if that sounds interesting to you. Very difficult to get in as there's only 8 seats per night. They only offer a lunch seating on the weekends. You need to make a reservation ahead of time. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning sitting looking out over Tokyo. Work out facility very nice. They provide workout clothes of needed. Don't miss out on the spa. Amazing view with a very relaxing atmosphere.

This is a superlative hotel. The very definition of five-star.Service_ The real highlight of our stay. Nothing but perfection. Pure Japanese attention to detail.Building_ Spectacular. Minimalist yet opulent. Set against breathtaking views of Tokyo's futuristic skyline. Room_ Spacious. Meticulously put together. Spa_ Surreal. Conciergerie_ Best in class service. Warm. Knowledgeable. Precise.Location_ Three minutes to Takashimaya. Ten minutes to Tokyo Station. Fifteen minutes to the Imperial Palace. Transport links_ Direct entrance to Ninhonbashi-mae subway station.Baby proof_ Yes.

I have been to this hotel many times and am always amazed by its attention to details and dedication to excellent guest experience. What's special about the Mandarin in Tokyo is that they think of the guests in every detail possible. Simple things such as refilling your kettle everyday so that all you need to do is to boil it is incredible. Location is also excellent. All in all, an incredible place to stay.

The Mandarin Oriental is small enough to make you feel like a very special guest, and part of this feeling is of course down to the high level of service. Even in Japan, where we found service as a whole to be on another level, this hotel excels.Wonderful views from all floors - even of Mount Fuji from the breakfast table on our last day.Ideally located above the Metro and with concierge help, we could plan our travel very easily from the lobby.Breakfast was so good. The quality and variety of the food on offer was lovely, and the eggs benedict with crab meat was very good. Service in the restaurant could be described as almost intuitively knowing what was required before you ever needed to ask.We ate at the restaurant 'Sense' and for lunch one day and dinner the next. We would recommend this experience for both the cuisine and the service.We chose to stay here as we love MO in other cities and we left feeling very glad we did.

For those of you have have experienced service in Japan, you know that normal Japanese service is 5 star American service; well, this is five star Japanese service. I don't know where to start - the table stakes: immaculate, well appointed rooms, beautiful property, attentive staff, every convenience desired, multiple travel arrangement seamless, laundry service excellent and rapid.On my arrival, a staffer greeted me by name out of the car, escorted me to the front desk to check in after which the front desk manager escorted me to my room assuring that all was in order. The second day at breakfast, an associate asked me if I wanted coffee and the vegetable egg white omelet again or something else. At dinner on day two, I refused to let the waiter take a fish dish with a world-class white wine sauce away and asked for bread to consume it (no small indulgence for me as I am a low carb guy) - the chef came out to thank me for the compliment! Jimmeny Christmas! This is this is the place to stay.My only suggestion is the that the gym is only adequate (although extremely well attended) for an international hotel.Great job team!

We were a group, stayed for two days. Great experience. The reception floor is amazing, especially at sunrise.. the skyline, city scape as backdrop is mind boggling., Size or rooms don't justify price but they are great.

Best Hotel in Tokyo, The Food and beverage outlets See oustanding in its Varieté and quality. The Staff is amazingly Friendly and pro-active! I will definitely Return to The Hotel Next Time in Tokyo. The view from each room - breathtaking!!

I had the pleasure of recently statying at the Oriental Mandarin in Tokyo. I have stayed at the Andaz in the past which was also nice, but not nearly as wonderful as the Mandarin. Perfection describes the hotel.

Up until now we were most wowed by the Peninsula in Hong Kong but I have to say the Mandarin Oriental equals and perhaps surpasses it. The hotel itself on the top floors of a skyscraper have spectacular views. Convenient because of the subway underneath the hotel and nearby Tokyo station for rail. The service is out of this world. Any request is met promptly and graciously. Shoes need to be shined and returned immediately? No problem. Milk in refrigerator for morning coffee with decaf only capsules for Nespresso machine? No problem and no repeat requests. Room has stunning decor and the bathroom with the wooden slat floors, wonderful showers and deep bathtub (big enough for two) that fills quickly because of the superb water pressure. You never hear vacuums or other housekeeping noise, the sound proofing is excellent. Only negative is that smoking is allowed in the bar one floor below the lobby and because it is open to the lobby area it permeates the hotel lobby. We had an interesting conversation with the Italian chef (from Rome) of the Italian restaurant on site. He was in the dining area chatting with the guests and after I commented that unless you have good tomatoes you really shouldn't offer a caprese salad and he sent out a plate of much better tomatoes which were in a different salad after agreeing with me about the quality between the two offerings. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Really top notch in all ways, design, service, cleanliness, spaciousness, convenience (location). Must be one of the top hotels in the world.

Hard to know where to start with this review as everything from the moment we arrived was close to perfect. Probably easier to list what I loved:* The service. Impeccable from the concierge to the cleaning staff to the bell captain (!)* The location: Not knowing Tokyo, I presume this is the financial district given the number of banks around. Clean, beautiful architecture everywhere.* The view: amazing from every spot, including the floor-to-ceiling windows in the bedrooms.* The gym - with that view again - and the complementary fruit juices.* The spa, bar and restaurants...I could go on and on! Must be one of the best hotels in Tokyo.

My husband and I have read wonderful things about the MO Tokyo and we had high expectations for our 5 night stay in Tokyo. Our stay was perfect and would recommend it to everyone! We travelled with our 10 month old and they had the room baby proofed (corners protected with soft corners), provided a cot, baby bath, baby amenities, a steriliser and food warmer. The Concierge also did a fab job at reserving our restaurants for us. The subway station was very conveniently located below the hotel building and the JR line was a short 10 min walk away.The breakfast buffet/spread was great - special note to the egg tarts, crabs benedict and juice selection.The room wasn't the most stylish one we've stayed in and the bathroom was smaller than some others but that comes down to personal taste. We still loved it. Floor to ceiling windows in the room provided a glittering view of the Tokyo cityscape whenever we entered. Service was the best we've received at a luxury hotel. Our needs were met before we even asked. So many things I could rave about our stay at the MO but I'll keep it short. Go experience it for yourself :)

Located on the 30th to 38th floors of the Nihonbashi Mitsui Tower, this hotel has great views of Tokyo and, on a clear day, Mt. Fuji. Rooms come with binoculars. There are a number of restaurants in this hotel including Chinese, French, Mediterranean, pizza and a Molecular tapas bar. The later is one of the top restaurants in Tokyo but seats are limited and reservations are hard to come by. Service is top notch, as you would expect from the Mandarin Oriental.Rooms are beautifully designed and have every convenience. The shower is large and has a rain head along with other shower head options. There is a large soaking tub.Ice buckets are kept full. An iron and ironing board will be delivered to you should you need it. This hotel is in the center of Tokyo with the subway and shops and restaurants right below. The location could not be better!We loved that there was a pair of scissors and tape in the room. It really came in handy when we were wrapping up fragile items to take home. Breakfast was included in the room rate and the breakfast buffet was much better than average with lots of choices whether you wanted an American or a Japanese breakfast. We generally had a little of both.

One of the best hotel experiences !!! Elegant, discreet and superb hospitality ... Amazing views and lovely jacuzzi with views of the city . Never waited for anything .. All needs were anticipated . I would def return ... The only negative is that I was put on a smoking floor and never thought to address this ahead of time because USA hotels are generally none smoking . I was very bothered by the smell !

Ryo Yamaguchi at this hotel's Paradise Salon is THE BEST!! I've been a loyal NY client since 1999 and refuse to go to anyone else. He does a phenomenal job on my baleyage highlights, carefully painting my individual strands with precision & an artful eye every time. My husband & my haircuts are always incredibly professional & stylish with close attention to environmental & lifestyle details. Ryo is a top-notch hairstylist with a celebrity clientele following & I can absolutely understand why. I'd highly recommend him to anyone seeking great hair!

Stunning. The floor to ceiling windows throughout provide a mesmerising Tokyo cityscape for you to gaze out upon, all the way to Mount Fuji. The staff I spoke with had long service records here and conducted themselves in a friendly professional manner that really made me smile. The décor and interior design layout is beautiful. Food - sublime. Direct access to subway. A truly inspirational luxury hotel experience.

An absolutely stunning hotel, the lobby can be found on the highest floor and the rooms then start below, but still high enough so that you get quite a stunning view of the city, whether day or night. With the panorama Windows you get the feeling hat you are suspended in the air.The size of the rooms is more than enough for two people and it has intertwined old Japanese aesthetics with modern decoration, achieving the perfect balance of old and new.Definitely one of the best hotels I have stayed at from the service, to the rooms, to the lobby and the various different dining experiences (the numerous restaurant kinda feels like it belongs in Vegas).. This is a must try hotel!

We recently stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel for 5 nights ....absolutely faultless ...the staff are to be commended, nothing was too much ....breakfast and dinner was wonderful ...spacious room and we even lucky enough to see Mt Fuji from the window ....we shall be back !!

This was our last hotel after two weeks touring in Japan and it was certainly the best. The hotel is located in a multi-storey block with a lobby on the ground floor and main reception on the 38th with a non-stop lift linking the two. The guest rooms are located on the six floors below reception so one needs to think twice about which lifts to take when you are going out. Quality and attention to detail are evident everywhere from the furnishings, the service, the food to the calibre and personal qualities of staff. We unexpectedly ran out of a routine medication and the reception/concierge staff could not have been more helpful in organising a prompt solution. I remember Kano's central role in organising things but all the staff were extremely helpful. The hotel is well located with easy access to the subway, a number of major department stores as well as other city facilities. The hotel is not hemmed in by other buildings so views from the guest rooms are very good with the Skytree to the East and, weather permitting, Mount Fuji to the West. I can't imagine it would have been easy to find anywhere better in Tokyo and we certainly have very good memories of our stay there.

Firstly for Tokyo this hotel with the metro immediately below is very well located for most activities in Tokyo.Staff were exceptional especially in the breakfast room where for our adult family of 5 after just one day all our special requests were remembered. Staff were always pleasant attentive but not in your face.Concierge staff were always helpful and acquired some difficult to get but excellent seats for the Sumo and had other excellent suggestions for dinner and activities.Rooms were on the large size and very nicely appointed bathrooms.Gym was very functional the only miss was there is no swimming pool.All up if classy, luxury is your preference this will be hard to beat.

If you are in Tokyo for business this is an excellent place to stay. It has all the facilities you, is close to the metro and business district. The staff are outstanding. You are even given a PASMO card to access the Metro. Breakfast is excellent and th view as good as anywhere in Tokyo.

Extremely helpful concierge - I had a single purpose for this trip - to visit a famous restaurant which is hard to book for the locals, and it is well-known for declining reservations for foreigners unaccompanied by Japanese. The concierge apparently convinced the chef that my wife and I are rule-abiding guests, and successfully made the reservation. This reservation alone is important for me, as it was a promise I made to my wife when I proposed to her a year ago. My friends in Japan - even though they went extra length to visit the shop personally at 8am on the first day of the month - were disappointed with an impossibly long queue. My wife's happy face enjoying the food relives my promise of our wedding.The spa is simple perfect. What more could one want - great service and amazing view?Most stylish room in its class. The details eg the subtly leveled flooring in the shower room / bathroom is pleasing to the sensitive eyes. It makes my day waking up to see the Mount Fuji over an amazing Tokyo skylineOverall, Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is one of a kind - if I want only a luxury hotel, I may choose the usual suspects eg Four Seasons - but if I want both the luxury and a unique stylishness - Mandarin Oriental is the undisputed choice

I fell in love with the decor of this hotel. Everything about it is perfect. I had to base the remodel of my home on this hotel!! It's so incredibly Chic and zen all at once. The rooms are huge and the bathrooms are superb. The food was excellent at the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel for any visitor to Tokyo because it will give you all the luxury and cool factor that Japan has to offer. The service is outstanding in Japan and the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is service all the way.
user_name:
Flying2Fashion
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Don't normally bother to write reviews anymore on tripadvisor but this time I feel I really owe it to the hotel. I'm a very picky 5 star traveler and quite frankly I can often find fault where others see none. Attention to detail is important to me; I don't mind paying a high price for service, but the other party has to do their part in the transaction and I feel MOTYO really lived up to their promise to me. Prior to our stay I engaged to concierge re sumo and kabuki tickets. While responses were somewhat delayed, the final result in terms of the tickets provided was great. Sumo tickets were particularly well chosen and I'm glad I entrusted the concierge with my credit card info ahead of time to get these things anchored before we arrived, as they would have been in short supply otherwise considering the timing of our stay which spanned Golden Week. We stayed 9 nights (May 2-11) in what I suspect to be the lowest grade room they have. It was a king room, on floor 32, overlooking Mt. Fuji (which we actually did see on a couple of occasions although I understand normally the weather makes sighting difficult in spring/summer). Winter sighting is much more reliable. Glad we didn't pay extra for this view, however it was special when we saw it. The room was lovely, yes, possibly showing some small signs of wear but on the whole still very beautiful and cared for. Bed was firm but cozy. Bedding beautifully soft and pressed and a large pillow menu that we used. Most astounding was the quiet and silence in the room. Never any hallway noise from adjacent room doors or guests and the hvac too was silent! Bathrooms worked brilliantly and shower area some had complained about on tripadvisor was not an issue at all. Again, everything beautifully maintained and cleaned. Toto washlet great obviously. Our room rate included breakfast and wifi and was negotiated directly with the hotel ahead of time considering the length of our stay. Wifi worked great on multiple devices with one single sign-on for our total duration with none of the daily signing in that is often required to access wifi in other, even 5-star, hotels. There was plenty of bandwidth available for FaceTime. Breakfast was beautiful and has been commented about at length in other reviews so I won't mention it other than to say that it made me cry on the first day because it was presented so well. Service was a bit over the top and some have criticized it as being contrived but after a number of days we could see this was truly the standard of MOTYO service and they are proud of it. That put the service into context for us. Extremely attentive and polite is what it was. We also had almost daily breakfast visits from the restaurant manager Kai who was interested in our plans for the day and helped to make recommendations for us with details. Smokiness many have complained about was somewhat evident in the lobby but was not a significant problem to me and I'm somewhat sensitive to smell. During our stay we used concierge services quite a bit for restaurants and maps and locations for shops and other things. All advice was good. We often had pounds of change which they converted to bills for us without batting an eye and ditto provided smaller bills no trouble after our visits to bank machine. I guess this is no big deal, but just something I really appreciated. Turndown service was great, flexible, and fast. We made use of the yakatas and appreciated the signature essential oil and after asking were provided with a sample upon checking out. We made use of the spa/jacuzzi/sauna one morning early when it's available to guests without extra charge. It was ok but helpful to see how other Japanese guests were using it. I just followed what they were doing and it all worked great. In-room dining provided fresh milk gratis for my tea in the morning as I preferred not to use the capsules provided. Ditto they cut one of the lovely mizakaya mangoes we had sourced ourselves out during the day. All free. This was something I really appreciated...no nickel-and-diming. We used the hotel car service to and from Narita which is very expensive yes, but which is always an awesome convenience and a great thing if it can be afforded. Car (Mercedes S class) was roomy and driver was great and upon checkout many staff from the hotel were present to make sure we had everything in order upon departure for our long journey home. At this price, you assume all the big things will be looked after so it becomes the little things that make the difference. For me the little things that so often go wrong and which MOTYO got right were the quiet room and hvac, the seamless wifi login, the elevator operation (once the doors start closing another guest pressing the call button does not interrupt the operation), the concierge recommendations and ticket service, the straightforward billing and absence of nickel-and-diming, and just the apparent ease with which everything is done. Service, service, service. Would definitely stay again perhaps next year in the fall. Have stayed at many 5-star and otherwise exclusive properties around the world including all the major brands at this price level (Four Seasons, The Peninsula, Shangri-La, and so on) and I think MOTYO may have done the best job ever.

Extra luxury hotel, rooms are amazing and the skyline view is breathtaking. Concierge and personal assistance were extremely professional. The breakfast was the best ever eaten in 5*hotels worldwide. Laundry service recommended. Everything was perfect!

This hotel is absolutely beautiful, and extremely luxurious. Everything was clean, and all of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurants we tried in the hotel were all great. LOVED the breakfast buffet. Only down-side is that the neighborhood is a little bit boring and business-oriented. The view from our room was AMAZING though.
user_name:
X375IEelizabethg
New York City, New York

review_body: This is our favorite hotel to visit in Tokyo. It is a beautiful, opulent setting with well-thought decor. The presidential suite is a room of dreams, well-appointed and comfortable to stay in for two weeks. The staff goes above and beyond, always learning about your little behaviors and wants and expectations. They always anticipate what we need, what we are looking for, and what we expect. They are pseudo-mind readers. Almost creepy. We can't wait to come back.

This hotel oozes elegance and luxury. Everything is impeccable and top notch. My only critique I can give is that it is astronomically expensive and caters to a clientele for whom money is no object. I think that is what they are going for, and they succeed, so they still deserve all of that 5 star rating, but if you are a traveler on the fence between this and something a few notches down in price, you don't actually need to spend this much money to have a great time in Tokyo. Tokyo as a city is just as much about the little local spots and cheap eats as it is about 5-star luxury.Our room had an unbelievable view of Tokyo. The design and the craftsmanship in the lobby, elevator, hallways, and rooms is impressive. We decided to have room service one night just because the room was so darn nice. Their service is top notch. You stay here and you are among by the elite of Tokyo travelers. The food we had in the hotel was delicious. I mean, the menu prices are a little eye popping but like I said, this is not a value option.Pro tip: the Mitsukoshimae station on the Tokyo Metro is extremely convenient. Exit A7 takes you directly up to the hotel. The Ginza line is the best. Yes, the Hanzomon line stops here too, but the walk to and from the Hanzomon line is kind of long. For example, if you are at Shibuya crossing, and you are plotting your route back to the hotel, take the Ginza line rather than the Hanzomon line, even though they both go to Mitsukoshimae station. As I write this, I realize that most people who are staying in this hotel will probably just pay up for taxis or ubers -- but the subway is quite fast and convenient even for big shots!

Excellent location!The hotel is beautiful. The common areas are filled with modern art, comfortable.The room was very large and with a view of the city. The bathroom was large as well, good amenities and very clean. The Front Desk and Concierge people were extremely helpful and professional and went beyond what was asked from them. I recommend this hotel full heartedly.

We stayed five nights in this wonderful hotel. We had a large beautifully decorated room on the 36th floor with a king bed and every amenity imaginable, plus a fantastic view east over the of the city. The hotel is perfectly located just two blocks from the Nihonbashi bridge at the north end of the Ginza shopping district. The enormous Mitsukoshi department store is right next door, and the Imperial Palace is a ten minute walk. And if you want to go farther there's a major subway station on the lower level. There are lots of restaurants in the area, but the dining options in the hotel are hard to resist. Our favorites were K’Shiki for breakfast in the morning and Italian in the evening, Ventaglio for a Mediterranean buffet, and the Mandarin Bar for a nightcap. (The Mandarin Bar reminded me of the bar in the movie “Lost In Translation”.)Service was unfailingly excellent, and I can honestly say I’ve never experienced any better. A fantastic experience.If I had to include one negative comment it would be that the bathroom is a bit small and has only a single sink. But it's still a great hotel.

The room, the service, the views, the food, it was all flawless! Mandarin Oriental is a brand I will put my full trust in every time!My room (a twin) was enormous with a desk, plenty of storage and luggage space for two people and a nespresso machine, which is always a nice touch. The room had huge windows with the most amazing views over the Tokyo skyline (nice that there were binoculars in the room too). The decor was really simple and neutral and felt very luxurious. Great wifi. The bathroom was large with floor to ceiling marble. The bath large and comfortable. Lots of very good quality amenities, plus really good kimonos, and top quality robes and slippers. Probably the best hotel slippers I've seen!The location is fantastic, very easy to get to and to explore from. The hotel is right on top of Mitsukoshi subway station and only a ten minute walk (or three minute cab) to Tokyo central station. Once you're in the hotel however, there's a good chance you won't want to leave! The facilities are really five star! The restaurants are sensational (michelin stars all round), the bar (although not cheap) is the perfect place to watch the sunset over a cocktail, the spa is really great and the jacuzzi must have the best views of any in the world! The only thing I found a little disappointing, was that there are two separate jacuzzis. One for men and one for women. Personally I would have liked to use a mixed one so that couples or friends can share the experience and the outstanding views together. Also, it's free for guests to use before 10am, but if you want to use it during the day, there is a fee. I didn't use the gym, but I had a look and it's well equipped with free water and fresh juices. Also, don't miss a visit to the Mandarin Oriental gourmet shop! The cakes and sweets here are totally divine and not overpriced. Perfect little afternoon treat stop!The breakfast buffet was really amazing. All kinds of Japanese foods, including rice, salmon, vegetables, dumplings as well as all the usual western favourites, I think there were even four varieties of bacon to choose from!! I ordered the french toast as well (included for free) and it was some of the best I have ever had. Overall, I would highly recommend a stay at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. Everything about my stay was great. It's a top hotel and the staff ho out of their way to make every guest feel like a VIP. The whole experience was very luxe and I would love to stay here again.

Excellent hotel. Good location and very helpful staff. Views shown from the room - (twin)Picture 1 - entranceOther pictures showing bathroom with separate shower, which I rate excellent. Breakfast facilities with beautiful city views and very good oriental and western buffet. The hotel features excellent restaurants. Some pictures taken at Tapas Molecular where we had a great dinner.

I wasn't sure when I first arrived whether the hotel was a little over stuffy, over pretentious, as I found it all a bit over bearing at first. But as I got more familiar with everything I realised that it was just a real desire from all the staff to provide the best possible service they could whilst also being polite and friendly.Everything just works so smoothly. Everyone at the hotel acknowledges you with a smile as you walk past and are keen to help if required. As you would expect the hotel has a very upmarket feel to it, but not in a brash way. We stayed in a Deluxe Premier Room on the 35th Floor. Great views of Tokyo and the Tokyo Skytree from the floor to ceiling windows. Very comfortable, nicely decorated, everything you need. Bathroom is spacious and well appointed. My only minor gripe is that I think it's a bit petty to be charging for Wi-Fi?We had breakfast and dined at the Pizza Bar for lunch. Breakfasts are excellent, everything you could want with multiple choices of most things. The Pizza's at the Pizza Bar are really good, and were freshly prepared by the chef as we watched while sat at the bar.Really got to appreciate everything about this hotel the more I stayed there and would definitely recommend.

I stayed 3 nights in this excellent hotel and was never disappointed. Service levels are as good as it gets. All staff members are courteous, helpful and well trained. The room was very spacious, modern and well equipped. The view of the city is amazing. Dining and drinks are exuberantly expensive. The breakfast buffet is top notch. Work to get it included in your room rate. There are tons of restaurants and high end shops surrounding the hotel.

My husband and I have stayed at many different luxury hotels around the globe. We usually stay at Four Seasons properties, but may need to change our allegiance, thanks to an exceptional stay at the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo!First and foremost, the location is excellent-- not far from Ginza-- there is a subway in the basement of the hotel! The other floors house my favorite premium Japanese fruit store and fruit parlor too. The lobby on the 38th floor provides tremendous views of the entire city, and the view from our suite on the 32nd floor was equally as breathtaking. What this Mandarin property excels at is service, but in a genuine, true hospitable way. From the moment we stepped on property, our luggage was brought to our room with lightning speed, and everyone knew our name and preferences. The smiles and helpfulness aren't fake, and you can tell the staff takes pride in providing an excellent experience to guests. An example is the breakfast manager, Niccolo. Every morning, we ate at the buffet, which includes made-to-order egg dishes, like a crab eggs benedict. Niccolo not only recommended it to us, but went so far as to explain how the eggs come from chickens that eat rosehips and hibiscus flowers and have a rich red yolk to match the deeply developed taste. He also remembered our beverage preferences each morning, and offered us treats he thought we'd enjoy, like fresh blueberry juice, or a plate of assorted Japanese fruits. He wasn't available on our last day, but he sent us a box of cookies and teas to our room to thank us for coming to dine at his restaurant. The spa is also quite stunning. The soaking bath and sauna have the same views as the lobby-- overlooking the entire Tokyo skyline. The steam room is also beautifully tiled and ultra relaxing. The changing areas include high-end lotions, body cleanser and every toiletry you can imagine! The only hiccup was with a communication flaw in booking several restaurant reservations. Our travel agent had sent a cancellation request for a Michelin-starred sushi restaurant, but the hotel overlooked it and had contacted us via email during our stay to ask why we didn't show up for the reservation. We explained our agent had cancelled for us, and they apologized for the mix up. Ultimately, we'll absolutely come back to the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo in the future! PS: We are currently staying at the MO in Taipei, and while luxurious, doesn't compare to Tokyo's service & staff!

Great location. Incredible service as you expect. Amazing views. The spa is really awesome looking out over the city. Top 5 hotels I have stayed in, in the world. Worth the money to stay here. I can't recommend it enough.

You just can't get much better than this. Great place lovely staff.Just love the reception on the 38th floor. The view is spectacular. The rooms have a separate lift, the security is built in. Shopping just up the road, every thing a person could want

What can you say about MO? Great property, excellent views, good service. The only issue i had was with the restaurant. Service was disjointed - one person seats you, another takes coffee order, a third brings coffee. The problem was that it took 10 minutes each time i ordered a cup of coffee to have them deliver. Also, the buffet was rather small and the number of menu items was very limited.

The location of the Mandarin Oriental is perfect - in up-market Ginza and access to the subway is directly from the hotel. You feel totally pampered during your stay-PERFECT! The food at Tapas Molecular is like going to Heston's Fat Duck!

It's so hard to review a hotel that exceeds your expectations from the moment you enter the lobby. The kids were won over by the gifts at check-in, the personalized welcome in the room, and the spacious luxury that was our suite. The staff routinely greeted us by name, and were friendly without being ingratiating, professional without being overly formal, and helpful at every turn.The concierge staff was helpful with securing reservations and always gave clear directions to and returning from any restaurant they recommended. Breakfast was fantastic and the restaurant had gluten-free bread options available. Service was impeccable.This hotel has become our new favorite hotel, and we will recommend it without reservation to friends traveling to Tokyo. We hope to return ourselves someday!

The Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo is the best you can expect in a journey . How you recognize perfection ? In the details and the quality of humans . This happens in the Mandarin Oriental . All people of the hotel are advancing your desires and needs , they take care and all this is natural. This sounds like a fairy tale.And btw, this happens in all the Mandarin Oriental hotels we go to. When i book a hotel in a city where there is a Mandarin , i do not loose time or energy, this is the only hotel we pick up , simple, efficient and never ever disappointed in all respect. If one day i happen to know the cell phone of the boss of the Mandarin Oriental International, i will tell him or her that my only concern is that there is not a Mandarin Oriental in some of the cities i travel to ....☺️ Pjd

The Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo is the best business hotel I have been to anywhere in the world. As a very frequent guest of the hotel, I experience the hotel as my "Home in Tokyo", where I'm a guest not just a paying client. The staff is recognising guests by name, know their wishes and anticipate needs. Breakfast, bar and restaurants offer outstanding quality, concierge is extremely knowledgeable, and the rooms offer luxury in a stylish but minimalistic way. I would never go to another hotel in Tokyo.

As usually, Mandarin always gave you the best journey and relax environment when you visit Tokyo. The location of the hotel is lovely and locate at quite historical business district that connected to subway station. The most amazing thing I experience was that in Mandarin Tokyo, you can not actually find a smoking room inside the hotel, instead, you can enjoy the smoking time at the Bar's open area on 37 floor and you would not smell any smoke in the whole hotel!

The MO in Tokyo has officially busted its way into my (very short) list of absolute favourite city hotels. It was truly excellent in every way.The room - we had a fairly standard category 'deluxe premier' room, but it was immensely comfortable, well designed, and had a great view out to the Tokyo Skytree. The look and feel of the rooms would remind you very strongly of the rooms at the MO in Singapore, but they're a bit more spacious and have a very convenient day-bed/couch near the window which became a favourite perching spot. The bathroom was also a very good size, and the shower was blissful. All rooms are between the 30th and 37th floor of the building, so I assume all have very good views.The amenities - we ate at 2 (of the 5) restaurants in the hotel, and grabbed a regular nightcap at 1 (of the 2) bars and all were excellent. We also made very extensive use of the concierge, engaging them about 2 months before our trip to line up some restaurant bookings for us at a some recommended places. They did a phenomenal job, in particular ensuring that I would be comfortable with seating arrangements, especially at some of the smaller counter-style sushi or tempura restaurants. They print out clear directions to all restaurants for the cab driver, which is an absolute must in Tokyo. They also sourced us Ghibli Museum tickets, which we were delighted about. I didn't use the spa or the fitness centre on this trip, so can't comment on those.Some general stuff - the main lobby of the hotel is a wonderful space, and a real pleasure to come back to after the hustle and bustle of the city. You always receive a very genuine welcome from any staff in the lobby at the time, and it really feels like 'coming home' (I know it sounds corny, but it works). The hotel's location is also excellent - both for wandering around the immediate area (you're at the very top of the main Ginza shopping area), but also because one of the stops on the Ginza subway line is in the basement of the hotel building. The building also has a nicely spacious porte-cochere where there is always a taxi waiting, and where anyone picking you up or dropping you off can do so calmly - none of this mad scramble to get out of the way of traffic which you can often have in city-centre hotels. Simply put, I don't have a single negative thing to say about our 5 night stay at the MO Tokyo. It was wonderful from start to finish, and we were very sorry to leave. We are already planning a return trip.

This is an extremely elegant hotel, obviously premium category but our experience was unprecedented . The hotel has a boutique feel on a highrise in financial district- located on 4/5 floors. Nevertheless location is quite central with 15/20 mins walk to Ginzha or Imperial palace. Service is amazing - the front office manager may literally walk with you to a nearby restaurant rather that giving you some high level instructions - p pole are friendly but unpretentious. Service is amazing, even in moments where it may get rather busy. Only shame is that you find no coffe machines in the rooms for an early morning drink - but rather simple nespresso type of instant coffee from segafredo. Spa and gym are great- try to get the Tokyo tower view - or imperial palace from a distance - avoid big construction lot towards imperial palace direction as you main view.

We spent three amazing days at Mandarin Oriental last week. Such attention to detail and to service made our stay something special. Breakfast was just gorgeous and I don't think we have ever enjoyed breakfast so much anywhere in the world. The sushi bar was also a top experience. Hope to be back soon.

We love the location of the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo in NIhobashi, the neighborhood is less crowded, super convenient via train/ taxi to shopping districts. Adores the hotel's design and it's room. Great attention to detail and it's customer service, even prior to arrival, swift and efficient assistance via email too. Noted a shortcoming is the lack of pool, Jacuzzi, sauna facility in a 5 star hotel. Will stay there again and recommend to friends.

I entrusted the Mandarin Oriental with the celebration of my wife's 60th birthday, and we were delighted. This was indeed a memorable and thoroughly enjoyable sojourn. The staff, from the managers to the bell hops, were totally devoted to ensuring our stay was as comfortable and pleasurable as possible. It was clear that not only did all employees took their job seriously, but they genuinely love working at the MOTYO.A special mention to Managers Kai and Jihyun, Chef Daniele, pizzaiolo Luca, Chef Ping, Chef Nicolas, Chef Tokukatsu, Chef Imaizumi and concierge Ana Gervasi, for going above and beyond to look after us.From my wife and I, thank you. We very much look forward to returning in the very near future.

My Husband and I previously stayed 12 days last September, It's very well management High standards hotel, it's also very convenient place , easily to going to everywhere, we found out It's very relaxing and very comfortable place to stay at , We both like it very much ! We have just been another 12 days again two weeks ago, it's still our one of the most favourite Hotel , it's very High quality food in Breakfast and very delicious French and Chinese restaurant in the hotel , I would say normally we don't like much buffet breakfast, but Mandarin Tokyo Hotel there are provided much more fresh fruits, vegetables and so many different kind of fresh juices from local, it's very unique , especially the Manager Nicolos you can see him most every day keep very busy to looking after guests , even check tea or coffee still warm or not ,; will change a warm cup of tea or coffee for guest such such .... it's very impressive ! Staffs are very polite and very well trained ! Front desk Miss Jenny and others staff are very experienced, when we consulted about place to visiting and local restaurants information, they knows very well, provide very useful and valuable informations about all we need. As we are traveling quite lots country and staying lots different Hotels . Tokyo is wonderful place to visit and Mandairn Tokyo Hotel is perfect place to stay ! Given modern world people are so stressed, We felt that staying at Mandrain Tokyo hotel feel much peaceful and relaxing ! We are looking forward going back !

Mandarin Oriental properties are always amazing. The view from my window was spectacular and the morning buffet was delicious. The assistant manager personally greeted me and helped download my airplane boarding pass. My only complaint?.... Cost. As much as I liked the hotel, I would pick the Conrad Tokyo over this hotel. They are both beautiful and the attention to detail at both facilities is impressive. However, for considerably less money, I stayed in a King suite at the Conrad which was huge whereas I paid more to stay in a much smaller room in the Mandarin Oriental. If price is no object, then spend away at this hotel but to not feel cramped you will have to get a suite. My "double room" with a King bed totaled approximately $1200 and was rather small.

This is probably the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The rooms are absolutely fantastic.. with every amenity you could ask for, extremely comfortable bed, gigantic room, huge bath, powerful shower, high end toiletries, stunning music system.. the list goes on. I couldn't fault the service, they fulfilled all my needs. The restaurant and bar were surprisingly good, although a little busy, although I suppose that is never a bad thing? As the atmosphere was buzzing all weekend. Breakfast buffet was sensational..Every little touch you can think of has been catered to, and if it hasn't i'm sure the staff would be delighted to help.

We stayed for 5 nights at this magnificent hotel. The service we experienced is second to none. The subway station below the hotel makes navigating this metropolis a breeze. This is our first time experiencing Japanese hospitality. Words can not describe how courteous and helpful the staff at this hotel are. The breakfast buffet is excellent and made better by the staff. Thanks Kai for all your insights and suggestions of places to visit. With Amex platinum, we scored a free night, WIFI, breakfast and late checkout. Pretty good deal. Will not stay anywhere else if we are fortunate enough to visit this great city again.

I checked in to Mandarin Oriental Tokyo to celebrate my partner's birthday after reading so many good reviews.Check-in was smooth and efficient, just like any other Japanese hotels.The room was spacious and bed very comfortable.Bathroom is not the best design as there is no glass partition that prevents water from splashing out of the shower area. Having stayed at so many hotels around the world, this is the first time that a hotel didn't bother to offer any birthday cake or even a birthday card. The management just cannot be bothered at all which is really surprising.

We needed one night in Tokyo after travelling elsewhere in Japan, and decided to splurge on the Mandarin Oriental. It was really amazing. The service in particular was quite impeccable. We included the buffet breakfast, which was definitely the right decision as it was just fantastic. (There are two different breakfast areas - a Japanese style one, and one described as "American". We chose Japanese and it was terrific, the quality of the food was incredible eg. yoghurt from the Caspian Sea that was like something from another planet it was so good). Again, the service was sensational. For example, if you picked something from the buffet but didn't realise you might need a particular piece of cutlery to eat it, that item was provided to you within seconds of you realising you needed it and without having to even ask. Mt Fuji was fully in view from our table. We could have stayed hours at that breakfast but unfortunately had a plane to catch. The only query I might raise is that I'm pretty sure that in the hotel bar they allow people to smoke (unless someone had lit up there without permission), which really horrified me, but we were going for a drink elsewhere in the Ginza so avoided that area.

I have been staying a week in mandarin oriental tokyo, and i have to say that it was one of my best stay ever in a palace hotel in the world; and i have already tried few! the place is of course very beautiful like all mandarin hotel in the world, with all comfort, very refined for each and every details; and the entire staff team was amazing, from the management team to the concierge, discreet but very helpful each time we needed, providing a very customised service at a very high level; i faced some medical trouble when i was there and they helped us and took care of us in a very special way, really amazing for a big hotel like that even if it is a luxury one; they have also excellent restaurants: the french one signature which has a star in michelin is just unforgettable, the chef is doing an amazing work, the maitre d'hotel and sommelier advised us perfectly and made sure we had a fabulous moment; the sushi restaurant is also remarkable; we could feel that each and every person working there are so involved in their work with passion, it's rare to fell that from everyone in a place; will come back for sure; thanks to all of them, it made a big difference in our trip;

We had a wonderful stay at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. This was the third Mandarin Oriental property that I have stayed in and I am definitely a fan. The service was unparalleled. While I was checking in, the receptionists noticed that I had a Hello Kitty watch on. Because they realized that I like Hello Kitty, they gave me a little Hello Kitty gift. It was such a nice touch. The service at breakfast was impeccable. I would especially like to give special recognition to Niccolo. He was able to anticipate our every need at breakfast, but was able to do it in an unobtrusive way. I have never experienced better service than the service that he provided us. The location of the hotel is excellent as well. There is a Metro stop located right in the basement of the building which was extremely convenient. In addition, you can reach the nearby department stores via the basement corridors as well, which was very helpful during the cold and rainy weather that we experienced during our stay. I would say that the only complaint that I have is the fact that there is no free wifi. It has been a long time since I have stayed at a hotel (especially a hotel at the price point of the Mandarin Oriental) where wifi is not free. Despite that, I will definitely plan on staying at the Mandarin Oriental again when I return to Tokyo in the future.

We had a superb stay at a really wonderful hotel. The service, style, and service were exemplary. The room was very comfortable with great beds and pillows. The spa was first class . The breakfast was as good if not better than anywhere else in the world.Each restaurant was better than the next and look forward to returning to one of the best city hotels in the world

I stayed at the Mandarin for four nights in February. The hotel had impeccable service, a gorgeous lobby, and spacious rooms. It is very hard to find any issues with the stay - the staff are very attentive and courteous. The only thing that I would warn is that the restaurants and room service are very pricey, but the hotel is close to a number of places to eat and pick up food if that is an issue.

The luxury of this place is unparalleled The chandeliers on the lobbyThe couch and upholstery are out of this worldThe service is extremely politeAnd all the time is someone worry about what do you needThe look for a personal item for my wife and bring it to the room adaptMarvellous hotelA little bit expensive but you get what you payI'll come back if I have the chanceThank you

The hotel is stunning. The service is magnificent to the point were they remember what type of coffee you had the previous day in order to anticipate your needs.The room is great, specially the view, confort and technology. Finally the recomendations the concierge had for dinner were spot on.

The hotel is at the heart of Tokyo Metropolice. It's close to business area, shopping areas, downtown sightseeing places with scent of the Edo period, and the Imperial Palace, too. The view is great at day and night. The service is also satisfactory. And the restaurants there, especially, Cantonese dining place called "Sense" is my favorite.

Stayed here for two nights with 3adults and 2 kids. The views, rooms and services were outstanding. The location is perfect next to Mitsukoshi department store and subway. Not only the staffs were attentive and courteous, but also the services are flawless. The room is spacious. The breakfast was superb. This is our second visit and still love to come back again.

No much to say, just perfect. Definitely the best hotel to stay in Tokyo. The overall ambience is stunning, the staff are amazing - nothing is too much trouble, always polite and helpful, registration and check out were efficient and quickhey. The room was above expectations.

This is truly an excellent hotel and lives up to all it ratings. Very friendly and helpful staff, excellent restaurant choices (with three Michelin star restaurants - French, Cantones, and Tapas), excellent views (some looking out towards Mount Fuji), and everything is to perfection. It did take a while to get use to the lobby being on the 38th floor and the guest rooms being below ( lower floors instead of above). However, you will be paying for the luxury to stay in such a fine location. If you can afford the room rate ... then this is the place to be in Tokyo. Although I rate this as an excellent property, and room rates are hefty, I was surprised to have to pay a daily rate for Internet in addition to the room rate.

This hotel offers the best views, best service, and best amenities of any hotel in Tokyo. It comes at a steep price, but its worth it. The attention to detail and service was unlike anything I've seen at a luxury hotel outside of Japan. Expect the hotel to bend over backwards to make sure your stay is everything you wanted it to be.I selected a room which provided 7000yen/day to use on hotel amenities, which offered me the choice to use the in-hotel restaurants and lounges which I would normally look for outside. Everything I had was outstanding. I recommend enjoying the morning brunch, weekend dim-sum, and enjoying a cocktail in the mandarin lounge - all with sweeping views of the city below you.

We spent 2 weeks at the Mandarin Oriental in August September.From the time of our arrival to departure every facet was simply the best.The smiles, the friendliness, the device, not servile and not intrusive but efficient and the facilities were close to the best we have received anywhere.we could not call it inexpensive but given the quality of all facets I would not say it was expensive. the quality of everything justified the price

The hotel you should not miss! Contrary to my perception, it is quite conveniently located and there are traditional shops nearby which are worthwhile to explore. Also there are a few good restaurants within walking distance.

The service, rooms and facilities are simply amazing. Was such a pleasure staying at the hotel and would go back in a heartbeat. On my last day I had a very late flight so they let me use the spa facilities, gym etc and were extremely warm and accommodating.The location - one comment would be that the walk back from Tokyo Station area late at night is very quiet. Given this is Tokyo, I wouldn't highlight safety as a concern but it's just something to note.

Words can not describe the exceptional service and facilities of the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo. Special mention goes to Niccolo (Senior Breakfast Manager), Kai (Food & Beverage Manager), Luca (Pizza chef extrodaniere) and Daisuke (Hotel Assistant Manger). The staff at this hotel have an uncanny ability to predict your every need before you even know what your next wish is. I could go on and on about our Mandarin experience however I think it is best experienced for yourself....enjoy!

I stayed here when on conference with Lexus and rate this property very highly. The rooms are spacious and well designed. They have a luxurious feel. They were very clean and comfortable. Beautiful views over Tokyo.Would love to stay here again and highly recommend the hotel.

Had a spectacular dinner in the gourmet restaurant where every plate is a masterpiece From the French chef performing in an open kitchen. The wait staff stands ready to meet your every wish. Everyone dining feels like royalty. Make sure you take small bites to savor all the flavor a in every course.

It is a very beautiful place, we liked the view in MO! The rooms are comfortable, clean, and have all that one needs. We recommend the breakfast. The staff is friendly, efficient, helpful, and cable to assist English-speaking guests. The location is super.
user_name:
Maria P
Punta del Este, Uruguay

review_body: We stayed at the Mandarin in January this year and I could not fault the hotel. The staff are amazing nothing was too much trouble. The check was the best I have ever had we were taken straight to our room and they had a little arrival gift of milk and cookies for our 9 year daughter. That night when we could not find a restaurant they recommended a staff member from their Concierge desk took the time to personally guide us to the restaurant. Thank you for the most wonderful experience.

If you can get used to having to travel up to the main floor before you can get access to the elevators that take you down to ground level, then you are in for a treat. The concierge system at this hotel is well beyond what you normally experience. We were showered with special gifts and origami, because the staff there either took a liking to us, or just like to add an extra soft touch or two. Be careful of drinking too much, as you navigate a stone path across water to get to your bar table, or you might be in for a wet one! Many hotel hallways are narrow and bleak, but even here, there is am emphasis on harmony and mystique. Bravo to this fine centrally located gem!

After much research we chose the MO Tokyo and were not disappointed. Excellently located near a metro station with taxis easily available, it almost floats above the city but is still somehow connected to it.The room was large and had a resort feel, with beautiful amenities and a decadent bed.The staff provided an exceptional level of service and almost anticipated our every need, with an extraordinary level of communication within the team.The breakfast buffet was generous and of superlative quality. There was a choice of a la carte breakfast venues, between quiet and clubby, and bustling and busy.There were many restaurants in-house, with spectacular views and great variety and on a clear day you could even see Mt Fuji from some of them.The spa was indulgent and modern, and the fitness centre well-equipped and efficient.We experienced a few problems which were resolved with much grace and efficiency.However surprisingly the hotel still permits smoking in the bar, which in the evening filled the lobby with the cheap and nasty smell of cigarettes.The establishment would be perfect if they updated their smoking policy.Notwithstanding this the hotel is strongly recommended for its location, luxury and impeccable service.

This was my 2nd stay at the MO in Tokyo. I travel to Tokyo 3-4x a year for business and usually stay at the Four Seasons but my husband suggested I try the MO. My first stay was ok. There was hair in my bathroom, miscommunications with the concierge team, issues with check out, etc. Management was very apologetic so I have the hotel another chance and I am thrilled that I did. The team (in particular, the Head of the Concierge team) made sure everything was perfect and I'm happy to say I have a new favorite hotel. Service was perfect, the room was in perfect order, they had the bill ready to go for check out, they automatically gave me late check out....I could go on and on. They really went above and beyond. Thanks for a great stay.

The MO in Tokyo exceeded all my expectations. From check-in to check-out, service was flawless. The room (3503) was tastefully decorated. The floor-to-ceiling window allowed us a brief glimpse of Mt. Fuji in the horizon when the sun came out the first morning of our winter visit. The Front Desk associate who handled our check-in was very apologetic that the sushi restaurant in the hotel (which had extremely limited seating) was completely booked during our stay. She made up for it by recommending and making reservations for us at an excellent sushi restaurant (Sushi Nihonbashi Seamon) on the 4th Floor of a building across the street. The bell desk person accompanied us across the street to make sure we would not get lost. The breakfast buffet had an excellent selection of premium breakfast items. Where else would you find fresh crabs benedict where the egg's gooey yolk is so richly orange because (as was explained to us) the hen ate only hibiscus flowers? Loved it!

We had a 10 night stay here. How likely is it that over this length of stay there are no issues encountered and if there is any concern at all it is dealt with such high standard of professionalism. I would recommend this hotel without reservation- it is definitely not just a pretty face although it is of course stunning with amazing views from the 38th floor where most of the dining options are located. Staying about 250 nights a year in hotels in different cities we have some pretty good benchmarks but this one sets a new gold standard. The in house dining options are extensive: The MO bar- try the Japanese Mojito (off menu) Tapas Molecular Bar (good fun even if a little pricey), French, Chinese, Italian, Sushi and even a gourmet deli serving fresh cakes and coffee. Staff in every part of the hotel are delightful and I will be rather sad to leave here tomorrow!
user_name:
A5905QXsteveg
New York City, New York

review_body: Above all else, the service is the thing that I remember the most. It’s hard to find bad customer service in Japan, but the MO manages to lift it up a level. Wonderfully attentive staff, concierge that always went the extra mile, super service in all the restaurants.The decor is beautiful, I was surprised to learn that the hotel is now over 10 years old, but it doesn’t look it at all. I stayed in a Mandarin Suite and it was beautifully appointed, very comfortable – and the views were of course breathtaking.
