A meal here will be remembered for the rest of your life or at least until you find an excuse to return.The Bar is also worth spending some time in. Dimly lit to maximise the impact of the jaw-dropping views and serving some imaginative cocktails while a jazz pianist and his double-bass playing sidekick set the mood. We spent too long (and too much money) in there but enjoyed every hour before stumbling back to the sanctuary of our room.The staff are all excellent and go out of their way to exceed high expectations. We had an issue at check-in when it looked like our booking had been cancelled (it hadn't and I'd prepaid which made it more concerning) but they put is in a room anyway while they figured out what happened. Later in the day we received a small gift and hand written note apologising for any inconvenience (there hadn't really been any) and assuring us it would never happen again. These little touches are the small differences that make the very best hotels stand out. In a city with a very 'high bar' anyway, the Mandarin Oriental sits confidently at the top of the tree.If I had a gripe it would be the ridiculous charge for WiFi. Why any luxury hotel does this in the 21st century bemuses me (particularly when it already costs a small fortune to stay there) but I'm not going to mark the property or its staff down for a daft corporate decision. Yes it's expensive but if you get a chance to stay here do so - even if only for one night. You won't regret it. And book one of the 8 seats at Molecule well in advance - you can do so via their website. Their excellent Concierge service are more than happy to sort any other reservations and assist with your travel plans well in advance too - just drop them an email.

This is the perfect 5-class hotel and everything you expect at this price and chain is there. No room for disappointments. Yet it is still possible to find something that is better than perfection. On this occasion, it was Niccolo Brachelente, the Senior Breakfast Manager, WHO feels every question mark on your face and works himself to his limits to make all customers as happy as possible, or even more. Thanks to him and the whole hotel team.

My husband and me consider Tokyo one of our most preferred cities for leisure. And, Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is our best choice in the city.This is our 4th stay there within a year. Each stay marks something unique in our memory. We checked in early in the morning as we arrived by overnight flight. MO Tokyo did kindly anticipate our needs and made a room available as soon as we arrived so we could freshen up before we explored the city. We did highly appreciate this extra arrangement.As the Director of Rooms Mr Levis greeted us upon arrival and we caught up with one another in our casual conversation at the front desk, my husband joked about it was actually our anniversary of staying with MO Tokyo since our first stay. Frankly we did not expect anything but MO Tokyo was so tender and sent us a greetings card with lovely sweets to brighten up our day. Hospitality of this standard truly excels.We look forward to another excellent stay with the hotel.Mr and Mrs Liu

My family travelled to Japan for the first time. We spent time in Tokyo, Kyoto and Hiroshima. I cannot say enough good things about the Mandarin Oriental. The staff was incredible. The rooms, food, atmosphere and level of service went beyond our expectations. We have stayed at the Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton in the past, but this was our first experience with MO. They attended to our every need, including dining reservations, tours, shopping and welcoming us back to Tokyo upon our return from Kyoto. They even called our hotel in Kyoto to let them know about the time of our arrival (which was a Ritz). The food and fruit delivered each afternoon was a wonderful touch. If you ever have an opportunity to go to the MO, you will be absolutely delighted! Thanks to the entire staff for a wonderful family vacation. R. Gupta

We just stayed at the Mandarin in Tokyo as a treat for a couple of days and it was just that - a very special experience. The service, the views, the attention to detail in the design are exceptional. I only wish the beautiful soaking tubs were available to the guests for more hours. They are only complimentary 6am - 9am. Also, the prices for the hotel rooms seem to change daily. So if you booked a night and then decide you want to stay for a second night, the price could be dramatically higher.

We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo a couple of weeks ago. We travel a lot but I rarely write reviews. But this hotel was really fantastic and went above and beyond. Highlights included the concierge (absolutely outstanding, helped with countless great restaurant reservations including three start michelins, had nice printed maps and directions for all of our reservations prepared for us when we checked in, would even email me out of the blue with suggestions of activities they thought I would like such an animal sushi making class! Tom in particular was absolutely fantastic and just so nice, pleasant, and helpful), beautiful hotel (very classy, gorgeous views from every part of the hotel, everything was new and nice and very tastefully/well done), and great staff (they were incredibly attentive and would hand us waters when we were going for a walk. Or if I was getting dim sum at the breakfast buffett they would be at my table to hand me chopsticks when I got back). The food was excellent and we got a packaged rate that included their amazing breakfast as well as free wifi. Location is central, super easy to main sights, fish market, and subway lines. One of our favorite hotels ever!!
user_name:
sami055
New York City, New York

review_body: Tasteful hotel with great location. But children are not allowed in most of the restaurants in the hotel. The hotel is next to Mitsukoshi department store which has a wonderful food court. We got great sushi there for a few nights

The hotel service is perfect and supreme, and staffs are very friendly. The spa is wonderful with a great view. The only downside is the Chinese restaurant that does not have the comfortable sitting. I will be going back to this hotel whenever I visit Tokyo.

I stayed with MO Tokyo in May, adding one more MO to my fan collection. :) The staffs are super helpful and friendly. One of them even walked us out to show us how to navigate the city. The view from the hotel is lovely and the foods are delicious. I loved watching sunrise/night city lights with a view to the Tokyo sky tree.

This was my first time visiting the stunning, sprawling city of Tokyo, and the Mandarin Oriental was a perfect place to stay for our six nights there. The hotel is located in one of the main business centers of Tokyo cluttered with restaurants and shops, but the most convenient part of its location is the placement of a Tokyo Metro station right underneath the hotel, which makes traveling to different locations of the huge city of Tokyo easy without a car.The highlight of our stay was the friendliness and the helpfulness of the staff. They bowed to us every time we left for the day and greeted us every time we returned. When one of us got sick, they recommended a great, english-speaking doctor. Another time, they got tickets for us to a concert in Tokyo when we asked.We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant every day. Each dish we had there was delicious, including Eggs Benedict, green tea pancakes, Belgian waffles, and french toast. The servers were great and made substitutions when we asked. The buffet, which had a large selection of baked goods, meat, and fruits. The hotel had many different restaurants for dinner, which I'm sure were all very good, but we only had the opportunity to try one, the Italian restaurant. I had the beef tenderloin, which was superb.Our room was very comfy and had an impressive view of Tokyo. We could even see the Tokyo SkyTree! The one main complaint about the hotel that I have is the lobby always smelling of smoke. It's possible that people were allowed to smoke in the lounge or fancy restaurants, which made it less appealing to be in the lobby.All in all, with phenomenal service, ideal convenience, and delicious food, the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo was virtually perfect for our stay in Tokyo.

Service is first class and the whole experience was amazing. We stayed for around 13 nights in this hotel. The location is excellent, the room very clean, the staff service amazing - Recommend this luxury hotel!

Lovely hotel in the center of Tokyo. Incredible views, I could not get enough of the views from my room, the lobby, and their restaurants. Also, the pillow bar is to die for. Selection of 9 different pillows. I did not want to leave.

This is the second time my husband and I have visited Tokyo and what a difference staying at Mandarin Oriental made! We loved the city before and now we are head over heels in love. This gorgeous and luxurious hotel is located in a beautiful central area, just above the Mitsukoshi-mae Station.Our beautiful room was located on the 35th floor, and had an incredible view of the Skytree. What an experience to go to sleep and to wake up to that! I am not mentioning how luxurious the amenities were-because as this being MO, that's probably a given. We adored the spa (go in a bit earlier than your treatment and enjoy the jacuzzi pool!) and loved the hotel bar (ambiance-wise and menu-wise). You will probably never want to get a happy hour cocktail elsewhere once you try the Ajisai! We didn't have enough time to enjoy the restaurants in the hotel, but that was only because our incredible concierge team helped us book many dream Tokyo eateries (some were almost impossible to get a reservation to but Sato-san at the concierge and her colleagues managed to book them for us). We will be trying some of the restaurants in the hotel when we go back. Also, try the Gourmet Shop downstairs for the best croissants (easily comparable to those in Paris).Thank you so much for such an incredible experience.

We stayed in Mandarin for five nights. The hotel was beautiful and centrally located. We had an amazing view overlooking Tokyo from the 35th floor and could see Mt. Fuji in the distance! The staff could not have been more attentive or accommodating! If you asked where something was, they would personally escort you there....even to the subway which was located below the hotel. It was a wonderful experience and would highly recommend this hotel!

The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo had by far the best service I've seen from a hotel. The staff was welcoming, helpful and quick to make sure a request was addressed. Additionally, upon our arrival with our two kids, they had prepared a binder of suggested places to visit then surprised our kids with a welcome pizza box (via room service) that had a dessert pizza made with watermelon, other fruits and white chocolate. I cannot say enough about this hotel--the staff, service, the views and the food. A great way to enjoy a stay in Tokyo.

The lobby is as beautiful as the pictures on the website. Stunning views of the city. I stayed in the mandarin suite. Very nice, clean, and modern. Also stunning views. Both fitness center (although small) and spa are nice. It is expensive but worth. Staff is very friendly. Great service. I would stay at the hotel again.

Room is very spacious and nice designed ..very comfortable. Employees are very helpful like 5/6 stars hotel should be. Breakfast manager was so attentive ..the only draw back is the hotel lobby is not smoking free .. Feel like Las Vegas there..

I had to chose among a few 5*L hotels in Tokyo but I am happy with my choice. The staff is wonderful, hotel is nicely furbished, you have a M station just below the hotel, you get a Skytree view if you are lucky. There is nothing at least a little bad I could say about it. It was just perfect.

It is hard to find anything to fault the Mandarin Oriental with, so again this hotel scores perfect marks and I love staying here for business (and also would stay for pleasure, though I prefer the Palace). Location is excellent, there are many charming restaurants nearby, but also excellent choices in the hotel itself. But extremely pricey! I ate breakfast at both options and enjoyed the choice. Great views, nice bar.
user_name:
intrepidgirlLondon
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed while visiting Japan for my 30th birthday, and experienced a level of service I have never encountered before. Staff at the Mandarin made every effort to ensure my stay was everything I wanted, from ensuring that I had hard-to-get restaurant reservations to providing maps, travel tips and timetables for the Shinkansen.The room was spacious, extremely comfortable and with useful gadgets like bluetooth speaker and international plug sockets, and the complimentary wifi was very quick. Rooms with a view of Mt. Fuji obviously aren't guaranteed one, as a foggy haze can obscure the horizon in the hotter months.Food in their K'Shiki restaurant is very pleasant, and Susho Sora is absolutely excellent.The Mandarin is, without a doubt, the best Western-style hotel I've stayed in.

TL;DR - amazing hotel. Breakfast at Kishki is a must. wear the kimono in the room. use the spa.Without doubt - the best experience I've had in a hotel of its kind. We stayed for 9 nights, and it is too easy to get used to living that way.Above all, I think the service must be mentioned. The staff is absolutely eager to please, but in a good way. So attentive, so kind, and with such a good will. On one hand, they're never in your face when you don't feel like seeing anyone or talking, and on the other hand - they are always there for you. And for the more practical things. We had a wonderful room on the 31st floor - with view to Otemachi station area - very urban and nice. The bed was giant and comfortable. There was a lovely shezlong that I enjoyed to sit on at the end of each day and relax in front of the city lights. The shower and tub are amazing too. A very nice touch that is worth mentioning is the Kimono / Yukata that is being laid out for you every day. I just loved wearing it after shower. The breakfast that was included in the room fee is either a Buffet style at the K'shiki restaurant or a fixed menu American Breakfast at the place next door, which I didn't even bother to remember its name. No doubt where to eat: the buffet is AMAZING. Never seen such variety of breakfast-brunch food, all fresh and of the highest quality. And last one thing: we didn't try the hotel's spa treatment this time. However, we did get to use it to refresh before we left the hotel - few hours after our check out - and the facility is absolutely gorgeous. So if you're there - take a look at the spa and consider ordering a treatment. btw - Jacuzzi and Sauna are free for guests in the morning - and it's a shame we didn't use it.Bottom line - it's an AMAZING hotel, and it was such a treat to get back there every evening after exploring hectic and hot (but lovely) Tokyo and relax there until the next-morning-adventure. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

A 5-star hotel wo a pool or free wifi - ridiculous. The check in lady actually told us because we booked directly with the hotel (more so as a returning guest!) that we couldn't get free wifi! She recommended we use an online service in future ... How silly is that policy/practice?! With more hotels coming up like the Aman, MO needs to wake up to the reality of staying current and relevant. Disappointing. Also there was some construction or renovation noise every morning - they should have managed this better as it was v disruptive for sleep.

The best kept hotel we've every stayed in around the world. The service especially was second to none as was the amazing food. Everything from room-service, to breakfasts at Kishiki, to the Pizza Bar were all world class. Also the concierge service was outstanding. It seemed every person, even cleaning people knew our names and our itinerary and needs throughout our stay. Could not recommend them any higher.P.S. Oh, and we went all out and reserved all the Spa suites for multi-hour private treatments with panorama views of Tokyo. Words cannot describe the awesomeness. If you are fortunate enough to afford and arrange such a treat, definitely do so!

The MO in Tokyo is a gem! It has an amazing city view, great bars and restaurants and a top class gym. The hotel is everything you expect and more.The real value add is the concierge service. They hjelped us book and cancel a number of restaurants and provided us with essential information for our travels in Japan. A special thank you to the wonderfull ms Fuyumi Sato who spent a lot of time helping me book and plan a stay in Shimoda. I would have been unable to book this trip without her help. The location of the hotel is perfect. The surrounding area is full of places to eat and shopping (around Tokyo Station). Public transport is only two minutes away and gives easy access to Ginza, Roppongi and the Sjukiji fish market. I am already planning our next visit!

I have ever had a dinner at the french restaurant and drinks at the bar, and they were not very impressive. This time, I stayed at the hotel. It was really wonderful. Firstly, the room was bigger than regular hotels and has a very good sound proof construction, and the room ceiling was much higher than standard.  The bath tub is big and deep enough to relax. The in-room dining Japanese breakfast was impressive. Nice to have it with Champagne and wine together with the nice view from the large windows. The Molecular tapas bar was interesting to try as amusement, but is not suitable for relaxing dinner.

The views from the lobby/lounge are really shocking. Beautiful top views from Tokyo lights, the restaurants really good. My favorite cocktails ever, great piano romantic live music! Either if you're staying on this hotel or not, its worth paying a visit and chilling on the bar. Grab something to eat or drink!For more pictures go to my instagram acccount @quiwitips

Our stay at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo was truly fantastic. My daughter and I celebrated her birthday there and our trip was made incredible by the staff at the hotel. Our every need was seen to with a smile and our every request was fullfiled. If in Tokyo, one should not stay anywhere but Mandarin Oriental. The hotel is incredible, the accomodation is devine, the Spa is delightful and the Staff 'OUTSTANDING".

The hotel was everything you would expect from a luxury property. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating and made my 12 year old son and I feel right at home even though we were 1/2 way around the world.

Service is outstanding, the views are amazing, the breakfast was very good, the room was ample, full of amenities. However, there are two thing that I did not like. First, I cannot believe a hotel is still charging the wifi in 2015 !!! I'm sorry but it's like charging for the towels !!! It really put me in bad mood when a hotel does this. It's the Mandarin, it's not a low cost airline!!!! Second, the location is average for tourism. In the evening, the neighborhood is really empty.There are much better neighborhoods to stay if it's your first time in Tokyo. In short, I would never stay again in this hotel in Tokyo.

Location makes it easy for sightseeing (easy subway from the basement) and shopping ( literally next door) and restaurants; that is, if you want to dine at restaurants not in the Mandarin which are spectacular. Views from the large rooms.....remember you are over 30 stories up, help you see and understand the great city Tokyo. So you have all the amenities (exercise room ....wonderful breakfast buffet) plus the best staff of any hotel that we (my wife and I) have ever experienced. Every staff member wants to help you in any way possible. This review seems trite but this hotel is number one and is determined to remain at that level. Quality and friendly and helpful and when you return to Tokyo there is no where you would rather

I have recently returned after spending a week in this amazing hotel. This was the second time I have stayed and I really wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting Tokyo, It really is amazing in so many ways. The service is incredible, if only all hotels were like this! The views...WOW! We had a standard room on the 31st floor and it was just perfect, plenty of room, everything you need and more, Bottega Veneta toiletries and the most comfortable bed. I was lucky to secure a corporate rate and so the rate was very reasonable, of course if I was paying full price I would probably think that it is pretty expensive. We ate breakfast every day in the K'shiki buffet restaurant which offers a great selection of Japanese and more western foods, amazing pastries, juices and hot foods including freshly cooked eggs. We didn't have breakfast included in our rate and so this would cos us approx £22 per person each day, yes its above average but it was convenient and we enjoyed what we had. I feel this restaurant at breakfast was really the only place in the hotel where service wasn't consistent if I'm being picky. On the days Niccolo served us the service was mind blowingly good. When he wasn't around then I would say it was as good as any other hotel out there. We generally went to the Mandarin bar most evenings after dining out of the hotel and we were always greeted with a warm welcome and they always found us a comfy place to sit and relax. They have a vast menu of drinks and cocktails and with live music it was a great place to chill. Several members of the concierge team helped us plan our days and evenings and I really don't know what I would have done without them! They were amazing! The best I have ever experienced. There was an area that we wanted to revisit from last time and I couldn't remember where it was but I did have a photo on my phone of a temple in the area and the concierge tracked it down and told us where to go! Another time I had a mosquito bite which had become rather painful and swollen, the lady from concierge came with me to the pharmacy and translated so that I could get the appropriate cream. I used the spa in the afternoon of the last day, not for a treatment but just to relax in the sauna, steam room and vitality pools. When I arrived I was told there was a 7000 yen charge (approx £35) even though I was staying in the hotel. Apparently it is only complimentary between 06:30 and 09:00. I think this is disappointing, and really it should be complimentary at all times for residents. I did express this to the lady and she let me in free of charge, although I did buy some products off her. Maybe this is something the Mandarin Oriental could review?! It was a great place to relax for an hour but the area is reasonably small. There is no actual pool for swimming. The location of the hotel for us is perfect. The metro station (Mitsukoshimae) is in the basement of the building and you can access the Ginza and Hanzomon lines from there without having to go outside. The immediate area surrounding the hotel is also very good. there is a huge department store (Mitsukoshi) next door and some great little cafes and restaurants. We also visited the Gourmet shop by Mandarin Oriental which is on the ground floor and serves great snacks, cakes and drinks. There is comfortable outdoor seating and a small area to sit inside. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough and cant wait to return!

I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in August 2014 The spa was the nicest I've ever been in with a soaking pool with Panoramic views of the city. The hotel is top notch and the service was unparalleled. The hotel was happy to help with directions in busy Tokyo. The concierge was more than happy to book my train ticket to Kyoto.

This is a truly wonderful hotel with a special level of service and staff attentiveness. From breakfast to the concierge and spa staff and everyone in between every member of the staff was truly wonderful. The food we had at Sushi Sora (do yourself a favor and dine here) as well as breakfast was delicious with unbelievable views. Our room was spacious and well designed with a similarly beautiful view over Tokyo and toward Mount Fuji. Having stayed at a few of Tokyo's luxury hotels, this property is on a level all its own.

Together with my wife we had the opportunity attend pop-up Noma restaurant dinner and as a part of the package we stayed at the Mandarin Oriental. Paying a premium price we came with high expectations. However, Mandarin Oriental Tokyo managed to deliver beyond my expectations. Though the hotel and "hardware" is first class, my praise goes to the staff and the management, BRAVO!

The location is perfect, right at the Mitsukoshimae station of Tokyo Metro Ginza line. We went to Tokyo to celebrate our 2nd anniversary and chose this luxury hotel as the perfect ending. As usual, my choice won't be wrong! The room is big, maybe twice the size of our previous hotel, but it's comfortable and warm( sometimes the big rooms make me feel...cold and empty). And the biggest surprise was not the cakes, but the handwritten card! Also, the view is good, we even saw the top of Tokyo Tower!I always enjoy the breakfast time when I stay at hotel. Delicious food, relaxing atmosphere and great view which start my day with fulfillment. Due to the canceled flight, I didn't really have the chance to enjoy it this time. But those we had were great. It's quite a pity to end up like this, so I thought I will come back again.The only imperfection for me is that I can smell the smoke at check-in floor, which made me a little uncomfortable. There must be some way to figure it out.

We stayed in a deluxe premier room. We had to change rooms because our first one had a strong smoke smell (even though we asked for a non-smoking room) and as such we did not get the view we wanted. The rooms are big and beautifully appointed like all MO rooms. There are a number of high quality restaurants in the hotel as well as a beautiful bar was a good selection of Japanese whisky.The service was excellent. The location was very good, close to Ginza. The breakfast buffet was the best I have had at a Tokyo hotel (better than the Ritz and the Park Hyatt). This is a very good 5-star hotel in Tokyo.

From its beautifully designed lobby high over Tokyo to its rooms with great appointments and views of the city this was a great hotel especially after a long flight. The staff were wonderful as was the food and surroundings. Outstanding with flawless service.

I just stayed four nights here beginning 7/2/15 and have to say this was the best hotel experience I have ever had. Everything is first rate. The Spa is incredible and the entire hotel staff was amazing. Yoji Osada at the K'shiki restaurant provided Outstanding service and made my friend feel like Royalty. I have travelled all over the world and nothing comes close to this. The Mandarin will be my Top choice from now on.

Nothing to add. Perfect stay with a quality of service that is impossible to find anywhere else than in Japan. A must in the city which is already overranking any other place on this criterias... If you can afford, just go there and hold your breath arriving at the reception for the first time, experience an amazing massage in the sky and dive into another cullinar world with the japanese "cuisine molléculaire"!

This is the best urban hotel we have ever stayed in! It is on the top floors of a skyscraper in an excellent area of Tokyo. It is a bit strange because the actual lobby is on the 38th floor and the rooms are on a number of looks below that. Not a problem! The staff is superb- extremely attentive and helpful but without artificiality. The view from the room- especially at night is pretty spectacular. We were there for three nights and only had breakfasts at the hotel,but they were great!

I stayed in this hotel a week ago with my mother during our trip to Japan. Overall, the experience was very good, but not unforgettable as in my other stays at Mandarin Oriental hotels, mostly due to some lack of coordination and communication between hotel staffs which leads to not a top notch service as I used to have in the other hotels of the brand.First, at arrival, the taxi driver left us at the wrong entrance, he just stoped at the entry of the building when he saw the hotel name written, and we were left by ourselves with our luggages which was very unpleasant. Two staffs at the Gourmet Shop saw us but didn't indicate to us the entry of the hotel, and it was a lady from the Information desk who came to escort us to the right entrance. After that, our luggages were taken and we did the check in at the 38th floor, it was done very efficiently and smoothly by very nice staffs. The room was gorgeous, modern, spacious and very well apointed, and the bonus was the stunning view of Tokyo (especially at night). Also the bed was extremely comfortable and we slept very well. However, we were waken up by a lady of the room service before 7 AM who rang at the door and knocked so many times that we had to open to her, just to found out that it was her mistake! We had indeed the previous night ordered in room dinning, but I called the room service after we finished our meals and the table was taken out of the room after midnight. So to be waken up the next morning by a lady of the room service who asked us to take back the table made us in quite bad mood as it reflected a lack of coordination and communication between hotel stfafs, which is not acceptable for a Mandarin Oriental hotel. A similar issue happened also after the check out for our luggages. While the check out was done very professionnaly in less than 5 min, for our luggages it was different. I indeed booked the Aiport Limousine bus tickets for Narita, and the assistant manager took our tickets and our luggages receipt and told us to rest before the bus came, and that the hotel staffs will take care of everything...Well, we did not rest actually, because we were interrupted by staffs asking for our bus tickets, and few minutes before the bus arrived by staffs asking where did we put our luggages receipts. I had to explain each time that the assistant manager took them all so I did not have them, and in the end it was ok as they found them.Communication between the hotel staffs was lacking, which led to not a flawless service as one can expect from a 5 stars hotel. It made me admit that I had done a mistake by cancelling my reservation at the Park Hyatt to choose Mandarin Oriental instead, as you are not at their level considering the service, even if your room may be nicer.I will still be loyal to the Mandarin Oriental hotels brand, but for my next stay in Tokyo I won't choose this hotel and instead choose Park Hyatt for sure.

We had excellent experience for 3 nights stay. Perfect location, easy access, very professional services, and gorgeous lobby. The French restaurant is excellent. Everyone from the concierge to lobby greeters are friendly, polite and very helpful. I would go back anytime.
user_name:
Judith A
New York City, New York

review_body: Five star service, five star views, five star amenities and a true five star experience.The hotel is located on the 30th - 38th floor of a building centrally located in Tokyo right above the Mitsukoshimae Station off of the Ginza and Hanzomon Subway lines. The view from every room in the hotel is spectacular. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and our room was spacious and extremely comfortable.The included breakfast buffet is one of the best I've ever had, make sure you order the French Toast. The gym is well equipped for a hotel and the sauna at the spa is so relaxing. They have thought of everything from the turn down service to the pillow menu and even Bottega Veneta toiletries.Hideki the front office manager took great care of us as soon as we walked into the hotel. And Jenny the guest relations manager helped us find a great restaurant for our last evening in Tokyo. The hotel is pricey but worth every single yen. I would definitely stay here again and I hope you have the opportunity to stay here too.

Very friendly, very luxurious hotel. Fantastic views, brilliant restaurants. Large rooms with everything one can ask for. Will return here, highly recommend it even if it's quite expensive. Central location for tourists and by the way: don't be afraid to use Metro. It is really quite easy, just read the signs

This hotel and its staff go above and beyond to make my stay legendary. I'm not sure if I know how to function on my own after leaving here. Highly recommend this hotel to everyone. The facility is super clean and pretty. The fitness center has the best views of the city.

I stayed in Tokyo MO for 3 nights last week and I am very impressed with its personalized service. Having stayed at multiple 5-start hotels in all of the big global cities (HK, BJ, NY, London, Ritz, Four Seasons etc), I think Tokyo MO wins for me for its human touch. The hotel itself is very new with a stunning view of Tokyo, very clean and comfortable space. Definitely on par with all the other MO's I've stayed. Upon arrival, we were told that the hotel provided full set of gym clothing, which is something that no other hotels have provided. This is especialy good for us since we packed lightly and didn't bring gym shoes for our vacation. We also noticed every night that the hotel already filled up the hot water maker every night when we came back to our room, which was very thoughtful.Lastly, it was my birthday two days after the check-out date however the hotel still gave us some cake as well as a hand-drawn birthday card. I know most hotels provide cakes for birthday however rarely have I seen a hand-drawn birthday card, which brought a personal touch.Overall, I was very please with the stay and would come back if I come back to Tokyo.

Just go. The best hotel I've stayed in, globally; can't wait to return, the following pretty much sums it up...I arrived at 7.30am overnight from HK ahead of a business meeting at 9am, I showered and pulled a fresh shirt out of my bag, it was a mess. I immediately called housekeeping and asked for an iron to be delivered to my room. It turned up within 5 minutes, the lady arranged the ironing board and plugged the iron in (pre-filled with distilled water), meanwhile I was getting dressed, the lady turned to me and asked "how hot would you like the iron? Would you like steam or dry?". I was lost for words. Not only does this hotel deliver it over delivers in buckets. Please do let me know where else this happens on earth as to date I've not seen anything like it.

Great location for shopping - right across the street from Mitsukoshi and Coredo buildings. Also very close to Tokyo station and good access to metro/subway system. The hotel is in great condition and of a very high standard. Wonderful views of Tokyo from the common areas and the rooms. The room was in very good condition. Electronic controls for lights, blinds, and curtains everywhere. The room was not very big, but this is a bit standard with Mandarin Oriental. In room wifi was free - which is great and was a change from previous Mandarin Oriental experiences, so a very welcome (and overdue) apparent change in policy. Service was fine, without being particularly special. The concierge I dealt with seemed disinterested, borderline annoyed, and was not particularly enthusiastic, although in the end he did find us a great place for Tempura nearby. But overall I found the service somewhat less attentive than in previous MO stays. Minor point. Lastly, the breakfast buffet was awesome and very much in keeping with MO tradition. Breakfast room enjoys wonderful views. Overall, a very nice place and a very good stay. Would recommend for a high end stay in Tokyo.

Stayed 2 nights with our family finishing up a 3 week adventure in Japan. The hotel is right on top of the subway, well located to several magnificent departments stores with tons of eating just right across the street. The check in desks overlook the Tokyo skyliness (as does the Men's urinals, which is btw is simply awesome!). The rooms were completely modern and prefect in every way. The service could not have been better, with attentive and extremely hospital staff at every turn. Food in the restaurants was also top notch. We ate in the Italian for lunch and the buffet for breakfast. Both were easy and excellent. WiFi is by purchase only, so that's a slight, slight negative for a hotel in this class.We stayed here and the Hyatt in Shinjuku and I would say that this is an overall better location but the Hyatt has a more comfortable bed. Overall, a draw and either is a top, top choice if you're looking for ultimate luxury in downtown Tokyo.

As long as there is no big price difference, choose Mandarin. This is the second Mandarin I have been to, and this is also marvelous. First one was HongKong. If no chance to stay, just go and sit in the reception, one of the best views in the city!

We were extremely impressed with the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. It is in the middle of the city and there are lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. The room was extremely well appointed with a fantastic view of the city. The concierge service was phenomenal! We were interested in a Kuboki theatre that had English translation and they were able to find a show that we could attend. They also helped us with our shopping. The food and service at our breakfast were outstanding. They have an eggs Benedict with crab meat as part of their buffet that was excellent. I have never seen a more responsive wait staff. When my coffee was low they were right there to refresh it. They have an excellent buffet and when I put in some bread to be toasted they immediately offered to watch it and bring it to the table. Everyone who worked there went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and cared for. It was a wonderful experience.

Fabulous! From check in to check out you are treated like royalty. Everyone is extremely friendly and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Restaurants were exceptional and every meal was superb. Rooms are well appointed and offer great views of the city and surrounding area. Great location for shipping and public transportation.
user_name:
Jacqueline A
Bay Shore, New York

review_body: Overall a fantastic experience. Everything you would expect from a Mandarin Oriental.Very nice rooms, good location, extremely good service.Recommend the sushi bar and a drink in their hotel bar afterwards.Can't wait to go back again this year.

Went on a work trip and got the chance to stay at this hotel. Was a comfortable and pleasant stay throughout, with a nice gym overlooking the city. The staff was also very warm and helpful and the best thing was, the room came with a really nice bathtub for soaking away any stresses!

On top of the world in Tokyo. Sleek yet warm, beautiful decor, great staff and excellent food. The view from the lobby is spectacular. We enjoyed breakfast buffet very much and the Cantonese restaurant Sense was one of the best dining experiences of my life. We could even see the fireworks from Tokyo Disney.

We stayed a total of 5 nights at the Mandarin Oriental, on both ends of our trip to Japan, and loved the hotel. From the moment of arrival the service was impeccable and attentive to every detail. The concierge was excellent and great at providing tips and advice. The hotel felt very personal, intimate and local even though it is a chain hotel. The did a nice job of integrating what a luxury traveler is looking for in a hotel, but also incorporated lots of local touches. We ate at the bar, which had a great vibe and was open late, and greatly enjoyed the brunch buffet twice.

My husband and i stayed in the MO for a week. This is the best place i've ever experienced in this range of hotels. The rooms, service and especially food are outstanding! Whoever stays there MUST try the breakfast buffet, especially the poached eggs ( the chicken are only fed with flowers and yolks are amazing bright pink and taste so delicate). There is a good chance to get a MT Fuji view seat in the top floor restaurant. Overall if you want to feel very special - this is the place.

Truly on of the great of hotels of the world. Very polished service. Nicely appointed rooms. Top restaurants with in the hotel with stunning views. The rooms are nice size and comfortable but can be a bit cluttered with something on every inch of counter space.

Ideal central location to move through the different districts of Tokyo . Spacious rooms with magnificent views (ask the orientation towards Mount Fuji, visible on clear days) . Attentive staff that responds to every need of customers. Excellent sushi bar and many other restaurants including the Michelin-starred Signature. Only drawbacks: no pool and fuzzy explanations of care practiced at the spa ( broken English of the hostess ).

A great choice for anyone who is looking for luxurious comfort while traveling... Great enviroment, great service and great location!! The suit is one of the best and the view os amazing.... Highly recommended and will definitely check in again on my next trip.

One word sums up my stay at the Mandarin "Luxury". Service was outstanding no request was to difficult to fulfill. The staff were attentive,courteous friendly and spoke English. Rooms were of a high standard offering ultimate comfort, even a choice of pillows Housekeeping was excellent, small details the lovely ceramic dishes with chocolates each evening. The rooms had amazing views to die for! The restaurants on the 37th and 38th floors excellent food beautifully presented and delicious again staff extremely attentive. Location is excellent great spot to access transportation within walking distance of Ginza shopping area. Cant wait to return

Stayed in many five star six diamond hotels around the world but there is something very special about the attention to detail and service at the Mandarin Tokyo. The rooms are relaxing, with unbelievable views. Workout center could be improved but a very small improvement on an otherwise perfect visit to Tokyo. I will be back again.

It really does work very well, my wife and i were on the final stage of a 2 week trip round Japan and desired the luxury, comfort and accomplished service that the Mandarin Oriental is accustomed to provide in abundance. The Tokyo branch exceeded these expectations by a distance with a surprisingly early check in of 1pm, an immediate upgrade to a suite, professional and attentive housekeeping which delivered 3 adaptors (rather than the requested 1...) within minutes of my call, and an extra gift which i am sure Jenny Miu in client relationships arranged (she is truly excellent).The bar area floating on water on the 37th is a thoughtful and imaginative touch alongside the piano bar ambiance. I loved Luca's pizza bar on the 38th and heartily recommend to anyone who needs a slice of Italy in your hand! We dined at Sushi Sora later which is also excellent.The rooms are more typically Mandarin Oriental and have of course an amazing view, immaculate bedlinen and plump pillows, the very best bathroom products but perhaps need a revamp in terms of overall style which shows a little sign of age. For the jetset travellers in need of a high class break from the hectic tokyo life with an array of restaurants and a blend of East meets West then the Mandarin is for you.

Very high end property, with the highest degree of service and accommodations. Everything you would expect from a Mandarin Oriental. Views of Mt. Fuji on a clear day, great restaurants on floors 37-38, and great room views on high floors. Centrally located in a great spot to access transportation and shopping. Service anecdote: I forgot my electronic toothbrush in my room after checking out and returning to the US. I emailed the hotel, which found it, held it for me until I could have someone pick it up. They also made dinner reservations easy, explaining to restaurants in Japanese about my shellfish allergy.

We stayed for 3 nights as part of a longer trip travelling around Japan. This was our last hotel in Japan, and the perfect way to finish our trip.From first arriving at the Mandarin Oriental our every need was taken care of. We had a beautiful room on the 32nd floor, with a great view of the Tokyo Skytree. All the facilities are first class, and most of all the staff are so courteous and helpful, they really define the true meaning of service. We found the breakfast restaurant manager (Niccolo?) particularly helpful & pleasant and the breakfasts are amazing! On our last day one of the girls on reception (unfortunately we didn't get her name) went out of her way to ensure we had a smooth late checkout and a perfect end of our trip with a visit to the beautiful spa. We can't recommend this hotel highly enough!

The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is impossible to fault. Absolute attention to detail is incredibly seamless, so you don't even notice your every whim was granted until you leave and think "um, yeah, can't fault it actually!".Try and enjoy the sauna and spa facility, which is free before 930am (particularly handy if you can't get a spa appointment). We also preferred the non-buffet breakfast area (see photo): phenomenal room and breakfast in a sumptuous setting, which appeared to be slightly under utilised by guests.We also stayed at the Aman resort and the MO staff commented that a lot of MO customers now stay at the Aman. I agree the Aman property may be one-up on the MO for pure breathtaking grandeur but the service and "feel" of the MO was something I preferred. The lobby and bar at the MO really "buzzed" and it just felt a bit more alive, whilst retaining that old world service and charm. A really special place, and if forced to choose I would choose MO over Aman if I travel to Tokyo again.

The staff were very welcoming, exceptional serviceThe beds were extremely comfortable. Wonderful views from bedroom and restaurant The concierge service was excellentGood location by a metro and Mitsukoishi store

It is famous for brand image of this Hotel Group.Of course, the decoration was perfect, and toilet also luxuary.But, at the top of the building Bar, it was not so good, I mean, It is better rank than other cheap and resonable Bar. However, this hotel's name is 'Oriental', not casual, not business Hotel. Even though, just only dating spot, Lovers's talking Bar, we enjoy talking over Host and Hostress. Somtimes, music can change for 4seasons. Because here is tokyo, Japan.(not Kyoto. but we love any seasons for trip and dinner, celebration). Anyway, toiret is the best around there. You may try and only 1 or 2drink is better. Wine list is very good, but the price is not so good for couple, especially single.

Top notch hotel!! Excellent accommodations!! Gorgeous views from the restaurants and rooms! Breakfast was on the 38th floor with amazing views of Tokyo!! Our room was a corner room on the 36th floor with all floor to ceiling windows on two sides!! Felt like being in a cloud!!! Gorgeous simply gorgeous views of Tokyo and the skytree!! Staff was so curtuous and helpful!! Anticipating all our needs!! We had the breakfast buffet included in the room price. The buffet was amazing from sweets to fruit to all the American continental breakfast. But my favorite was the Japanese section with the delicious dim sum!!! Bedding linens and pillows were so comfortable!! Concierge arranged our train travel, guided us in all the sightseeing!! Subway station is right under the hotel making it very easy to take and see Tokyo. Restaurants abound around the hotel. What can I say!! I would be back here in a heartbeat!!! Very very highly recommend!!

I visited this hotel for a 3 days stay when in Tokyo last week. The hotel is perfectly located with many sights within a short journey and the views from the upper floors are spectacular.The staff are what makes this hotel so special they are attentive, happy and always helpful.I would certainly recommend this hotel.

This is a truly spectacular hotel. The service is the finest we have ever experienced. It is a beautiful hotel in a great location. Every employee we encountered was professional and well trained. The rooms are nice and offer terrific views. Obviously it is pricey but you will not be disappointed if you stay there.

MOTYO is a beautiful hotel with well-appointed and clean rooms. However, something was always lacking... maybe my expectations were too high of a 6 Star Diamond Award winner.Upon arrival, the door staff and bell staff were very welcoming and quickly took care of our luggage, as well as kindly brought us to the reception desk.At check-in, the staff was nice enough, but something was lacking... typically, hotels of this class offer a drink/snack to welcome guests after long journeys, however, there was no drink/snack in sight. Once in the room, the room size was decent -- however, I have also stayed at other luxury hotels in Tokyo with much larger rooms. Room size aside, the room was comfortable and clean. The bath amenities are Bottega Veneta and were replaced consistently, however towels were always in short supply. Despite being advertised on the official website, free WiFi is not available.Overall, the room was just...sufficient. We sought assistance from the concierge and, consistent with other reviews, the concierge staff was extremely slow to respond (which was completely unexpected considering the Japanese culture). Clear and correct information was not always provided. Communication and level of details were consistently lacking. This was a huge disappoint.

Excellent serviceRooms very nice but could use slight updating compared to some other mandarin properties eg Taipei, Shanghai. I honestly expected rooms to be better since it's rated #1 on tripadvisorBut the hotel totally makes up for it in impeccable over the top service. You are treated like kings and queens here by the staffBreakfast options were very good. The ambiance even at the buffet was nice

Made us feel like the entire hotel staff catered to our personal needs! From check-in to check-out, we felt like we were the only ones in the hotel. Every staff I met knew my name. We will certainly be coming back!

The room was lovely with many amenities such as bathrobes, special soaps, and slippers, but with the price of the room, these were expected. The service in all areas was exemplary. The hotel is a cab ride away from the Ginza and mueums and shrines which makies for an expensive stay. The breakfast which was included in the cost of our room was the usual hotel buffet fare. Nothing special. We enjoyed our stay, but the expense would not make it our top pick should we visit Tokyo again.

This is a fabulous hotel with superb, courteous and friendly staff who cannot do enough for you. They really should look again at their policy of charging for wi-fi. From the minute you arrive they make you feel special. We stayed for three nights at the start of our holiday and one night at the end. Our first room was a De-luxe Premier Room which is their basic room and it was immaculate, a very good size with huge and comfortable king size bed, lounge/sofa area, desk, mini bar etc. and fabulous views of Tokyo. The shower is very powerful and they supply ample quality toiletries. On our second visit we were allocated a de-luxe corner room and although very nice with fantastic views the configuration of the rooms make these rooms narrower, with smaller bathrooms. We preferred our first room. Don't think it matters which side you overlook because you are high up even on their lowest floor (floor 30) and all the views are stunning. A nice little touch is the little cupboard near your door which opens in the room and in the corridor. This is where they deliver your newspaper and where you leave any dirty laundry for collection. There is a choice of restaurant for breakfast, one a la carte, one buffet. The buffet in K'shiki is very good with wonderful service (didn't try the a la carte). There is a huge selection and the take your order for eggs. Never seen such a selection of bacon! Enjoyed some lovely cocktails in the a Mandarin Bar and ate one night in K'shiki restaurant (very enjoyable with, as expected, wonderful service). Made a booking for their Pizza Bar for our last night (there are only about 8 or 10 seats around the Pizza Bar so you should book in advance if you want to try this). This was a great experience, watching chef Luca putting together the pizzas - delicious. Just down the escalator and you are in the tunnels taking you to the metro. We wanted to go to the Sky Tree viewing platform and asked the Concierge for directions. It's very easy from the hotel to get to the metro and board the train direct to the Sky Tree, no changes. Also under the hotel is Mitsikoshi Department Store and their Food Hall is definitely worth a visit. This is an excellent hotel but the only hotel we stayed at in Japan which charged for wi-fi.

My husband and I stayed at this property for 8 nights in April. Our TAUCK Tour group originally booked us at this hotel for 3 nights. We added an additional 5 nights. We had a good room with a view of the buildings across the street.

We booked the hotel on the hotel website making sure we included wifi in our package. In comparison with other five star hotels in the similar class, we got a better rate but it is still not for the faint of heart. To get to the hotel, we took the airport train to Tokyo Station and then walked ten minutes to the hotel. You can also take a 1000yen taxi ride to the hotel from the station. From check in to check out, the service at the hotel was personal and intimate - more akin to a boutique hotel. The front desk is friendly and personable as is the concierge. Special mention should be given to the staff at the Kshiki restaurant/Pizza Bar, where the service was outstanding and unobstrusive. The staff anticipated our needs before we even knew what we wanted. I choked on my own saliva and before I knew it a large glass of water was in front of me without having asked. Nicola, in particular, made us feel like royalty at breakfast each morning. There is a nice, small buffet spread at breakfast which is delicious. We went to the pizza bar a few times as well and Daniele the chef came out a few times to greet us. We had good conversations and shared grappa with Luca, the pizza maker. The pizza (and dessert pizza!!) is not to be missed here. Our room was lovely, bright, and very large for Tokyo standards. Comfort and the sprawling views make you want to stay in your room. I could sleep in their bed for days on end since it was the perfect firmness, and I like the blinds and curtains option for darkness. My only complaint is that I wish there was a door to separate the shower from the bathtub/sink area and I had trouble adjusting the different shower head options, all were powerful beyond belief. Otherwise the room is very comfortable. You can enjoy complimentary oranges, artisinal apple juice, yuzu cakes, coffee and tea in your room which is nice as well. Access to the spa pools is only available free of charge to guests until 9am. Guests have 24 hour access to the gym which is convenient as well. Where other Tokyo hotels charge for pool and gym access, this perk at the Mandarin was nice to have included for guests. We anticipated that there is no pool on site, as this is a smaller hotel, so we were not disappointed. I feel ambivalent about the location - I wish it was closer to the JR Tokyo Station but there is a subway line downstairs of the hotel that goes directly to Ginza, Omotesando and Shibuya which I thought was very convenient. A Mitsukoshi and 7-11 are also a block away. In any case, since the service was beyond, I will stay here again.

One of the world's greatest cities no doubt about that and a terrific view from this hotel. But for me, and at these prices, I want a swiming pool and far, far better menu and international cuisine. Rooms are what you expect from a luxury hotel. Staff friendly and efficient. But the hotel lacks a truly 5 star rating. Nevertheless, a very enjoyable and interesting stay.

Stayed at the Mandarin during my last buisness trip. The room was large and very comfortable. Check in only allowed after 3pm, but the managment gave us a location to change and freshen up for the meeting we had to go to. Very nice breakfast selection and difficult to decide what to try first. We were fortunate enough to be able to get to try the cuisine of "Noma", which happen to do a food promotion at the same time in one of the restaurants at the Mandarin. A very memorable dinner, outstanding food and service.

The room is nice with a fantastic view but services are not aligned with the price. In the end we were disappointed when compare with what you can expect in this category, in Tokyo at least.No swimming pool, spa open only until 9:00 AM for the Hotel's clients, no possibility to have a coffee downstairs in the morning - we didn't understand why, no free wi-fi - which is just unbelievable at this price, no organized transportation like bus to the Airport.

Great Location: right in the middle of Tokyo, a couple of blocks from the parks and a 10 minute walk to the famous Tokyo station.Service: Simply perfect. We got rained on while walking from a meeting and the lobby staffed helped me clean up my bag and suit (and dry off) before I moved on to my next one. A dream for a business traveler.Value: It is really expansive, breakfast at JPY45,000 is market for luxury hotels, but I didn't find it more note worthy than any other place I have been in Tokyo.One major downside is the sushi restaurant is tiny, so tiny that it was always full. Same thing for the bar, we went twice and twice had to wait before a spot at the counter or a tall table freed up. Not acceptable for a business hotel.If I can afford it, i would definitely go back.

Spent two nights after a 12 day cruise and the hotel awesome. Great room, great service, great location. Very clean and spacious, MO service is the best!Tokyo is an incredible city and the hotel was so nice it was hard to want to leave the room. Views were incredible as well. The breakfast was as good as it gets! Go for it, you won't be disappointed!

After somewhat roughing it on a cruise around Japan, this oasis of calm, professional service, and comfort was a pleasure. Breakfast was full of choices, the location near the Ginza and with lots of restaurants nearby at all levels, this was a great stay. We had a minor problem with the bathroom sink which was fixed right away and a letter was left in the room apologizing for the problem. The personnel are totally customer oriented.

This Hotel is truly worth 5 stars plus. From the moment you are welcomed by the friendly English speaking staff to the day you leave you cannot help but admire the warmth and efficiency of this establishment. The luxurious rooms leave nothing more to be desired and each have breathtaking views of Tokyo. The Breakfasts are top quality Japanese and Western foods with impeccable service. The central position of this Hotel adds to it's attraction. Walk out and turn left for a 20 minute walk to Akihabara, the electronics Mecca of the world….turn right and another 20 minute walk takes you to Ginza. Next door is the famous Mitsikoshi Department store and opposite is the Corido complex with it's wide variety of Restaurants.

Excellent hotel. It will make your trip much enjoyable. Had a great experience. The room was wonderful . Breakfast very good with lots of things to choose from. Personnel always ready to help. We had a great view overlooking the Tokyo Skytree.

This hotel is really wonderful. We stay there only 1 night due to costs reasons but nothing really to complain. The view from the room is really amazing and the SPA even more :). The room is big and comfortable and the bathtub is huge. The biggest I have ever seen in a hotel. Staff was simply prefect always smiling and did everything right. Even the preparation was great :). If you can afford it, no doubt you should try it out :)

Another shining example - in the land of the rising sun - of the unequalled level of service, value and customer attention consistently provided by the Mandarin Hotel Group. A totally pleasing and rewarding experience from start to finish.

Very excited to be staying at The Mandarin. Perhaps its more a business hotel, but coming from a week's stay at The Peninsula, i couldn't make up my mind.Perhaps i should just mention after being charged a very high rate, we were told that we had to pay for internet. My husband was furious and the front desk after giving him admin released the fee. What a cheek. We had stayed in a little Ryokan in Kyoto who never charged us. why do these big hotel feel the need to exploit their clients.The room was amazing and the service exceptional, but as a group I think Mandarin needs to pull their socks up. The Mandarin in Hong Kong was kitsch personified. One can never rest on their laurels.
user_name:
alison r
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: As expected a stunning hotel well positioned in Nehonbashi close to the store, station and interesting sights including some lovely cherry blossom outside Bank of Japan at this time of year.Breakfast buffet reccomended - excellent selection of everything and my special favourite bacon - four styles and flavours from around the world Asian selection expansive, bakery unbelievable - 20 (yes twenty) varieties of bread and rolls with the best French pastries I've tasted and they were streets better than all that we ate in France! Best breakfast buffet I have ever enjoyed. Room as expected superior size, fittings, comfort, bathroom and appointments. Well set up for work with a great desk and stationery equipment such as stapler, scissors etc should you be foolish enough to do some! Views brilliant across the city and I assume the same everywhere as all rooms at level 30-36. Staff in abundance and all trained to the highest standard, concierge desk staff over our stay were exemplary in attention going over and above the call to find us out of the way odd places we wanted to visit and provide maps for taxi drivers. Staffing lobby were very efficient in finding us taxis and loading us in and out. Only two irritants the dual lift system having to go up to foyer to come back to our room - on the bright side very good for security and they were very efficient as we never waiting more than a few seconds for a lift.Worst thing was in lobby and foyer there is a constant sweet and sickly aroma of air freshener which is overwhelming and quite horrible. Fortunately it's not in bars, restaurants or rooms but prevents lingering longer than needed in common area - perhaps that's the aim!!

Very good and spacious room, with a modern style but very comfortable and cozy. Very nice bathroom. Clean. Nice view (that will have because the hotel it's in a high floors). All the hotel is very well designed. Great service.

The hotel is set some 40 plus floors up so any room you stay in has a fantastic view. Service is impeccable, the bar is great, lovely location. The staff are extremely well trained and you cant fault anything when it comes to service. Good centralish location. Not free wifi which in this day and age is not acceptable...

Second stay and just as good as before. Decent size room with comfy bed. Good service from all encountered. There is even a nearby Starbucks just down the road that one of the porters kindly directed us to.

In Tokyo for 7 days. One of the cleanest cities I have ever visited. People were extremely friendly. Hotel was exceptional and their service was bar none one of the best. Elegance at its best. Accommodations were extremely the best. Staff were accommodating and most spoke English.

We stayed in February 2015 for three nights - there were four of us, including our 4 years old daughter, and son aged 8 months. Our Japan holiday started at the Park Hyatt Tokyo for four nights; then skiing in Nozawaonsen for a week; and finished here at the Mandarin Oriental. Overall it was a great trip, and we can recommend Japan as incredibly family friendly, and remarkably easy to navigate. Needless to add, the snow conditions are absolutely amazing. However, in regard this hotel, we did feel it was primarily aimed at the business traveller - this is perfectly understandable, but my wife and I agreed that for those with families perhaps the Park Hyatt is a better option.The hotel's aesthetic is bold and masculine. The size and layout of the reception area leave you in no doubt that you have entered a confident luxury establishment. Likewise the rooms are large, slick, and declare the quality of their finishes. Even the shampoo, body wash, bathroom accessories (from Bottega Veneta), have robust masculine scents and the stone in the bathroom itself is cool, dark, and earthy. All this photographs well, and the official promotional photographs give an accurate sense of how the hotel feels (more accurate than most such promotional material, where reality often differs from the carefully curated images). It's impressive.And that's the thing. "Impressive" might be a term equally applicable to a boardroom, or a suite of offices, or the foyer of a concert hall...and it would perfectly complement the world of international business...but it's not exactly conducive to feeling relaxed.I suppose another way to express our experience is to find a word that sums up our impression at the Park Hyatt - and that would be "beautiful". The tenor of that hotel seemed in a lower key, the atmosphere combining an intimacy along with the expansive views. The colour scheme evoked a forest, while the Mandarin was more that of a cave. The Hyatt used light and soaring ceilings for effect, while the Mandarin used darkness and rich detailing. So "beautiful", as distinct from "impressive".The service fits well with the theme of "impressive". Polite, well-spoken, personable, efficient. The professional persona did seem paramount, to the point of disguising the individual personalities. The front desk and greeting staff all had perfect English, the house-keeping less so, making for some difficulty obtaining a few small items, and some inopportune invasions of our room.The management are not unconscious to the needs of children - on our arrival the room had refreshments including a cookie with our daughter's name written upon it in icing. A nice touch...but the general flow of the hotel is not tuned to the family. Only two of the restaurants allow children (one only before 7.30p.m), and even then book ahead for a reservation. As an aside, the waiting list for "Noma" now stretches to 60,000 names...so unless you can afford to buy the hotel, you might have trouble snaring a table.The location is excellent. Right on a subway hub, close to the main train terminal, with shopping and sights within an easy walk. And for more distant attractions, taxis in Tokyo work well for families and are affordable (i.e. half the price of Sydney).Hopefully on reading this review you might well ask does any of this amount to a real criticism of the hotel; and the answer is indeed it does not. It's more an account of where the hotel's priorities fall, and whether they align with those a potential guest.

Stayed here for business. The hotel is so welcoming, clean, warm and has all the amenities needed. The views are just amazing where one side views Mt Fuji and the other the Tokyo Skytree. I only had breakfasts at the hotel and the service and food were great!

I say that only half in jest.The service is impeccable from the minute you set foot on the property. Everyone knows your name and is there to provide just what you need when you need it. The gentleman who seems to run the floor during the (outstanding) breakfast buffet is a shining example of passionate customer service; he anticipated our every need. Had I knocked a cup off of the table, I have no doubt he would have phased himself across the dining room and caught the cup before it hit the floor.The views are astounding. Nice fitness center.And then mango at breakfast must be some of Japan's famous perfect super expensive fruit. Delicious.You cannot go wrong here.

A beautiful, well groomed Hotel with caring and attentive staff.Gorgeous rooms, views and facilities and great location in the Muromachi area. Step out of the Galleria to fabulous department stores or take a short taxi or (20min) walk to the Ginza district for extreme shopping!

Mandarin Oriental Tokyo surpasses all of our experiences for the best service and staff in any hotel ever. Everyone is unfailingly polite and efficient and courteous. Our rooms were awesome (clean, modern, great views, quiet) - we had adjoining corner suites as we went with teens. Niccolo (or Niccolino) from K'shiki restaurant for breakfast brunches (make sure you get all inclusive breakfast) was the kindest and most amazing maitre d'hotel of this restaurant ever - he made sure you had your cushion, you got your meals pronto and was just really attentive. All of the concierges were incredible, especially Setsu Waga who lined up all of our restaurants in a row! Love this place!

The Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo is a beautiful hotel with outstanding service. We recently stayed there for our first trip to Tokyo. The rooms are decorated in Japanese style with outstanding views of Tokyo. The beds are about as good as any I have slept in. The staff is extremely helpful and welcoming. The hotel is also very convenient to a metro stop on the Ginza line making it easy to get around the city...Will definitely stay here on my next trip to Tokyo...

Fantastic Hotel where everything is excellent. Superior service where everyone you meet is service oriented and treats you both personally and professionally. Beautiful rooms with everything you can ask for. Finally an amazing breakfast with a gorgeous view over Tokyo.

The service at the Mandarin is excellent. The staff are so accommodating, professional and wow, helpful. The spa is wonderful, an infinity spa overlooking the city. I asked the doorman where the department store was, and he walked me there. You don't see that every day. Sushi room is excellent. Centrally located to walk.

The hotel is all around amazing, but the service is a standout above all else. I don't know how they do it, but they anticipate your needs, what seems like, sooner than you can yourself. I generally shy away from a breakfast buffet, but this breakfast at k'shiki was the most perfectly curated and execute buffet I have ever had, and the service was the best I have ever experienced. Great location, great hotel, great service.

I'd never stayed at a Mandarin Oriental hotel in the past, but always wanted to and it did not disappoint. The staff seems to know what you need before you even know. They are very well trained and extremely attentive. Someone was always waiting to hold open a door for you or assist you with directions, etc. The rooms are not large, but very comfortable. The Japanese robes and tea were a nice touch. Each room has a Nepresso coffee machine, as well as automatic tea machines. Plenty of lighting and outlets.Our hotel package included a breakfast buffet and it was wonderful. The eggs were the freshest eggs I've ever eaten. Apparently the chickens are on a diet of roses and hibiscus. True story. The yokes turn our bright orange! The restaurant manager was the best I've seen in a restaurant. Great views, great service, convenient location. I would highly recommend staying at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo.

Nice view, some services could have be done better, excellent breakfast. The restaurant manager at the breakfast room gave the completely unforgettable service. Housekeeping need to be improve. No fill up in the tea and coffee box.

The rooms are beautiful and very big. The service is perfect . Is a great Hotel to stay in Tokyo. Very well located and it has a subway station I highly recommend it.The beds and sheets are the best the bathroom is great.

The physical hotel is beautiful, as others have noted. The rooms are spacious with beautiful views. The buffet breakfast is quite expensive, but if it is included with your room it's an excellent offering of western and Asian items. The service in the breakfast is excellent if a bit forced. One thing they do is to note on a computer what you ordered the day before, so when you return, a server (even if he's never met you) will ask you if you'd like to have X juice or Y eggs again today as you did yesterday. That's a bit over the top--and I could see servers checking out the computer screen.On the downside, there was loud thumping late at night. Either there was an equipment room or a staff room or incredibly noisy people above me. It came periodically all four nights I was at the hotel and was quite disturbing. And there were some service issues. The hotel offers PJs and states that you can call and they'll deliver them to your room. I did it twice, with no success. More significantly, I brought a guest to the hotel to have an afternoon coffee with me in the room where they serve coffee and tea etc. One of the reasons people like this hotel is because of the view. We were seated across the room away from the view, despite the fact that there were two empty tables next to the windows. When I asked why we couldn't sit at the window, the hostess said these tables were "reserved". I looked around the room and it was obvious to me and my guest (who is from Tokyo) that pretty much everyone there were local Tokyo ladies. I asked why, as a guest of the hotel, we couldn't be seated at an obviously open table. My guest suggested that we just forget it. As a frequent traveler, it was crystal clear to me that this hotel was not treating its guests properly. That type of attitude is pretty common, but not for a hotel that bills itself one of the world's greatest.

Second time in about one year that I stay at the Mandarin in Tokyo, and there is no much I can say besides that is the perfect place to stay. Room, service, view, food, staff, location.....everything. I travel on business permanently and this definitely one of the best hotels I ever stayed. They have everything under control, up to the minimum detail, which sometimes can make a big difference !!!!!!! No doubt that I will come back

Just finished a 3 night stay at the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo and it was outstanding. The service is incredible: tons of staff chasing you around asking if they can help. The staff really went out of their way to ensure everything was great. Rooms were modern, spotless, and spacious. Gym was well equipped with many treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 1 rowing machine, and lots of weights and equipment, plus all the amenities. Breakfast buffet was delicious. I cannot say enough positive things. This will be my go-to hotel in Tokyo.

Just spent 6 nights in this hotel and it was a truly amazing experienceThe Pros : excellent staff on all positions, always keen to satisfy you. Special mention to Fuyumo Sato at Concierge desk, Niccolo and Daniele in the main restaurant, and Rie Matsuki in Signature restaurant. All meals taken in all restaurants of the hotel were excellent, as well as service meeting my (very high) expectations. Hotel views over all Tokyo are just fabulous, whether in the morning or in the evening. Staff attention to details is exceptional.The cons : fitness room is a bit small for peak hours (early morning). One must be aware that some of the restaurants in the hotel have very limited seating capacity and it is therefore strongly recommended booking in advance of your stay to avoid disappointment. Rooms are very well fitted and equipped but some room controls could be a bit more practical (I personnally prefer the control pads found in Peninsula hotels). As for most hotels on top of buildings two elevators rides are required to reach your room, one to reach reception on the top floor and one to reach your floor below reception.

Just spent three nights at this fabulous hotel. Let me start this by saying that this hotel's service is like no other. They anticipate what you need before you know. From the greeting at the front door to leaving the property the staff is wonderful and knows each of their guests individually. The property itself is beautiful with the reception on the 38th floor of a commercial building and the rooms on several of the floors below. The views are outstanding especially at night when the City is lit up. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable.Now the service - from the concierge to room service they excel. For example, we touring all morning and arrived back at the hotel at 2:15 PM looking for a lunch recommendation. Many of the restaurants close at 2PM. There was a wonderful place in the building across the street from the hotel - whose last seating is 2:30PM. The hotel called over and got us a reservation. Then as we arrived downstairs to run across the street, the lobby staff met us and showed us how to go underground and reach the buidling as there was no crossing in this area. She ran us almost all the way there. And, of course, the recommendation was spot on. This is only an example of the unparalleled service. The concierge was especially helpful and assisted us before our arrival making tour reservations and to make sure we got to do everything that we requested.Next, unfortunately I caught a respiratory infection during my first day. The hotel found a doctor for me and the entire staff assisted in bringing tea and making sure I was comfortable. I am truly thankful to everyone. I simply cannot say enough. I travel all over the world and have never had such a positive experience.
user_name:
Stephanie H
New York City, New York

review_body: ProsService. The staff will surprise you. They sometimes know what you need before you know what you need.Privacy. We appreciated the separated elevators which halve at the beautiful lobby.Restaurants/bar. Top notch options at all hours of the day. Loved our meal at 'Signature,' and we've been back to the bar/lounge several times since. Spa. The views. The massage. The full-ceiling shower. Just...yes. Cons...none...OverallConsidering the quality of our stay, we felt that it was reasonable-to-special-occasion priced. The location was fantastic, and we couldn't imagine spending those three nights anywhere else in the city. We received very helpful recommendations from the concierge every time we asked, and we ended up finding it difficult to leave the room at times because we were so comfortable. We will definitely stay there again, whether it's Tokyo or another Mandarin Oriental property.

I went for dining out for italian restaurant for business occasion. Service was fantastic and food was quality focus. I still look back that extremely comfortable service wherever I go another vunue to dining in. Difficult to find such as top class moment of delight!

First and foremost, this is a great hotel, no doubts about it. The service level is top class except for the very small detail that the majority of the staff don't know your name which normally a hotel like this pride themselves with. But, anyhow, extremely professional and friendly service! The rooms are well sized for anywhere but for Tokyo standard they are huge with great views across the city of Tokyo. The atmosphere in the hotel is very calming and nice ... It's trendy but without losing the "warmth".
