It's an amazing way to start the day!The room is fantastic, it is one of the few hotels which has plenty of closet/suitcase space so you can get ready each day and not have to scramble to find storage space. My only complaint is the closet area is too dark. The bathroom is great, amazing water pressure in the shower and Japanese toilets are just the best. The quality of linens, bedding, and other furnishings is top notch.I found the location to be very good, I did a lot of exploring and being connected to the Metro was a big time-saver. In summary, this is the place to stay in Tokyo, you are treated as royalty regardless of whether you arrive at the hotel in the orange airport limousine bus or a Ferrari.

If you normally stay at MO in there various locations I am sure you will rate this MO in Tokyo as one os the best MO is running. The hotel is located in the upperlevels of a tower (the building itself is suberb) the decor is super modern in an asian style, the service is the best you can have and the rooms are spacious (a most in Tokyo) and absolutly silent (even the air conditioner machine is silent). The concierge staff is mostly helpful and all hotel staff is always helpful. The bar is excelent (the views are awesome) and the dinning options are michelin starred. One of the best hotels in Tokyo if not the best.

I stayed in 2 adjoining rooms in August 2014, one was a corner room with a spectacular view on 2 sides of Tokyo. The rooms are beautifully appointed, bathroom a large bathtub and walk in shower. Staff is charming, extremely polite and very helpful. Great breakfast buffet, the breakfast Maitre Niccolò was particularly gracious and very attentive.The Gym is nice, not particularly large. I haven't tried the Spa. Concierge very helpful and informative. The location is great, the metro station of Ginza Line is under the hotel so great for moving around Tokyo by subway.All in all an outstanding establishment which I highly recommend.

after our great stay in the mandarin oriental in hong kong we decided to book the mandarin oriental for our tokyo trip too - it was a good idea! the tokyo branch is even better than the hong kong one! its an excellent hotel with a excellent stuff in a excellent location!

My wife and I loved our stay at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. The staff is providing truly exceptional service to the hotel guests. Beware though that internet access is not complementary which I find cheap considering what you pay for room and food in this hotel. After I pointed this out we received it for free.

We allready stayed two times in the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo and both times have been a great experience.We used the Narita Bus Connection to get to the Hotel, this was very simple and well organised, like alot of things in Japan and is a good alternative to a transfer by car. The rooms are very well designed, big and luxurious. We had the Skytree view, which is really stunning especially at night. Every day we had pralines or something else on the room.We ate at the K´Shiki, which is also the breakfast Restaurant, the Sense and the Sushi Sora. Each of them was of great quality with an outstanding service. Same for the bar. The Service was very well educated and well informed about the guests likings, etc.Chuo is a very good place in Tokyo for shopping and dinner and fits the hotel perfectly.For us the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is one of the best Hotels in Asia and the world. We will stay here again when we come back to Tokyo.A clear recommendation for this Hotel :)

Located in the prime area if Nihonbashi, the hotel is set on top of an office tower. Lobby is on the 38th floor (top floor) with expansive view if the city. It is spectacularly beautiful at night. Check in was brisk. While a staff processed your admin stuff, another would bring warm towel and chat with you. You would be accompanied by the reception staff to your room, and he'd explain the room facility and amenities as you are settling in. The room is large, with generous bathroom area. It is beautifully designed with contemporary flair and warm color tone. The bed was comfortable and the linen felt luxurious.If your room comes with breakfast, do make a point of trying it. It can be taken at 2 restaurants, the Lobby Lounge and the K'kinki. I find the buffet selection at the K'kinki to be excellent. They whipped up a mean egg benedict. The egg was perfectly poached and served on a bed of crab meat. Oh yumm..The hotel is located above Mitsukoshi-mae metro, so it is convenient to move around. It is also only 5min walk to Kanda JR station if you need to catch the JR line.What a great metropolitan oasis in an otherwise a hectic city. Highly recommended.

It is my mistake that I have yet to write a review for the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. I AM A FAN! My husband and I were in Japan to celebrate our 6 year anniversary and the Mandarin Oriental was the quintessential Tokyo hotel that checked all the boxes and also one of our best stays ever!! While we didn't exactly choose the lowest category room, we were (double-triple-quadruple?) upgraded to a corner suite with a beautiful marble bathroom and views to die for. I really enjoyed the bathtub with the salts. We looked forward to opening all the window blinds in the morning and enjoying the expansive view of all the skyscrapers. In the evening, we had coffee or tea and relaxed in our bathrobes or yukatas. (They even had MO pajamas!) I wish we had a iron/ironing board in the room, but that's just me. Some people are baller and don't iron their own clothes. =)The service was impeccable and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. It's hard to describe except to note a few examples.. We received a package envelope before our arrival. It was waiting in our room when we finally checked in, and next to it was a pair of scissors. We had some leftovers we kept in the refrigerator. When we found it the next day, housekeeping had placed utensils on top of it. They notice these things and help in the smallest most unobtrusive way without you even having to ask. They never missed a turn down. Ice was always in the bucket and treats were left on the coffee table. In addition, concierge did an excellent job helping us with reservations to some of the top restaurants in the city. Every morning, we woke up to a splendid breakfast spread. The buffet which included a variety of breads, fruit, hot and cold items, Western and Japanese were so delicious. Restaurant staff was very attentive. They changed out utensils depending on your meal choices and offered to bring the items to your table if your hands were full. They never paused to refill a coffee cup or water glass.The other restaurant we tried was Signature and it's not to be missed. We had the 3 course prix fix and it included many surprise dishes and excellent service. The plating was so beautiful, I almost didn't want to ruin it by sticking my fork in the food!! It not only looked delicious, but it tasted incredible. At times, I wanted to lick my plate.. but that's not what you do at this type of restaurant where the ladies are wearing pearls and the gentlemen have jackets on. It was elegant, but not snooty. I believe we may have had the best table.. in front of the window, overlooking the tall buildings.One evening, we also enjoyed a few drinks downstairs at the bar with the live jazz band, and it made for a lovely evening.We used the gym at this hotel. We felt that the equipment was taken care of and the towels and water provided was nice. It was a good size for the hotel and the one time we were there, it didn't seem crowded. The view from there was magnificent.. I was surprised there was no locker room attached, however. I wish we used the spa, but I couldn't at the time for personal reasons. My husband enjoyed a nice dip in the jacuzzi in the men's spa locker. I want to thank the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo for taking such great care of us. We hope to visit again!

The Hotel is a wonderful place to stay and includes everything to feel comfortable..But the most exceptional thing was the stuff, especially LUDMILA, who is really a perfect employee. She did absolute everything possible to fulfil every visitor`s wish, desire and every order faster as we could name it... Wow!!! Such stuff is really more as good as gold!!! Thank you very much for your attention, support and pure kindness..

I was impressed by the quality of service. A special thanks to Ludmila on the reception. She even personally guided me to metro station. Thank you so much!Also, I would like to mark a good hotel position and delicious breakfasts. I suggest to take a room with a view to sky tree tower. The best view in Tokyo :)

My favorite in Tokyo...I love its esthetics and the amazing view. As usual everything is perfect , from service, restaurants, concierge, and decoration. The view on Mount Fuji from the internal staircase is just breathless...and convenient location. Will go back there anythime.

First time to stay here. Fantastic experience. The room, the service, the atmosphere, everything very high end and comfortable. Nothing that I would change at all. Very memorable stay. One of the more comfortable hotel stays I have had in Asia.
user_name:
Graeme M
Short Hills, New Jersey

review_body: Located in a high-rise building, the 35-38 floors are pure bliss. My room on the 36fl had great views of the city. The location is extremely close to shopping and transportation. I have stayed at other Mandarins, but the service here was first class all the way. The rooms are impeccable and the shower fantastic. Strongly recommend if you are doing business in Tokyo.

Basically I want to live here.Quiet, understated. Perfection. The service is quit the food fantastic the conference rooms great and the staff exceptional. Stay here once if you can. Great rooms amazing bathroom. Breakfast is great here.

This hotel was absolutely incredible. We were upgrade to an amazing corner suite with incredible views over the whole city, a fabulous master bath with a rain shower, huge soaking tub with a picture window and impeccable service all around. The suite was very tastefully furnished and the amenities were outstanding. Every day, they brought us afternoon goodies, from various chocolates paired with exotic fruits to local cookies to delicious petit fours. The concierge personnel were extremely helpful and managed to get us into a couple of restaurants that are nearly impossible to get into. The buffet breakfast, which was included in our rate was outstanding and very high quality. We also had cocktails and snacks in the bar, which was a beautiful space and the ambiance delightful. After our experience here, this is the only property at which we would stay when visiting Tokyo in the future. It was truly a special, luxurious experience.

This hotel is actually built into an office building and has the top floors. You come into the hotel on the street level where there are shops, a train/subway station, a bakery etc and go to the 38th floor for the hotel reception area.This is the top floor and then you go down for the room. The rooms are a nice size, not too large but spacious. The views are spectacular...they take your breath away! The bathroom is roomy and contains all the amenities one would ever need. There is a sitting area , a king sized bed, a large screen TV and a bar. . Each day we got some delicious mandarin oranges left in our room by the maid. The weather was sunny but foggy or we would have been able to see Mt fuji from the hotel. The hotel is within a short stroll to the Ginza shopping area and the train/subway is under the hotel. We took it a quick few stops to Ueno Park one day! The hotel is immaculately clean and has a large staff who are always willing to answer questions, offer suggestions on things to do, rearrange your air when a plane is delayed or canceled, open the elevator for you, call a cab etc. We were able to walk all over from this location as it is very safe. The breakfast at the hotel consisted of made to order eggs, fruits, yogurt,meats, pastries and more and coffee was also made to order. Service was excellent and the main areas of the hotel : the bar, the tea/coffee area, the pizza bar were all excellent and the prices were not terribly inflated. Definitely a luxury hotel with great service and an excellent location.

A comfortable hotel in a great location,The staff was the best!!! They treated us like royalty. They always had smiles on their faces, always ready for recommendations for places to eat, how to get to various locations by taxi or train. I love Tokyo and would come back again and probably stay here just for the service that the staff gives. its simply the best for the short stay.

Outstanding service is hard to pull off. Many top rated hotels try too hard with service and it comes off as forced or fake. The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo has the best service of any hotel we have ever stayed at... Here is why: Every member of the staff goes out of their way to be helpful without going over the top and making you feel uncomfortable or crowded. The check-in was flawless. We had ordered baseball tickets from a third party service and they were sitting on the desk in the room when we got in. The concierge was extremely helpful. We had the same server at breakfast for the 4 days we were there and it is hard to call him a server. By the end of our stay, I wanted to call him a friend! Whatever training Mandarin is doing is cut above the rest. The staff make you feel at home and meet every need while making the whole experience feel genuine.As far as the hotel itself, the views are incredible, the restaurants are great and overpriced, and the location suited our needs very well. Let's go to the pros and cons:Pros:1. Service Service Service- we covered it above!2. Stunning Rooms and View- We got a slight upgrade at checkin for being Platinum American Express members(see more below on that) and the view was awesome! We looked directly toward the Tokyo Sky Tree and had some amazing scenes day and night. The room was large and the bathroom was awesome. Although I haven't stayed at any other hotels in Tokyo as of yet, I cannot imagine a hotel with better rooms.3. Location- The hotel is in Chuo, which is the heart of Finance in Tokyo. Some people complain that the location is not ideal, but we thought it was ideal. There is a Tokyo Metro station directly below the hotel which makes life easy. Tokyo is huge and we were concerned before going about the location, but having a close metro station makes life easy. We could walk to Ginza in 10-15 mins. There were some great close restaurants. You must go to the basement food court in the Mitsukoshi department store which is a 2 minute walk for the hotel. My wife died and went to Heaven in that place!The best part about the location is this. Some parts of Tokyo never sleep or relax. It is hard to relax in a hotel that is in the middle of the action all the time. This location is relatively calm at night, which makes it very relaxing. A relaxing location is a premium in Tokyo.... 4. Good Deal- this is not a cheap hotel by any stretch. Yet, we did get a fantastic package from American Express. For staying 4 nights, we got the 4th night free. Included with this deal was breakfast everyday and a $100 food and beverage credit for the stay. If you are staying for 4 days, check this offer out on the Amex website.Cons:Very hard to find any fault with the hotel. If i were to nitpick, I would say the breakfast buffet was a tad skimpy compared to other hotels of such a high level. The service at breakfast, however, was so good that is is very hard to find fault with it. They could improve selection, but the quality was high.Awesome travel experience and my wife did not want to leave! I don't blame her one bit!

We enjoyed one of our best hotel stays at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. The level of service was exceptional, our room was all that we could have asked for and the quality and choice of restaurants was so good that we didn't eat outside the hotel during our stay. Each department of the hotel performed immaculately and left nothing to be desired.A very satisfying experience, I wish I could say the same for other hotels we have stayed in.

This is my second stay here , the first stay was 2 yrs ago and now two years later , i still say the same - Top class and one of the best I travel a lot and i do frequent the finer Hotels and establishments . I have been to many beautiful and well built Hotels around the world. But the service levels at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is beyond compare. I have said this in my previous review and i say this again Quick overview :Check in was a pleasure and a breeze.Assisted by Ms Asami Kikuchi . Rooms - perfectly appointed and rather large , even by Asian standards Bathroom - Clean and good with high quality toiletries. Large Tub . Everything you need is there . You could go there without any personal toiletries !! Combs , brush , tooth brush , razor , everything provided complimentaryConcierge A great team to help you out during your trip . Without the concierge i would have spent hours on the computer trying to find my way around town . The Concierge was well staffed with knowledgeable ladies , i was usually served by Ms Masumi and Ms Sato , and their support was exemplary , thank you. Just to give an example of the quality of service , ..... i asked them to buy me some tickets for the Kabuki show , so when they delivered the tickets to me , they provided me with the tickets , accompanied by a map to the theater , directions in Japanese , a 2/3 page write up on the story of the show ( downloaded from the internet ) , a print of the theater seat layout with our seats marked on it . All in an envelope - very professional - they think of everything MOST IMPORTANT - Drinking water - they provide unlimited number of Mineral water bottles, in the room , at the reception , also at the bell desk on the ground floor hotel entrance , gym etc . I drink a lot of water and most other top hotels just provide one or 2 small bottles everyday in the room . Some do provide additional bottles on request , but in Mandarin Tokyo they somehow make it very easy to access Bell Desk:When you walk out of the Hotel the bell boys on the ground level are always willing to assist with bottles of water , or umbrellas depending on the type of weather . They advise you on what to expect from the weather today . The greatest assistance i received from them was giving directions to Taxi drivers ( many of which do not speak English ) , so all i had to do was sit in a cab and pay at the end , Also as you step out of the Hotel they will hand to you an address card of the Hotel , which they recommend you use to get back at the end of the day 4G Wifi Router The hotel rents out a 4G wifi router which can connect upto 6 devices. This was very convenient for us to stay online all day wherever you are . Lot cheaper than paying for roaming charges Wheelchair My father - travelling with me , needed a Wheelchair . I called in advance and the Hotel reserved a wheel chair for us . The wheel chair was in our possession all through our stay in Tokyo , and hence we could wheel him all around town . This made the trip better for him since he could now keep up with all of the rest Breakfast and Restaurant - K'shikiThe breakfast was something we looked forward to , each morning. Great service and great layout . Breathtaking views from the breakfast room windows.The restaurant management was very very cooperative and proactive , everyday morning they helped to arrange some Indian vegetarian dishes for my parents . We dined there a few times too , and the Food was always fresh and great tasting . The restaurant manager Mr Shioji was concious of our special dietary needs and the whole at K'shiki team was very courteous and friendly .Had a nice evening at the Oriental lounge , where we took dessert one evening - Great desserts and Rose tea . Must make a mention of Mr Takeshi Takeichi , front office manager was great talk to , and he always helped with some advise and tips whenever we passed the front desk . he made us feel welcome at time of check in and every other time Sushi Sora - great restaurant for Sushi Check out and billing had a few hiccups , but nothing worth a mention . The Mandarin team resolved it soon after check out and emailed me the confirmation the very next day . Thank you I will stay at Mandarin Oriental - Tokyo whenever i am back

The Mandarin Oriental Tokyo really get what hotels are all about. A fantastic stay for 3 nights. Room layout, service and amenities are brilliant. The hotel understands the small things make for a great stay. If you can find a good rate, do not hesitate to choose this hotel in a Tokyo.

One of the best hotel experiences. Rooms are big, nicely decorated and clean. Staff's English is excellent. Location is great. Especially recommend the Sushi Sora, great Sushi and the Chec explains every fish and there is a pictured book explaining the sushi as well. Skip the fish market, this is much better way to experience sushi.Concierge extremely helpful and professional.This not only one of the best hotel in Japan but world wide.Only thing missing is a Pool. We did not care, since we do not have time to Swim anyway. But if you require it during your stay, it will surprise you.

We have stayed at a few Mandarin Oriental in different countries and I must say that the MO Tokyo's service beats every single one hands down. Here you get what you'd expect from the famous MO high standard service And More. It could just be the Japanese hospitality at their best that made it so special. Every single staff is amazing. We were checked in quite quickly and brought to our room and our luggage were already waiting for us in our room. Not the most impressive lobby but extremely spacious room (and bathroom) with the magnificent view of the Tokyo sky tree. Gym is cozy but it has good equipments - would recommend the hotel to install thicker blinds as the sunlight was blinding ! Conveniently located as well right above a metro station. Highly recommended !

We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo on our honeymoon and it was our first stop. I'd been told this was an amazing hotel but it really lived up to its reputation. The service and setting are stunning. From the moment we arrived until when we left the service was impeccable and we loved every minute. We ate in two of the restaurants for dinner - at Sense and also the Tapas Molecular Bar - and both were very memorable. We also had breakfast in both K'Shiki and the Oriental Lounge and both were very good. The staff continually remembered our names and we were greeted with complimentary champagne and an upgraded room as it was our honeymoon... what a way to start our trip in Japan. The concierge also went halfway across Tokyo to get Sumo tickets for us!!! Excellent all round and would love to return.

I've been staying at the Peninsula across from the Imperial Palace since it opened, but I tried the MO on this trip and I'm sold. Unlike the Peninsula, where the lobby seems always to be so bustling that it's impossible to relax or have a pleasant conversation, the MOs lobby on the 38th floor is a thing of beauty, with panoramic views and restaurants that are pleasant even when crowded. The service is exceptional, the rooms are built to a flagship standard. The fitness center is open 24 hours and while it's a little small and the equipment a bit too close together, it's perfectly adequate and decent workout clothes are available. The location is convenient, and there's a subway entrance in the basement so anything is accessible quickly. There's a Mitsukoshi across the street, and plenty to do within walking distance. This is one of the very best.

It's my first time to stay at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. Surprisingly the hotel is located at such a convenient location, it's just next to the main store of Mitsukoshi Department store, and surrounded by new shopping malls (Coredo). Just below hotel, you can directly access to very nice restaurants and shops especially the best fruit store in Japan is located on 1/F.I specially enjoyed the breakfast at hotel, really very good and the view is gorgeous. I can see Skytree from my room or at the Gym.No need to mention - you can always trust the best hotel service provided by Mandarin Oriental, and the staff are all very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.Very good hotel!!

The mandarin oriental always lives up to it's standards. Right when you enter the hotel you find the most helpful welcoming staff that automatically make you feel happy to be there. Unfortunately you have to go through 2 elevators to get to your room as you need to pass by reception. The concierge are patient and very helpful. The front desk also great!The breakfasts were nice and well presented. The service of this hotel is seamless and we stayed in suites so obviously they were spacious and comfortable. We liked how this hotel was very close to ginza as well as well as the big department stores mitsukoshi and Takashimaya. And right next to the main station. The other nice shopping area with good restaurants area which is quite far from here is odematedando. This is an area we would like to try to stay in next time we are in Tokyo, if only there was a mandarin over there! In terms of service this hotel is probably the best as we were also considering the peninsula but felt this was definitely the right choice.

WOW! What an amazing hotel! The staff are extremely helpful, courteous, sincere and unbeatable.The room was amazing, with views of Tokyo Sky Tree. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable, turn down service every night. Scented oil (for the vapouriser, bath etc) were left out for us to enjoy. Fresh fruit everyday.The bathroom was large and beautifully decorated. All the usual amenities are there including bath salts, and bath pillows so you can soak away in comfort. The attention to detail at the hotel was astounding - we had a package delivered whilst we were out and it was bought to our room with a bar of scissors next to it. Its only a small thing, but that completely blew my mind! Who trained the staff - big applause!!!!!The hotel is right above a metro station and an amazing shopping centre (Mitsuoki) with the best food hall I have ever seen!! We went there to get food for our picnic in the Imperial East Garden on our last day in Tokyo.I would go back tomorrow!

I've stayed in a number of Mandarin Oriental properties across the world, and still think this is easily the quintessential MO. Certainly not a budget option, but in return you get amazing rooms, unbeatable views, and impeccable service. Whoever is responsible for training the staff should be commended as they are a delight. My go-to location in Tokyo, no question.
user_name:
ceeebo
New York City, New York

review_body: Rooms are gorgeous and spacious with expansive views. But why, with all that space, is there no privacy in the bathroom? Smokey glass separates the shower from the toilet and the sink area from the bedroom. Yes, it can be sexy but kind of weird if you embarrass easily. Also, just one tiny sink...really? There's plenty of room for 2 nice size sinks. Otherwise, service is fabulous, concierge is totally concerned with whatever problem you need to solve and spa is magnificent. I disagree with previous review about breakfast. There's nothing more that you could possibly want that wasn't available. Lunch and dinner is very pricey but you are getting top quality for everything. A reminder to take everything you need with you when you leave the room. It takes several minutes to get downstairs using 2 separate elevators.
Stayed for 2nights for my business trip. The staffs are helpful and room is fantastic. Mandarin is the best hotel in japan

My wife and I decided to go further afield and go long-haul this year...So Japan it was!First stop Tokyo. We looked at most of the "best" hotels and decided that the Mandarin Oriental was the best suited to our taste. and we were not disappointed. This place has the WOW factor in spades! Views from every window and service that the world should envy. (Take note uncle Sam!!)We are not the type who will look for faults but we are fussy and usually notice them! Nothing to find here......Faultless, Our only problem was only staying three nights before moving on to Hakone and Kyoto. we could have happily spent our whole holiday here and still only scratched the surface of Tokyo. The same goes for the Hotel which has three amazing restaurants. to my eternal regret I could not find a way to fit in the sushi restaurant. Luckily we did the Molecular Bar which is so unique even in Japan! I can go on, the BAR was fabulous - and nice to smoke in a bar again!! but the air quality is fine for non smokers I was on my second drink the first evening before I noticed people were smoking. The rooms with that view wall to wall floor to ceiling...Quite special! and Boys the lobby restroom is a surprise!This is a no brainer Book here! especially if you want to avoid a corporate hotel. They made us feel welcome and that we were important to them not just a guest. and that's hard to do.I have no plans to return to Japan in the near future but if ever I do I know where I'll be staying....

Great location, outstanding views, very high quality rooms and really friendly service. Bar is a bit smoky and I'd have liked a bit more choice at breakfast. But this is a hotel to be enjoyed; I'll have no hesitation in coming back.

The MO Tokyo is a classy hotel located on the top floors of a modern office building in the financial centre of Tokyo. The lobby of the hotel offers breathtaking views of Tokyo and on clear days you can even see Mt. Fuji.We had a room on the 31st floor and the room was well appointed and quite large and had a large bathroom as well. The amenities provided were high class and there was not much I could fault as everything was as expected from the MO. The hotel is connected to an underground shopping alley with some restaurants and is connected to the Subway which makes it convenient to get around. However since it is in the business district the area is not very happening in the evening.The gym was located on the same floor as the lobby and was small but well equipped. The spa offers the sauna, steam room and whirlpool for free to hotel guests before 9AM. After 9AM there is a 7000 JPY charge per person which I find a bit much as a five star hotel should offer these amenities for free.Staff was in general very pleasant and professional and gave a very good impression.However something which dissapointed me slightly was the fact that our curtain did not open properly on one side (the electronics were faulty) and this was already the case when we were shown to the room. However this was not fixed even the next day when we called housekeeping to check this again. In a MO I first of all expect things to work and if they do not it should be fixed immediately. The hotel is pricey but this is Tokyo so do not expect a bargain here. I would definitely recommend the hotel if you are in Tokyo but do also give other properties some consideration as five star properties in Tokyo are in general stunning.

Hotel: best view in town. Excellent in house restaurants and bar! Very well situated for shopping, walking, city tours and nigh-out dinner.Spa: goodRoom: spacious, modern with a breathtaking view of Tokyo! Service: excellentValue for money

Dear MO, Tokyo. In the nicest way possible you have made it a little difficult for us to enjoy anywhere as much as we did before we visited you because of the wonderful warmth and sincere hospitality each member of staff showed us on our stay- it was as if we have returned from a stay with family rather than just another fine hotel. The only way to relive this we feel is to come back very soon!We stayed at 2 other hotels which will also be reviewed but this is the winner hands down because it provides practically all you could need from a hotel under one roof. The attention to detail is part of Japanese culture anyhow but at MOkyo it seems they have taken it to other dimensions from the yoga mat in the room to the super food juices on display in the gym (perhaps a little rationed though!) to the staff following up every enquiry no matter how small, quietly, efficiently and always with the express purpose to meet your individual needs whatever they may be. It is a week later and I am still wowed. The choice and style of restaurants at MO is varied, the gym is one of the better ones, the interiors everywhere are immaculately maintained, the rooms are super well insulated and this is one hotel where the room service is pretty close to eating at the restaurants! A special thank you to the Manager at K'SHIKI- he made a potential evening dining alone in a crowded restaurant seem like I was dining in comfort at my own table at home...how he did this was down to his own personal style, professionalism and attentiveness. The beds are a nice balance between firm and soft (I prefer firmer) but we slept soundly every night. Windows floor to ceiling style provide amazing views and blinds/ shutters are at the touch of a switch. Bathroom or sink area perhaps a little on the small side but shower and bath facilities were nicely spaced/ laid out. The loos in Tokyo all are the electronic heated seat type. The water level in this one was either high or somehow not right as it splashed- excuse the detail!Pizza bar has good lively atmosphere, Tapas Molecular Bar is fun to do with a friend and if s/he is less into that kind of experience its as enjoyable joining the other 7 diners, and if you go to Mo Bar don't forget to try the Japanese Mojito. If I could only change one thing it would be to make the gourmet shop on the ground floor bigger and with more variety such as maybe it used to be since the photos on the website show a different Gourmet Shop to the one actually available at the hotel. Also if I can mention we found it strange to call it a 'gourmet' shop and then have coffee available only in paper cups...it was why we didn't coffee there.Best of all the department store located 3 minutes from the hotel called Mitsokushi and its basement loaded with superfood salads/ food goodies of every kind meant that eating fresh and healthy on the go was easy when needing a change from sit down meals. Concierge was also outstanding for every request and always available no matter how busy the hotel got and we were there for part of Golden Week. On the 10th day I really did not want to leave!I did not use the spa unfortunately so can not comment but the photos look divine. This hotel has no pool but you do not miss it as it is in a district close to shops and activity and Ginza is about 10 minutes away so I hardly found time to use the facilities. It is nice that they are complimentary to guests between certain early morning times since its not always great to pay a full spa fee for 10 minutes in the jacuzzi. These discretionary touches or display of flexibility is what made it feel like a home away from home.I could write all day about how fine this hotel is but will just say that in the last year we have travelled for 80% of the year and stayed at some of the best hotels. This hotel beats them all in almost every department not by a margin but by a very long shot. Theres no denying it is one of Tokyo's great assets not to mention to the MO brand itself so I hope that any new hotel that is opened could be allowed to benefit from training by this Management Team. It has made me want to switch brands and try MOs wherever we can.

The hotel itself is situated on the top floors of the building, thus providing a breathtaking view of Tokyo during both day and night. Room: spacious, comfortable, and with a great view (can see Mount Fuji and overlooks the Imperial Palace). As a bonus, the room comes with two kimonos, which I have tried on, since I'm a tourist. Service: ridiculously good. Firstly, the room is clean and always made to fit for the time of day — pillows propped up at the morning cleanup, put away when we return in the evening; slippers placed by the bed; coffee, tea, and water pot refilled; new water bottles; linens placed beneath the bathroom toiletries. When we first arrived, directions to our restaurant reservations were already printed and ready. When we come back from a day of shopping and sightseeing, concierge delivers the bags to the room while we go out to dinner. They are always ready and willing to oblige our every request. Food: we breakfasted every morning at the Oriental Lounge. The ambience is quiet and peaceful, the view over the city is scenic, and the food is good. The special pancakes are thick and fluffy and light.

Mandarin Oriental hotels are famous for their service, but the MO Tokyo takes it to a higher level. From the moment they met us at the dock until we departed for the airport, it seemed like we were the only guests, even though it was very busy for Golden Week. At dinner Daniele, the executive chef, stopped by our table and chatted for several minutes. Concierge helped us locate our former home in Tokyo from 35 years ago...not an easy task in a city that continues to grow and change rapidly.

Even though I am a frequent trip advisor user I have never written a review. After enjoyingan amazing experience at this hotel I wanted to say if you are going to Tokyo this is where youwant to stay. The service is stellar, the rooms are luxurious and spacious and the locationis ideal. You will be treated like family by the staff and enjoying breakfast in your room isa real treat. They even bring a toaster so your bread is freshly toasted. I cannot wait toreturn to Tokyo to experience this fabulous hotel. SL - Charlotte, N.C.

An excellent hotel with wonderful service. I had a corner room with great views of Tokyo. The hotel is on the top floors of the Mitsui building with spectacular views. The room was spacious, relaxing and luxurious, with a big king bed, good pillows and a comfortable couch. Separate bathtub and shower, as should be, with a window next to the bathtub where you can see Tokyo. The service is impeccable. The hotel design simply marvellous. You feel like staying in. The high-end Mitsukoshi department store is next door. Many good restaurants across the street. I had a wonderful stay. A highly recommended hotel.

I stayed at the MO Tokyo a few years back and it made a deep impression on me. On a recent two week trip to Japan I decided to splurge and stay here again, and it didn't disappoint; it was as good as - if not better than - I remember it. Once again the MOT delivered a stellar experience that will live with me for a very long time - or at least until I return, which I will certainly do. For this price, I expect everything to be impeccable (and I'll admit that I am demanding on that front), but the MO delivered in every way. Yes, it comes at a price, but is I think worth every Yen. My room was huge and immaculate (with a Skytree view); service was impeccable; breakfast, superb. I slept like a baby and loved every second that I was there. And that is why the MOT is without doubt my favourite hotel (and I think one of the absolute best city hotels) in the world.In a word: sensational.

The position of the Hotel is great — very close to the Imperial Palace and the Ginza district. The welcome started off very well but was disappointed that they were not prepared to provide complimentary wi-fi in lieu of the gourmet breakfast that was included with the package (leaving early and breakfast timings would have involved a rush.) Felt they handled it badly. The tide turned after seeing the room and the fabulous views and our dinner at the Molecular Tapas Bar. Admittedly we did not need to stay here to have dinner here but it was very convenient. Review on that separately. We had an early breakfast in our room and that was bang on time and was really nicely presented and tasted delicious. Bags collected on time, Check Out was very good and Duty Manager came over to ask if all OK. And then waved off by him and his colleagues as we left in the taxi that was arranged.

Having stayed here several times, we always love to go back. The service is immacualte and the restaurants inside the hotel are super amazing. Location is also very good and the view from bars and restaurants stunning.

Stayed here at the start of our trip to Japan, and what a memorable three nights we had!From the moment we arrived at the lobby on the ground floor, we were treated to an experience which we will never forget. Being greeted and guided through the check in we instantly felt at home and relaxed after our 12 hour flight from London.We arrived at around 9am and check in was not until 3pm, we were allowed to freshen up in the hotel spa. I have to say that the view whilst you sit in the pools are mind blowing. We went to our rooms at around 4 and it was immaculate. With city scape views, we could see all of Ginza, parts of the Imperial Palace gardens and partial bits of Shinjuku. We did however need to change rooms, because my partner is a light sleeper and there were children in the room above who were using their room as a gymnasium. Jet lag must have meant they were running and banging around until at least 11pm. I have to mention the exceptional services of Mr Takeshi Takeichi, he was perfect in handling our requests of a room change and any other problems we had. He addressed our issues promptly, courteously and we are ever grateful.This Hotel and its staff are a credit to the Mandarin Oriental group.

Booked for this hotel for 3 nights and really enjoyed throughout. The room was comfortable with nice bathroom. The service was 5 star. Location was good with public transportation nearby. Would like to stay here again in my next visit.

My husband and I enjoyed a luxurious vacation for 5 nights at the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo! Everything was wonderful. The room was beautifully-decorated and had wonderful city views. The vanity was a little cramped, and we wished for more storage space (especially drawers). Service was spectacular and unobtrusive. We had breakfast each morning in the restaurant, and by the second day, the server had memorized our names and preferences. He went out of his way to make us feel welcome and pampered. The concierge handled all of our dining reservations and provided us with a folder containing confirmations, maps, and photographs of the restaurant shopfront (very helpful as addresses are difficult to navigate in Tokyo). The hotel was conveniently located, directly attached on the basement level with the Mitsukoshi-mae station. Only downside was the smell of cigarette smoke that permeated the lobby as smoking is allowed in the lounges/restaurants.

WOW! This is the one so far most amazing hotel I have stayed at. Fantastic rooms, fantastic views, fantastic food and the service is 7 star. Felt like a movie-star the whole visit :) Highly recommended!

The hotel is great with great service and attention to detail in all the right places. (Plugs, bathroom, etc). Our room was facing Tokyo skytree and had stunning sunrise views.The only warning is that the hotel location is not optimal for vacation travelers but the hotel is directly on top of a metro station so it is not a major issue.

My wife, teenage son and I traveled to Japan in March. The Mandarin Oriental was our base for three nights in Tokyo. The hotel occupies the 30th-38th floors in a new skyscraper, a few blocks from Tokyo Station, right next to Mitsukoshi, and on top of a subway station. Our room was spacious and comportable. It had a panoramic view of the city, including Mt. Fuji hovering on the horizon. The breakfast buffet was a perfect way to start the day. We had a driver and guide for two days in Tokyo, so did not use the hotel's facilites (outside of one rather mediocre dinner at their Italian restaurant) but can vouch for the fact that the rooms lack for nothing. Later in our trip was stayed one night at the Ritz-Carlton, about $100 more per night, and it was nowhere near as nice. I realize the Mandarin isn't cheap, but it's worth every penny.

I never get tired of The Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo. I have never written two reviews of a hotel but this place is just beyond beyond compare. It really has become my home from home when I am in Tokyo. I am not just greeted by name by many members of the staff but they even remember my last visit, the room I was in and room service now just ask me if I want my usual breakfast. The service never waivers. The staff exude a calm, quiet yet warm welcome, the rooms are always immaculate, the food is outstanding. Just try the lasagne. Sounds bizarre to have lasagne in Tokyo but it is perfect. The PuLi in Shanghai is one of my new favorite hotels but the Mandarin in Tokyo just can't be beaten for consistent, world class attentive service in a hotel that really does feel like home. Some hotels aren't worth the cost. Stay at The Mandarin Oriental and one realizes that true luxury is worth the price.

From the moment the taxi arrived at the front of reception we knew this was special and it was .The room we had was a double deluxe on the 36 floor looking over Tokyo to the sky tree, and what a view to wake up to every morning. As you open your remote curtain and blinds and the sunlight floods the room , stunning. The restaurants are fantastic,bar fantastic ,service fantastic.The hotel is situated a short walk to the Imperial Gardens .We stayed in Japan for nine nights - fantastic place! Mandarin Oriental Best hotel ever stayed in and will be back.Gerry&Jackie

Can never find fault with a Mandarin Hotel and my wife and mine's visit was a relaxing oasis in the city. Our room on the 34th floor gave amazing views that we never tired of looking at. There was nothing that we wanted that wasn' t already there and the food was the most enjoyable that we had in Japan. If I wanted to nit-pick I would say I would have liked to sit at the bar on the 37th floor in a no smoking environment but I couldn't - it was for smokers only - a bit of a throwback to the old days. Nevertheless We just love the Mandarin!

I have stayed in a large variety of major hotels over the past 3 years for work and my conclusion regarding the MO Tokyo is this. It is quite simply the best hotel I have ever and probably will ever stay in. The six-star rating which this hotel has is no exaggeration. The atmosphere, service, politeness and friendliness of staff, quality of food (both breakfast and room service), the breakfast view of Mount Fuji, the well-equipped gym, the chocolates/little cakes provided during turn-down service, the extensive "pillow menu" offered.... I could go on. Spent 3 weeks here in Nov/Dec 2013 with work paying (it is quite expensive!) but worth every Yen. It is a dream of mine to one day return. Thank-you to all staff for an amazing experience.(The only thing...although it doesn't warrant deducting a star... no swimming pool.)

The standards set by this hotel continued through every department we dealt with and who we came into contact with. Every member of staff was extremely courteous, superbly efficient, professional and very friendly. The concierge staff deserve a special mention for outstanding service and organisation, and also a special mention to Daniele & team and his pizza bar / Italian / lasagne! Many of the same team were responsible for breakfast which sets a new benchmark for hotel breakfasts. Wonderful produce and care taken in the selection and catering so well for any dietary requirements. And looking after children so well. The standard of our room was exceptional with attention to detail quite unbelievable. A complete stationery box and back flannels were a couple of new items (and very useful) that impressed. The location is brilliant with the hotel sitting high above a subway stop, from which you can access anywhere in the city very easily. The taxi and car service at the hotel offer was amongst the most efficient service we have experienced. The views from the hotel are amazing and the hotel felt very relaxed and quiet most of the time that we were there. In fact it transpired that it was full when we stayed! We did want for one thing during our stay - a swimming pool. But then you simply can't have everything and the standards exhibited everywhere meant we forgot about the pool very quickly. We would stay at the hotel again without hesitation and would be genuinely excited about the prospect.

Fantastic city/business hotel, spacious, well-designed rooms, great food (you know you are in for a good pizza even as far away as Tokyo when the cook speaks fluent Italian), very attentive service, amazing views over the city, gorgeous public spaces, also incredible value relative to what you get at a similar rate in say, London or New York. Absolutely faultless.

I almost cried when leaving the MO after a 7 night stay. We spent our honeymoon here with another 4 nights in a 5 star private chalet in Hakuba. I have to say that I preferred my stay at the MO compared to the chalet purely because of the attention to details and service we received during our stay.In fact, upon arriving to Hakuba I wished I was still at the MO.Upon our arrival at MO, they sent up champagne and desserts as congratulations on our wedding. That night we had reserved the tapas molecular bar for dinner where they knew our names and had arranged a special gift - also as congratulations. These were the first two gifts in a total of 6 that we received from the staff. Nothing was too much trouble. Nearly everything is anticipated and just as you think you need something you realise they have already brought it.Every restaurant knew our names as we arrived.We booked massages (best we have ever had!!!) and were then given a HUGE platter of fruit to enjoy as a couple (another congratulations gift).The rooms are incredible, the views amazing. Beds incredibly comfortable.Worth every $.I will always stay here every time we visit Tokyo.A very sincere thank you to all the staff at MO for your service and for providing such an amazing stay.

As other reviewers have said the staff at the MOTYO are fabulous, they anticipate your needs, always smiling with a can do attitude. The hotel is exceptionally well maintained, nothing out of place. However two issues: 1. The rooms are not well insulated against noise; we could hear the guests in the room above walking around loud enough to wake us. 2. My major complaint with all high end hotels is charging for Wi-Fi, I find this insulting when paying $600 + per night USD, if the MOTYO does not have enough margin to include gratis Wi-Fi add $20 to make the total rate $620 USD. Other than my two issues I think the MOTYO is an exceptional hotel and would stay again here again, hopefully the noise issue was an exception and not the norm.

We stayed here in August 2013 for 2 weeks and it is one of the best hotels I have ever been to. From the very moment we arrived we were looked after and Japanese service is truly the finest in the world. We were taken straight to our room to check in and throughout our stay nothing was too much trouble. Our room was large with fantastic views, the bed was incredibly comfortable, bathroom was large with lovely toiletries. There was plenty of storage space and a little cupboard where the newspaper and laundry were delivered. We had free wifi but I think it depends on your room package.All staff were amazingly hospitable but the concierge staff were especially helpful, in particular Setsu made sure our trip to Japan was perfect and arranged our day trips, suggested wonderful restaurants and was so kind. We took the bullet train to Kyoto and when we were waiting at the train station she left messages on our mobile to say that the train had been delayed and to check that we were ok. The food in the hotel was excellent, afternoon tea was lovely - I would suggest booking ahead and requesting a window table. Breakfast had a lovely selection every morning & again the staff were wonderfulDinner and room service were very good and I would recommend popping down to the shop to get some lovely cakes and buy some of the delicious mandarin oriental blend of tea to take home with you!I used the spa facility one - it's quite expensive but I believe free before 9am and very relaxingThe only negative point is that in the evening the bar in incredibly smoky and coming from the UK where we're now used to smoke free bars it was quite unpleasant but this is very common in Japan & when we visited the Hyatt for steaks (highly recommended) it was just as smoky.Overall I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat.

I stayed here for a week and loved it. Tokyo is a hospitable and cultural country. The neighborhood is generally nice and quiet with some dining options and quick eats at night. I stayed at 5-star hotel and everything's very amazing. The staff is decent (ford Japanese standards) but does their job. The free washing/drying machine is also a huge plus for travelers.I requested a nonsmoking, high-floored room with Skytree view, and my requests were granted. My room was on the 13th floor with excellent view of Skytree. The room is very new and pretty spacious for a Japanese semi-double business hotel room; it even has a small couch! As with most Japanese hotels, it's very clean. Bathroom was kind of small but very clean as well. The only complaint one might have is the noise from the subway/train stations, since they are right next to the hotel, but since I are pretty much knocked out every night, it wasn't a problem for us. Over all, this hotel exceeded my expectations and I will definitely stay here again!The Mandarin Oriental is one of those magical places that seem to be from another era - its service, its location, its accommodation, its food. Overall an experience that you must have once in your lifetime if you can.

A 7 day stay in the hotel in the corner room. A very good experience in general - nice food (but expensive if compared with the rest of the city), clean rooms, good service (they monitor when you get out of the room to do the cleaning, not always the case even in the 5* hotels) and pleasant staff. The views are breathtaking, and the hotel is spotless clean, as is the whole city of Tokyo! Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the centre of Tokyo - the Tokyo rail station is 10min by foot or 5min by taxi, very convenient. The hotel itself is located on a 'smaller' station (all central metro stations in Tokyo have at least 4 exits and are huge!) so you get into the metro directly from the hotel's door. Points to work on: - when checking in no refreshments were offered - there is no pool and the spa is accessible for a supplementary charge

If servile staff are your definition of a good hotel then you’ll like this place, where everybody bows and scrapes as if you are royalty, but personally I find such fake sentiments off-putting and prefer a more genuine experience. The hotel is OK but nothing special.
user_name:
jsonholiday
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The service is absolutely outstanding. Every staff member I dealt with was attentive, professional, courteous and made the stay an absolute pleasure. The hotel facilities are on par with the service. Rooms are a good size, with everything you need to make your stay comfortable. Food was excellent - the breakfast is everything you could hope for, as was the room service menu sampled.Having stayed at competing hotels previously in Tokyo (and frankly considered them unbeatable) I did not anticipate being as impressed as I was. Excellent on every measure.

Service is incredible at this hotel - this is my third stay so I am now familiar with their style. I honestly do not know how they train their staff to attain this level of consistent efficiency. They were virtually flawless for the 8 days of my stay.The Chief Concierge, Ms Tajima, thoroughly assisted me with my numerous requests even though both my personal assistant (who also stayed here) and I noticed that the Concierge team is at present short-staffed - they really need more staff - the whole team remained totally professional - all reservations, follow-ups, mailing and receiving items on my behalf, etc., were done to perfection. Hospitality is usually very good in Japan, but this Concierge team is truly outstanding.Our buffet breakfasts for the entire stay were made very pleasant by the presence of Mr Niccolo Brachelente, the K'shiki Restaurant Breakfast Manager. I stay at hotels for 6 months every year, and very, very seldom have I seen any manager more capable and willing to be "hands on" than this gentleman (and I do mean gentleman). His anticipation of client needs is astonishing and his time management skills are superb - I never had to ask for a second or even a third coffee, these arrived just as I was about to order them.Housekeeping staff are un-intrusive and really quick. I was working in the room on one occasion during their service and I hardly noticed their presence. They almost made no noise but my room was clean and smelt really fresh when they left.The Spa is excellent. The Spa Manageress, who had served me at the Mandarin Oriental in London, moved to Tokyo 2 years ago to head up operations and it is really important (to me anyway), to have at least one staff member there who speaks great English. The vitality pool is just as I remembered it - the water just at the right temperature and the views of Tokyo city spectacular from the pool.In-room-dining always manages to be quick and the quality of food is good - there were no mistakes made and nothing (including utensils) was ever missing.Shower pressure was good and the bath-tub is deep enough. Bathroom amenities are quite good quality. Pillows are a bit too soft for my liking but the doona was lovely. Air-conditioning controls worked well and are quite fast in changing room temperature (nice surprise).The location is nice as Nihonbashi is away from the busy shops at Ginza, but very close to Mitsukoshi Department store (the main branch) and this is accessible from walkways underground - an important point when it is raining or snowing.It was a very pleasant stay as I feel that I can trust the staff with just about anything.

Before my stay at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo, I already had extremely high expectations. The MO properties I have stayed at in New York, Las Vegas and Shanghai were all world class experiences that left me with great memories and the highest respect to the brand. Before carefully choosing my hotel in Tokyo, I found the MO to be the most attractive of all Tokyo's luxury hotels. In overall design, location, reputation.. etc. First of all, the location is pretty convenient, about 10 minutes walk from Tokyo Station. If you come from Narita Airport by train it’s very handy, as well if you want to use the metro system which is very good in Tokyo. There’s plenty of great restaurants to eat around and Ginza is only about 20 minutes walk.The overall design of the hotel is fabulous! Elegant, classy and extremely well designed. I stayed in a deluxe room which was on the 32nd floor and had amazing views of the city and the Tokyo Skytree. The room was minimalistic and nicely designed. The bed was very comfortable, and they had one of the best pillows i’ve slept on in any hotel. Great bathroom amenities as you'd expect from any luxury hotel, and a good selection of complimentary in room tea.All the hotel areas are well maintained and beautiful to look at. From the lobby, to the bar downstairs to the spa.. The hotel has no pool, but has water facilities that can be used free of charge during the morning hours. The water facilities were satisfying, very clean and of the highest quality. There’s room for improvement in the service, after a few initial hiccups. But the final response was truly genuine and of world class attention and care. I would say it feels a little more business oriented than other MO hotels, but that was to be expected considering the location. It is still a beautiful hotel nonetheless and truly a luxury hotel by all means. I’m looking forward to go back to MO Tokyo, next time I visit this amazing city.

It is really the perfect hotel. Amazing service and attention to every single detail, made my stay at the Madarin simply perfect. I stayed there for 7 nights as part of a business trip which included Beijing, Shanghai, Seoul and Tokyo, everywhere in high level hotels, but in some point is not about having dozens of persons attending the guest, but just about the way it is being done.Summarizing1. Great room in terms of size, view, distribution, ammenities, and sleep quality2. Clean, very clean3. Good location, and directly connected to a subway station and a fantastic department store (recommend the food-shop of the department store, on the basement)4. Great staff and very good service5. Good room service. Since given time difference, in the evening (Japan Time) my team in London was working, some nights I needed to stay at the hotel working, ordered room servivce, and it was good in terms of quality and speed.6. very fast and efficient check in and check out processSimply fully recommended !!!!!!!!!!!

Luxury all the way.My wife and I stayed in a corner suite on the 35th floor and loved it. Huge and well-appointed suite with 3 flat screen TVs - and every luxury. The property is about 8 years old and occupies the top 7 or 8 floors on an office building. One enters at ground level for a zippy elevator ride to the 38th floor - the lobby floor. Then, one changes elevator banks to the hotel's room and suite floors. A card system ensures that only guests get to the actual rooms.On the food front, the breakfast buffet was amazing. Many, many fine choices.We ate two dinners at Sense, the Chinese restaurant within the hotel. Great food and oh so convenient in a snow storm.Mr. Takeshi "Tak" Takeichi, the front office manager and his stellar crew went out of their way to make us feel at home, over and over again. "Tak" leads a strong staff - committed to service. His concierge helped with quality restaurant recs in the area and provided needed info on travel.Overall, I cannot say enough nice things about this luxury property. It is the place to stay in Tokyo. My only sadness is that we stayed only four days.

What can one say? It is the Mandarin Oriental in all it does. From the delightfully understated elegant lobby, to the sumptous rooms, to the myriad little touches, to the outstanding food, to the widest view in town. I could go on, but you have the idea!

Ok...there was no swimming pool. If I must name a negative thing about this hotel, this may be it. But we do not use the pool so it really does not matter at all.We stayed 4 nights in a Mandarin Grand Room. The room was spacious with a high ceiling. We could see Mt. Fuji on a clear day. There was a bathtub with a separate shower. In addition to the bath salt in the standard amenities, bath oil was also provided at daily turndown. Internet was available at a charge.Location was good with the Mitsukoshimae station right under the hotel. A short walk to the nearby Mitsukoshi Department Store. Dining at the hotel was wonderful. We tried Signature, the french restaurant in the past and we found it very good. This time we had dinner at the Tapas Molecular Bar as well as Sushi Sora. We enjoyed both very much as well. Having afternoon tea at the Oriental Lounge while watching the snow falling over the city was a very relaxing way to spend an hour or two. We had treatments at the Oriental Spa twice, once in a spa suite with additional cost. The spa suite featured a nice view of the city and there was no window inside a regular treatment room. The heat experience at the Spa was not to be missed. We love watching the sunset at the vitality pool.Talking about the service, it was indeed top notch. From the bell service at the door to the front desk clerk and the concierge, everyone was there to make sure we were enjoying our stay with them. Service at the restaurants was equally impressive. At breakfast, we told the manager the egg white of the hard boiled eggs was a little too hard. When we arrived the next morning, he informed us right away he had already instructed the chef to cook our eggs 2 minutes less and the outcome was just perfect. We highly recommend this hotel and we will stay again next time to Tokyo.

The best service a luxury hotel can give. Starting from arrival,the concierge at the door,the reception, the duty manager, the concierge, the waiters and chefs, the houskeeping all of them were very polite and corteous. The room view is amazing. The room is very spacious and can fit another king size bed. The toilet fitted with a bath a tv and shower with all the things you require. The room and toilet is very clean. The sushi bar is excellent. In short what you see in the website is true and very much more. Mandarin oriental, very well done!

The good- Excellent service throughout with staff speaking good English.- nicely done rooms with spectacular views.- great spa. - good choice of restaurants.- lobby well decorated. The less good- location (metro downstairs but a bit far)- a bit too corporate like. - breakfast buffet needs to be needed up.

We have just stayed in this MO during this weekends. I can't wait to write my review when I'm now in the Narita Airport Terminal 2 on my way to Hong Kong.We have been allocated to the room 3007 according to our reservation. Upon arrival in the morning, we were warmly greeted by the Concierge, front desk staff in the 38th floor. The experience was amazing and wonderful! Everything is over my expectation. The staff can easily remember your name and greeted you once they saw you or when they were available. (As you know, everybody are working very wholeheartedly. Most importantly, they also expected their own high performance towards their customers!) Room, breakfast, gym area is great!

The Mandarin Oriental comes at a steep price, but has something to offer in return. The hotel is located a bit off the center of Ginza street, but is well connected. You can directly walk in the basement of the hotel to the metro. It is also right next to a large department store that offers a great selection (Mitsukoshi). Since the rooms are located in the top of the high rise you have an amazing view of Tokyo. The size and the arrangement of the room was unusually large for Tokyo. One minus is that there is very little cupboard or drawer space to unpack. The service was excellent from check in to check out. The breakfast buffet was also quite impressive with a great selection. The hotel does not offer a pool! It offers a Jacuzzi type of hot bath and sauna. The male area is completely separated from the female area and there are no mixed areas. Overall I would recommend the hotel, we had a great and convenient stay there.

We arrived at MOTYO for our first trip to Japan based on a recommendation from a good friend. Travelling with two children (one 8 years and one 7 months old) in a big city and with a healthy dose of jet lag in the bag we tend to spend more time at the hotel than we would otherwise do. The experience of MOTYO starts with the reception at the 38th floor. It has two stories of floor to ceiling windows to the side facing mount Fuji and one story of floor to ceiling windows facing Akihabara and the Tokyo tv tower. Arriving on sunny day we were simply awestruck by the views. At the same time the reception area seems small and cosy and the staff is so welcoming and kind. This “homely feeling factor” of MOTYO is a great thing. Even if the hotel has many guests spread over many floors, you get the feeling that this is not a big hotel and that staff invests time in getting to know you and your preferences – and your grievances too. You feel like more than a customer. You feel like an old friend of the house. Maybe in a place like Tokyo, which can seem confusing at times, this is even more important than in our traditional go to cities in Europe or the US.Concierge services at MOTYO is second to none. And what is great is that they think ahead. If you cannot get what you want they will suggest something else and make the necessary bookings for you in advance. And there seems to be no end to what they will do for you. For instance, they went to Tokyo Station for us and picked up our JR passes for the Shinkansen and made a number of alternative seat reservations for us so we had something to choose from (important because of the holiday season). When one restaurant did not accept children under 10, they made bookings at another place with similar menu and distance to the hotel so that we had a booking option when we got back from touring the city. We stayed on the Mount Fuji side and had fantastic views. The floor to ceiling windows with unobstructed views are a stroke of genius. Suddenly even our infant could see the skyscrapers, Mount Fuji and the traffic all for herself. You can literally sit around all day and look at the mountain in the sunshine and never tire of the view. We stayed in a premier grand room and in a corner suite. The room was spacious and worked fine for a family of 4. The suite with views to the harbor and Mount Fuji was fantastic. MOTYO is located in Nihonbashi with all the old craft shops and is very close to Tokyo train station and the shopping in Ginza. We found this location suited us fine as we were traveling to Kyoto during our stay and we liked the area in general. If you prefer Shibuya or Shinjuku in the “other end” of central Tokyo then MOTYO’s location may not suit you. Note that taxis are relatively cheap and it is easy to get around, so I would not decide on a hotel in Tokyo based on location alone.Issues that may indicate MOTYO does not entirely deserve the five stars:- There is no in room entertainment system. A high end hotel must have a up to date system and up to date flat screens. We may not use it much, but it just needs to be there. - Cleaning was surprisingly so so a couple of times. But the hotel made sure to make up for that plentiful.- Key card functionality - especially in the elevator - is not bullet proof. Same goes for the elevator’s automated voice which insists you are not allowed to get off on the floor you stay!- Spa and the small pools are not open to children. Why not? The pool is open to kids at the Park Hyatt and at the Ritz Carlton. You can see that in the rules but it could be more clearly stated on the web. We actually tend to decide on hotels with pools when travelling with the children in big cities because it is a great way to create a balance between sightseeing and pure relaxation for the kids.Why then do I give it 5 stars? Because perfection is not realistic. And therefore it is the nature of and the way that a hotel deals with imperfections that becomes crucial. MOTYO dealt with every grievance we had in a very professional and forthcoming manner. And in the end it all comes Down to the fact that I just know that we will be back in Tokyo and that we will stay at MOTYO.

This is one of the best hotels in the world .The building is modern , the lobby on 38 th floor has pleasant view.Placed is a very good area , close to Guiza and good restaurants , by the way the chinese restaurant in the hotel is really good .Rooms confortable , excelent breakfast , but the high light is the staff , helpfull , polite .The concierge specially Ms Masumi Tajima , can do for you more than you expect .I asked her to help me to buy my ticket by train to Kioto , when i got my tickets , she add, the more interesting places to be visited, and the city's new paper with evething about the Kyoto .Madarin is more than confortable , is a nice experience , everything is perfect !

Perhaps it was the flight to Tokyo from Shanghai on ANA airways which was probably the best short haul business class I have ever been on, or perhaps the fantastic view of Mount Fuji as we flew into to land but this stop over on our China / Japan trip promised to be exceptional.And it was, first we were greeted by a absolutely charming lady from the hotel who introduced us to our driver who took us on a most comfortable trip on the excellent roads to the hotel. Arriving at the private entrance to the hotel we took the elevator to the lobby which surprisingly is on the top floor of the hotel. Check in was a pleasure with all the staff being most attentive and extremely polite. We were then shown to our room (which was on a lower floor of course which again was a strange experience) by two beautiful and totally professional ladies who took delight in showing us the gorgeous room we had. The view from the window of Mount Fuji was spectacular as was the room itself with all the luxurious appointments possible.I must mention the work that the two lady concierge did for us. Despite I am sure many tedious E-mails I sent trying to micromanage our stay they achieved every task we set them and all with a smile and a polite bow!Breakfast and dinner at the hotel were great and we delighted in drinking the "Moscow Mule" pre-dinner cocktails at a table which seemed perched in space above the lights of Tokyo.There are so many great things to say about this hotel I could go on and on even more than I have all I can say is if you visit Tokyo and you don't experience the Mandarin Oriental you will have missed one of life's greatest pleasures.Can't wait to go back.

Well, I almost had to re mortgage the house to afford this place, but it was worth every penny, great stay in a really impressive building, would go back again and would recommend to friends and anybody else, including random strangers on tripadvisor
user_name:
caz w
North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: On a recommendation of a friend who stays at the Mandarin Tokyo whenever she is in the city for business, I decided to give it a whirl. What a great choice, and what an amazing experience. When you book a stay at the Mandarin Tokyo, be prepared to be pampered and coddled. You will feel like an orphaned child suddenly engulfed with the love of Angelina Jolie.First impressions:The taxi ride from the Tokyo Station was short. Upon arrival at the hotel, the bellboy will get your suitcases and show us to the lift lobby. The lobby is not on the ground floor but 38th floor so it has great views of Tokyo. Check-in was smooth and quick; we were of course shown to our rooms and had everything explained to us. Room:Spacious, tastefully designed, modern, clean. I love it. Plenty of space to chill out on the sofa and desk. Great views of the city.Bathroom:Good layout. Not as spacious as I would like, but very tastefully designed. All the luxury amenities are there.Service: This is where the Mandarin stands out, heads and shoulders above the rest. All the staff in the hotel seem to have a sixth sense to read your mind. Or maybe they just have a very good walkie talkie system. Anyway, they somehow knew when I was heading to the gym, and when I was done with my workout! Or just before I went out for a run around the Imperial Palace, they handed me a running map, and upon my return they had a towel and a fruit juice ready for me. A little uncanny, but you feel the love big-time here. We also made a few dinner reservations through the concierge prior to our stay and it all went smoothly despite a long waiting list at these restaurants: Jiro Sushi, Ryugin, etc. They even print you a map of the restaurant, how to get there, what you need to bring or do - how convenient!One afternoon we wanted to try a famous local soba restaurant just around the corner, and asked the concierge about it. She quickly called to make sure they were open (they weren't), and promptly suggested another place nearby which was probably even better! As usual she gave us the map and how to get there, and a little blurb about what to order. Location: The Imperial Palace is about a 5-minute walk away. Plenty of shops and restaurants around the Mandarin. Subway station also very close. It's definitely close to many of the skyscrapers so it will be used by many business travellers.In summary:You really can't go wrong with this hotel. It is expensive, yes, but it is a luxury hotel after all. The better question to ask is this: Can you get a better hotel at the same price? I highly doubt it.

I just visit MOTYO during new year eve, I stayed for 6 nights. I haven't been visited Tokyo for almost 10 year, so I planned my itinerary with the help of hotel concierge one month before arrival. The concierge is very helpful and made all the reservations for the restaurants, disney and tokyo sky tree. The hotel is in only two station away from Ginza area which is quite convenient. We enjoyed rooms and all of the facilities. The best part is that, one night after dinner, I came back to the hotel and was greeted by head of hotel butler (who happened to speak Thai - my language with me fluently - he was working with MO in Bangkok for more than 7 years). After a polite greeting, he asked that if I forget anything at the restuarant, at that moment I just realised that I forget my bag which carry all of my camera (it's quite an expensive camera) and personal belonging. I was shocked and was so happy that the restuarant was kind enough to ring back to the hotel and ask for me. The head butler (Mr. Takashi Kurono) immediately offer that he will ride on the taxi and go to retrieve the bag for me, it is very kind offer since my children was tried and need to go to the room. At last, I did get my bag within an hour. Mr. Takeshi refuses to take any tip, he only request for the taxi fees to be charge to the room. I can not thank you enough for his generous offer and services. I hope I will have a chance to visit Tokyo and stay at MOTYO again soon.

The whole experience was very pleasant right up from reservation to our last day..We stayed 4 nights. Service was very good. I sent an email to change my date of stay and the reply came very promptly and it was the same when I requested for adjoining rooms and no smoking rooms. We arrived on an early morning flight and requested to check in early. All was arranged and we were able to settle down very quickly. Staff during check in were most efficient especially Ms Satomi.You must try the breakfast served at the K'shiki restaurant. All the staff especially the manager gave such good service. On my last day we had a lot of packing to do due to the shopping that we did.They were helpful and provided us with boxes and strings and tapes.The view form the 38 th floor is awesome. We had some good weather and you can see Mount Fuji on one side and the Skytree on the other. The rooms are spacious and luxurious.On the lower ground floor you can access the Ginza metro line and also there is the Mitsukoshi Department store. The Food Hall here is wonderful. You just want to eat everything there. One shortfall is the location as the Ginza line is not a major line and does not go to tokyo station which is a main station. However you can get to shibuya as it is the last stop on the Ginza line. And also Asakusa stop (Sensoji Temple) using the Ginza line.Definitely our top choice for our next visit even though we were a little surprise there is no swimming pool.

Mandarim Oriental is a wonderful hotel located in Tokyo, Japan. The hotel structure is really beautiful and the interior is amazing.
